name: abortion
trans: n. 流产，堕胎，小产；流产的胎儿；（计划等）失败，夭折

sentences.english: She decided to have an abortion .
sentences.chinese: 她决定做人工流产。

sentences.english: anti-abortion campaigners
sentences.chinese: 参与反堕胎运动的人

detailed_translations.english: a medical operation to end a  pregnancy  so that the baby is not born alive

name: absence
trans: n. 没有；缺乏；缺席；不注意

sentences.english: In the absence of any evidence, the police had to let Myers go.
sentences.chinese: 警察没有证据，只好把迈尔斯放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席， 不在； 缺席的时间， 外出期； 缺乏， 不存在
detailed_translations.english: when you are not in the place where people expect you to be, or the time that you are away

name: absent
trans: adj. 缺席的；缺少的；心不在焉的；茫然的

sentences.english: The dull, absent look on her face implied boredom.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上呆滞、茫然的神情说明她觉得无聊了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席的；缺少的；心不在焉的；茫然的
detailed_translations.english: not at work, school, a meeting etc, because you are sick or decide not to go
to not go to a place or take part in an event where people expect you to be

name: absurd
trans: n. 荒诞；荒诞作品

sentences.english: It seems an absurd idea.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or unreasonable

name: abundance
trans: n. 充裕，丰富

sentences.english: an abundance of wavy red hair
sentences.chinese: 浓密的红色鬈发

sentences.english: One quality the team possessed in abundance was fighting spirit.
sentences.chinese: 该队的一大特点是斗志昂扬。

detailed_translations.english: a large quantity of something

name: abuse
trans: n. 滥用；虐待；辱骂；弊端；恶习，陋习

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

name: academy
trans: n. 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校

sentences.english: the American Academy of Arts and Letters
sentences.chinese: 美国艺术和文学学会

detailed_translations.chinese: 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校
detailed_translations.english: an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc

name: accelerate
trans: vt. 使……加快；使……增速

sentences.english: measures to accelerate the rate of economic growth
sentences.chinese: 加快经济增长速度的措施

detailed_translations.english: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect

name: acceptance
trans: n. 接纳；赞同；容忍

sentences.english: He wrote a letter of acceptance (=  a letter in which you agree to accept a job, university place etc  ) to the university.
sentences.chinese: 他给那所大学写了一封接受函。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接受， 承认； 容忍
detailed_translations.english: when you officially agree to take something that you have been offered

name: accessible
trans: adj. 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

name: accomplishment
trans: n. 成就；完成；技艺，技能

sentences.english: It was a major accomplishment for a player who had been injured so recently.
sentences.chinese: 对于一个刚受过伤的选手来说，这是很好的成绩。

detailed_translations.english: something successful or impressive that is achieved after a lot of effort and hard work

name: accordance
trans: n. 一致；和谐

sentences.english: I am in accordance with him in this matter.
sentences.chinese: 在这件事情上我同他是一致的。

sentences.english: We assure you that the quality of our goods will be in accordance with that of the samples.
sentences.chinese: 我们向你方保证，我们货物的质量一定与样品的质量一致。

sentences.english: If your pursuit of personal career and ideal are in accordance with ours, if you are seeking for the pleasure from sharing the same ambitions, please join us!
sentences.chinese: 如果您想谋求个人事业、理想与公司的事业和理想高度一致，如果您追求的是志同道合的工作愉悦，请加入我们！

name: accordingly
trans: adv. 因此，于是；相应地；照著

sentences.english: We have to discover his plans and act accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 我们得找出他的计划，照着办。

sentences.english: Some of the laws were contradictory. Accordingly, measures were taken to clarify them.
sentences.chinese: 有些法律相互矛盾，因此，采取了措施将其阐明。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is appropriate to what has been done or said in a particular situation

name: accountability
trans: n. 有义务；有责任；可说明性

sentences.english: View your job, and her job, as a shared accountability.
sentences.chinese: 把你和她的工作看做是一种联合责任。

sentences.english: But you must balance that need with the need for accountability.
sentences.chinese: 但是你必须在个人需求和责任感两方面做出平衡。

sentences.english: Some of us have trouble with accountability because we associate the word with punishment, scrutiny, and/or not meeting standards or agreements.
sentences.chinese: 好些人都把责任理解错误了，因为我们总是把责任和惩罚，仔细检查或者没有达到标准或不一致性联系在一起。

name: accountable
trans: adj. 有责任的；有解释义务的；可解释的

sentences.english: The hospital should be held accountable for the quality of care it gives.
sentences.chinese: 医院应当对医护质量负责。

detailed_translations.english: responsible for the effects of your actions and willing to explain or be criticized for them

name: accumulate
trans: vt. 积攒

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

name: accumulation
trans: n. 积聚，累积；堆积物

sentences.english: ...an accumulation of experience and knowledge.
sentences.chinese: …经验和知识的一种积累。

detailed_translations.english: An accumulation of something is a large number of things that have been collected together or acquired over a period of time

name: accusation
trans: n. 控告，指控；谴责

sentences.english: The main accusation levelled against him was that he tried to avoid military service.
sentences.chinese: 对他提出的主要指控是他想逃避兵役。

sentences.english: Burton’s enemies had made false accusations against him.
sentences.chinese: 伯顿的敌人对他提出不实的指责。

sentences.english: She’s made all sorts of wild accusations against me in the past.
sentences.chinese: 她过去对我妄加指责，说了种种不是。

sentences.english: They fled the country, amid accusations of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 在一片贪污腐败的指责声中，他们逃离了该国。

detailed_translations.english: a statement saying that someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something wrong

name: accused
trans: n. 被告

name: acid
trans: n. 酸；<俚>迷幻药

sentences.english: sulphuric acid
sentences.chinese: 硫酸

sentences.english: a juicy apple with a slightly acid flavour
sentences.chinese: 一个多汁、略带酸味的苹果

sentences.english: I was expecting another of his acid remarks, but he remained silent.
sentences.chinese: 我等着他再说一句刻薄的话，但他不吭声了。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that has a  pH  of less than 7. Strong acids can burn holes in material or damage your skin
having a sharp sour taste

name: acquisition
trans: n. 获得物，获得；收购

sentences.english: the acquisition of language
sentences.chinese: 语言的习得

detailed_translations.english: the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill

name: acre
trans: n. 土地，地产；英亩

sentences.english: They own 200 acres of farmland.
sentences.chinese: 他们拥有200英亩农田。

sentences.english: a 200-acre wood
sentences.chinese: 一片200英亩的林地

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring area, equal to 4,840 square yards or 4,047 square metres

name: activation
trans: n. [电子][物] 激活；活化作用

name: activist
trans: n. 积极分子；激进主义分子

sentences.english: The police say they suspect the attack was carried out by animal rights activists.
sentences.chinese: 警方说他们怀疑这次袭击是由保护动物权利的激进分子实施的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 积极分子；激进主义分子
detailed_translations.english: someone who works hard doing practical things to achieve social or political change

name: acute
trans: adj. 严重的，[医] 急性的；敏锐的；激烈的；尖声的

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

name: adaptation
trans: n. 适应；改编；改编本，改写本

sentences.english: Branagh won two awards for his screen adaptation of Shakespeare's Henry the Fifth.
sentences.chinese: 布拉纳因他对莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的荧幕改编而获了两次奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 适应；改编；改编本，改写本
detailed_translations.english: a film or television programme that is based on a book or play

name: adhere
trans: vi. 坚持；依附；粘着；追随

sentences.english: Small particles adhere to the seed.
sentences.chinese: 微小的粒子紧贴着种子。

sentences.english: We adhere to the principles of equal rights and freedom of expression for all.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚持人人平等和言论自由的原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stick firmly to something

name: adjacent
trans: adj. 邻近的，毗连的

sentences.english: We stayed in adjacent rooms.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在毗连的房间里。

sentences.english: the building adjacent to the library
sentences.chinese: 紧挨着图书馆的建筑

detailed_translations.english: (of an area, a building, a room, etc.) next to or near sth

name: adjustment
trans: n. 调整，调节；调节器

sentences.english: a period of adjustment
sentences.chinese: 一段调整期

detailed_translations.english: a small change made to a machine, system, or calculation

name: administer
trans: vt. 管理；执行；给予

sentences.english: The money will be administered by local charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔资金将由当地慈善机构管理。

sentences.english: Our office administers the affairs of the Society.
sentences.chinese: 我们办公室管理协会的事务。

detailed_translations.english: to manage the work or money of a company or organization

name: administrative
trans: adj. 管理的，行政的

sentences.english: The job is mainly administrative.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作主要是行政方面的。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the work of managing a company or organization

name: administrator
trans: n. 管理人；行政官

sentences.english: On Friday the company's administrators sought permission from a Melbourne court to keep operating.
sentences.chinese: 在星期五，该公司的管理人员们从一家墨尔本法院取得了继续经营的许可。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job involves managing the work of a company or organization

name: admission
trans: n. 承认；入场费；进入许可；坦白；录用

sentences.english: Reese, by his own admission , lacks the necessary experience.
sentences.chinese: 里斯自己也承认缺乏必要的经验。

sentences.english: No admission after 10 pm.
sentences.chinese: 晚上10点以后免进。

sentences.english: The Museum has no admission charge .
sentences.chinese: 那家博物馆不收门票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；准许进(加)入；入场费
detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong

name: adolescent
trans: n. 青少年

sentences.english: It is important that an adolescent boy should have an adult in whom he can confide.
sentences.chinese: 一个青春期男孩应该有一个他能倾吐心声的成年人，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 青春期的； 青少年的
detailed_translations.english: Adolescent is used to describe young people who are no longer children but who have not yet become adults. It also refers to their behaviour.
a young person, usually between the ages of 12 and 18, who is developing into an adult

name: adoption
trans: n. 采用；收养；接受

sentences.english: She decided to put the baby up for adoption .
sentences.chinese: 她决定让人收养那个婴儿。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of adopting a child

name: adverse
trans: adj. 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）

sentences.english: They fear it could have an adverse effect on global financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心这会对全球金融市场产生不利影响。

sentences.english: Miller’s campaign has received a good deal of adverse publicity .
sentences.chinese: 米勒的竞选活动招来许多负面报道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）
detailed_translations.english: not good or favourable

name: advocate
trans: n. 提倡者；支持者；律师

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: aesthetic
trans: adj. 美的；美学的；审美的，具有审美趣味的

sentences.english: From an esthetic point of view, it’s a nice design.
sentences.chinese: 从美学角度看，这是个不错的设计。

sentences.english: a work of great aesthetic appeal
sentences.chinese: 极富美之神韵的作品

detailed_translations.english: connected with beauty and the study of beauty

name: affection
trans: n. 喜爱，感情；影响；感染

sentences.english: She looked back on those days with affection .
sentences.chinese: 她深情地回顾那些日子。

sentences.english: Their father never showed them much affection .
sentences.chinese: 他们的父亲对他们从来没有表现出多少慈爱。

sentences.english: Anne had two men trying to win her affections.
sentences.chinese: 安妮有两个男人追求。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of liking or loving sb/sth very much and caring about them

name: aftermath
trans: n. 后果；余波

sentences.english: In the aftermath of the coup, the troops opened fire on the demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 在那次政变的余波之中，军队向示威者开了枪。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time after something such as a war, storm, or accident when people are still dealing with the results

name: aggression
trans: n. 侵略；进攻；侵犯；侵害

sentences.english: an unprovoked act of aggression
sentences.chinese: 无端的侵犯

detailed_translations.english: the act of attacking a country, especially when that country has not attacked first

name: agricultural
trans: adj. 农业的；农艺的

sentences.english: Farmers struggling for survival strip the forests for agricultural land.
sentences.chinese: 为生存而挣扎的农民们把森林伐光来作农业用地。

detailed_translations.english: Agricultural means involving or relating to agriculture

name: aide
trans: n. 助手；副官；侍从武官

sentences.english: a presidential aide
sentences.chinese: 一位总统助理

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to help someone who has an important job, especially a politician

name: albeit
trans: conj. 虽然；即使

sentences.english: He accepted the job, albeit with some hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 尽管有些犹豫，他还是接受了那份工作。

sentences.english: Chris went with her, albeit reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 尽管勉强，克里斯还是同她一起去了。

detailed_translations.english: used to add information that reduces the force or importance of what you have just said

name: alert
trans: n. 警戒，警惕；警报

sentences.english: The animal raised its head, suddenly alert.
sentences.chinese: 那只动物突然警觉地抬起头来。

sentences.english: Taking notes is one of the best ways to stay alert in lectures.
sentences.chinese: 记笔记是听课时集中注意力的最佳方法之一。

detailed_translations.english: giving all your attention to what is happening, being said etc
to make someone realize something important or dangerous

detailed_translations.chinese: 警戒， 戒备； 警报
detailed_translations.english: a warning to be ready for possible danger

name: alien
trans: n. 外国人，外侨；外星人

sentences.english: alien cultures
sentences.chinese: 异域文化

sentences.english: an alien multiracial society
sentences.chinese: 一个多种族的异国社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to another country or race
someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in

name: align
trans: vt. 使结盟；使成一行；匹配

sentences.english: The desks were neatly aligned in rows.
sentences.chinese: 书桌一行行排得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: Make sure that all the holes align.
sentences.chinese: 确保所有的洞眼成一条直线。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things so that they form a line or are parallel to each other, or to be in a position that forms a line etc

name: alignment
trans: n. 队列，成直线；校准；结盟

sentences.english: The church should have no political alignment.
sentences.chinese: 教会不应该有政治结盟。

detailed_translations.english: support given by one country or group to another in politics, defence etc

name: alike
trans: adj. 相似的；相同的

sentences.english: My mother and I are alike in many ways.
sentences.chinese: 我和母亲在许多方面很相似。

detailed_translations.english: very similar
used to emphasize that you mean both the people, groups, or things that you have just mentioned

name: allegation
trans: n. 指控; 陈述，主张; 宣称; 陈词，陈述;

name: allege
trans: vt. 宣称，断言；提出…作为理由

sentences.english: She alleged that there was rampant drug use among the male members of the group.
sentences.chinese: 她指称该组织中有大量的男性成员吸毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断言， 宣称， 硬说
detailed_translations.english: to say that something is true or that someone has done something wrong, although it has not been proved

name: allegedly
trans: adv. 依其申述；据说，据称

sentences.english: a sports car, allegedly stolen in Manchester
sentences.chinese: 据说是在曼彻斯特被偷的一辆跑车

detailed_translations.english: used when reporting something that people say is true, although it has not been proved

name: alliance
trans: n. 联盟，联合；联姻

sentences.english: independent organizations and alliances
sentences.chinese: 独立组织和联盟

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which two or more countries, groups etc agree to work together to try to change or achieve something

name: allocate
trans: vt. 分配；拨出；使坐落于

sentences.english: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first.
sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分配； 分派， 把…拨给
detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

name: allocation
trans: n. 分配，配置；安置

sentences.english: Twelve hours a week seemed a generous allocation of your time.
sentences.chinese: 一周12个小时，这好像占用了你很多时间。

detailed_translations.english: the decision to allocate something, or the act of allocating it

name: allowance
trans: n. 津贴，零用钱；允许；限额

sentences.english: Sales staff get a generous mileage allowance or a company car.
sentences.chinese: 销售人员有优厚的里程补贴或者公司提供的专用汽车。

sentences.english: If you are entitled to sickness allowance, you must claim it from your employer.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有资格领取疾病津贴，必须向雇主申请索要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 津贴， 补贴； 零用钱
detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you are given regularly or for a special purpose

name: ally
trans: n. 同盟国；伙伴；同盟者；助手

sentences.english: a meeting of the European allies
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟国会议

sentences.english: He will have no choice but to ally himself with the new movement.
sentences.chinese: 他将别无选择，只能与这个新运动结盟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同盟国；伙伴；同盟者；助手
detailed_translations.english: a country that agrees to help or support another country in a war
If you ally yourself with someone or something, you give your support to them

name: aluminium
trans: n. 铝

sentences.english: If necessary, we can use aluminium instead of steel.
sentences.chinese: 如果必要，我们可用铝代钢。

detailed_translations.english: a silver-white metal that is very light and is used to make cans, cooking pans, window frames etc. It is a chemical  element  : symbol Al

name: amateur
trans: n. 爱好者；业余爱好者；外行

sentences.english: a gifted amateur
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的业余爱好者

sentences.english: Mickelson won his first major golf tournament while still an amateur.
sentences.chinese: 米克尔森还是业余选手时就赢得了他第一个高尔夫球锦标赛大奖。

sentences.english: ...professional athletes and amateur runners.
sentences.chinese: …专业运动员和业余赛跑运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱好者；业余爱好者；外行
detailed_translations.english: someone who does an activity just for pleasure, not as their job
Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job

name: ambassador
trans: n. 大使；代表；使节

sentences.english: the US ambassador to Spain
sentences.chinese: 美国驻西班牙大使

detailed_translations.english: an important official who represents his or her government in a foreign country

name: amend
trans: vt. 修改；改善，改进

sentences.english: The law was amended to include women.
sentences.chinese: 该法律经修改把女性也包括在内。

sentences.english: The defendant later amended his evidence.
sentences.chinese: 被告后来修改了证词。

sentences.english: ‘Steve stole it – or rather borrowed it,’ he amended.
sentences.chinese: “史蒂夫偷的——应该说是借的。”他改口道。

detailed_translations.english: to correct or make small changes to something that is written or spoken

name: amendment
trans: n. 修正案；改善；改正

sentences.english: constitutional amendments
sentences.chinese: 宪法修正案

detailed_translations.english: a small change, improvement, or addition that is made to a law or document, or the process of doing this

name: amid
trans: prep. 在其中，在其间

sentences.english: The dollar has fallen in value amid rumors of weakness in the US economy.
sentences.chinese: 在一片美国经济疲软的传言中，美元贬值了。

sentences.english: Demonstrators ripped up the national flag amid shouts of ‘Death to the tyrants!’
sentences.chinese: 示威者在“处死暴君！”的叫喊声中将国旗撕得粉碎。

detailed_translations.english: while noisy, busy, or confused events are happening – used in writing or news reports

name: analogy
trans: n. 类比；类推；类似

sentences.english: analogies between human and animal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 人类行为与动物行为的类同

sentences.english: She drew an analogy between childbirth and the creative process.
sentences.chinese: 她将分娩和创造过程进行类比。

detailed_translations.english: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

name: anchor
trans: n. 锚；抛锚停泊；靠山；新闻节目主播

sentences.english: We dropped anchor a few yards offshore.
sentences.chinese: 我们在离岸几码远的地方抛锚停航。

sentences.english: The next morning, they weighed anchor (=  lifted the anchor  ) and began to move south again.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上他们起锚，又开始向南航行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 锚；抛锚停泊；靠山；新闻节目主播
detailed_translations.english: a piece of heavy metal that is lowered to the bottom of the sea, a lake etc to prevent a ship or boat moving
to fasten something firmly so that it cannot move

name: angel
trans: n. 天使；守护神；善人

sentences.english: the angel Gabriel
sentences.chinese: 天使加百列

detailed_translations.english: a  spirit  who is God’s servant in heaven, and who is often shown as a person dressed in white with wings

name: anonymous
trans: adj. 匿名的，无名的；无个性特征的

sentences.english: the anonymous author of a collection of poems
sentences.chinese: 一本诗集的佚名作者

sentences.english: According to one employee, who wishes to remain anonymous , the company engaged in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 根据一位不愿透露姓名的员工所述，这家公司曾从事非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: unknown by name

name: apparatus
trans: n. 装置，设备；仪器；器官

sentences.english: Astronauts have special breathing apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 航天员有专门的呼吸装装备。

sentences.english: The tax will require a massive administrative apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 税收需要大规模的行政机构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械，器具，仪器；机构，组织
detailed_translations.english: the set of tools and machines that you use for a particular scientific, medical, or technical purpose

name: appealing
trans: v. 恳求（appeal的ing形式）；将…上诉

sentences.english: The city offers an appealing combination of sporting and cultural events.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市集体育活动和文化活动于一身，颇具吸引力。

sentences.english: It creates an atmosphere which visitors find so appealing .
sentences.chinese: 它创造了一种吸引游客的氛围。

detailed_translations.english: attractive or interesting

name: appetite
trans: n. 食欲；嗜好

sentences.english: Her husband always had a huge appetite.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫向来胃口极大。

sentences.english: Symptoms include tiredness and loss of appetite.
sentences.chinese: 症状包括疲倦和食欲不振。

detailed_translations.english: a desire for food

name: applaud
trans: vt. 赞同；称赞；向…喝彩

sentences.english: The audience applauded loudly.
sentences.chinese: 观众掌声雷动。

sentences.english: A crowd of 300 supporters warmly applauded her speech.
sentences.chinese: 300名支持者为她的演讲热烈鼓掌。

detailed_translations.english: to hit your open hands together, to show that you have enjoyed a play, concert, speaker etc
to express strong approval of an idea, plan etc

name: applicable
trans: adj. 可适用的；可应用的；合适的

sentences.english: What is a reasonable standard for one family is not applicable for another.
sentences.chinese: 对一个家庭合理的标准对于另一个家庭并不适用。

detailed_translations.english: if something is applicable to a particular person, group, or situation, it affects them or is related to them

name: appoint
trans: vt. 任命；指定；约定

sentences.english: officials appointed by the government
sentences.chinese: 政府任命的官员

sentences.english: The committee appointed a day in June for celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 委员会把庆典定在6月的一天举行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 任命，委派；约定，确定，指定
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for a position or a job

name: appreciation
trans: n. 欣赏，鉴别；增值；感谢

sentences.english: He was presented with a watch in appreciation of his long service.
sentences.chinese: 他获赠一块手表，作为对其长期服务的感谢。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being grateful for something someone has done

name: arbitrary
trans: adj. [数] 任意的；武断的；专制的

sentences.english: an arbitrary decision
sentences.chinese: 武断的决定

sentences.english: the arbitrary arrests of political opponents
sentences.chinese: 对政敌的任意逮捕

detailed_translations.english: decided or arranged without any reason or plan, often unfairly

name: architectural
trans: adj. 建筑学的；建筑上的；符合建筑法的

sentences.english: ...Tibet's architectural heritage.
sentences.chinese: …西藏的建筑遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑上的； 建筑学的
detailed_translations.english: Architectural means relating to the design and construction of buildings

name: archive
trans: n. 档案馆；档案文件

sentences.english: an archive of the writer’s unpublished work
sentences.chinese: 那位作家未发表作品的档案

detailed_translations.english: a place where a large number of historical records are stored, or the records that are stored
to put documents, books, information etc in an archive

name: arena
trans: n. 舞台；竞技场

sentences.english: a sports arena
sentences.chinese: 运动场

sentences.english: an indoor arena
sentences.chinese: 室内剧场

detailed_translations.english: a building with a large flat central area surrounded by seats, where sports or entertainments take place

name: arguably
trans: adv. 可论证地；可争辩地；正如可提出证据加以证明的那样地

name: arm
trans: n. 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门

sentences.english: Dave has a broken arm .
sentences.chinese: 戴夫手臂断了。

sentences.english: Tim’s mother put her arms around him.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆的母亲伸出双臂搂着他。

sentences.english: Pat was carrying a box under his arm .
sentences.chinese: 帕特腋下挟着一个盒子。

sentences.english: He had a pile of books in his arms .
sentences.chinese: 他抱着一摞书。

sentences.english: They walked along the beach arm in arm (=  with their arms bent around each other’s  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们臂挽臂走在沙滩上。

sentences.english: The old lady rushed to greet him, arms outstretched .
sentences.chinese: 老太太张开双臂，快步上前迎接他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门
detailed_translations.english: one of the two long parts of your body between your shoulders and your hands
to provide weapons for yourself, an army, a country etc in order to prepare for a fight or a war

name: array
trans: n. 数组，阵列；排列，列阵；大批，一系列；衣服

sentences.english: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
sentences.chinese: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

sentences.english: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了当地的市场，看到了漂亮地摆放着的水果蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange something in an attractive way
An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

name: articulate
trans: adj. 发音清晰的；口才好的；有关节的

sentences.english: Many people are unable to articulate the unhappiness they feel.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都表达不出内心的痛苦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清晰地发（音）；明确有力地表达；用关节连接；使相互连贯
detailed_translations.english: to express your ideas or feelings in words

detailed_translations.chinese: 发音清晰的；口才好的；有关节的
detailed_translations.english: writing or speech that is articulate is very clear and easy to understand even if the subject is difficult

name: ash
trans: n. 灰；灰烬

sentences.english: cigarette ash
sentences.chinese: 香烟灰

sentences.english: The house burnt to ashes.
sentences.chinese: 那房子烧成了灰烬。

sentences.english: His ashes were scattered at sea.
sentences.chinese: 他的骨灰被撒向大海。

detailed_translations.english: the soft grey powder that remains after something has been burned

name: aspiration
trans: n. 渴望；抱负；送气；吸气；吸引术

sentences.english: a high level of political aspiration
sentences.chinese: 崇高的政治抱负

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的愿望； 志向， 抱负
detailed_translations.english: a strong desire to have or achieve something

name: aspire
trans: vi. 渴望；立志；追求

sentences.english: ...people who aspire to public office.
sentences.chinese: …志在获得公职的人们。

detailed_translations.english: to desire and work towards achieving something important

name: assassination
trans: n. 暗杀，行刺

sentences.english: He narrowly escaped an assassination attempt (=  when someone tries but fails to kill someone else  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他在一次暗杀行动中死里逃生。

detailed_translations.english: the act of murdering an important person

name: assault
trans: n. 攻击；袭击

sentences.english: Two men assaulted him after he left the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他离开酒吧之后遭到两名男子的袭击。

sentences.english: The refugee camp came under assault again last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚难民营再次遭袭。

detailed_translations.english: to attack someone in a violent way
a military attack to take control of a place controlled by the enemy

name: assemble
trans: vt. 集合，聚集；装配；收集

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

name: assembly
trans: n. 装配；集会，集合

sentences.english: Police have imposed conditions on public assemblies.
sentences.chinese: 警方给公共集会设置了条件。

sentences.english: Restrictions on freedom of assembly have gradually been relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 对集会自由的限制渐渐放宽了。

sentences.english: an assembly point
sentences.chinese: 集合地点

sentences.english: instructions for assembly
sentences.chinese: 装配说明（书）

detailed_translations.english: the meeting together of a group of people for a particular purpose

name: assert
trans: vt. 维护，坚持；断言；主张；声称

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: assertion
trans: n. 断言，声明；主张，要求；坚持；认定

sentences.english: She makes very general assertions about marriage in the poem.
sentences.chinese: 她在诗中的婚姻主张非常笼统。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断言，声明；主张，要求；坚持；认定

trans: n. 保证，担保；（人寿）保险；确信；断言；厚脸皮，无耻

sentences.english: Despite my repeated assurances, Rob still looked very nervous.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我再三保证，罗布看起来还是很紧张。

trans: n. 庇护；收容所，救济院

sentences.english: He applied for asylum in 1987 after fleeing the police back home.
sentences.chinese: 他于1987年逃脱本国的警察之后申请了避难许可。

detailed_translations.english: protection given to someone by a government because they have escaped from fighting or political trouble in their own country

name: atrocity
trans: n. 暴行；凶恶，残暴

sentences.english: The killing was cold-blooded, and those who committed this atrocity should be tried and punished.
sentences.chinese: 这场杀戮非常残酷，那些犯下此暴行的人应该受到审判和惩罚。

name: attain
trans: n. 成就

sentences.english: More women are attaining positions of power.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的女性获得要职。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time
to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time

name: attendance
trans: n. 出席；到场；出席人数；考勤

sentences.english: We have an average attendance of 4,000 fans per game.
sentences.chinese: 每场比赛平均有4,000名球迷来观战。

sentences.english: Last year’s fair saw attendance figures of 32,000.
sentences.chinese: 去年的交易会有3.2万人参加。

detailed_translations.chinese: 出席；到场；出席人数；考勤
detailed_translations.english: the number of people who attend a game, concert, meeting etc

name: attorney
trans: n. 律师；代理人；检查官

sentences.english: ...a prosecuting attorney.
sentences.chinese: …一位公诉律师。

detailed_translations.english: a lawyer

name: attribute
trans: n. 属性；特质

sentences.english: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

detailed_translations.english: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation
a quality or feature, especially one that is considered to be good or useful

name: audit
trans: n. 审计；[审计] 查账

sentences.english: Each year they audit our accounts and certify them as being true and fair.
sentences.chinese: 每年他们都会审核我们的账目，以证明其准确合理。

detailed_translations.english: to officially examine a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct
an official examination of a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct

name: authentic
trans: adj. 真正的，真实的；可信的

sentences.english: an authentic account
sentences.chinese: 真实可信的说法

detailed_translations.chinese: 真的， 真正的； 可靠的， 可信的
detailed_translations.english: based on facts

name: authorize
trans: vt. 批准，认可；授权给；委托代替

sentences.english: an authorized biography
sentences.chinese: 授权传记

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for something

name: auto
trans: n. 汽车（等于automobile）；自动

sentences.english: imported autos
sentences.chinese: 进口汽车

sentences.english: the auto industry
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业

sentences.english: auto insurance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险

detailed_translations.english: a car

name: autonomy
trans: n. 自治，自治权

sentences.english: campaigners who want greater autonomy for Corsica
sentences.chinese: 希望科西嘉有更多自治权的活动家

detailed_translations.english: freedom that a place or an organization has to govern or control itself

name: availability
trans: n. 可用性；有效性；实用性

sentences.english: the availability of cheap flights
sentences.chinese: 有廉价机票出售

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being at hand when needed

name: await
trans: vt. 等候，等待；期待

sentences.english: Several men are awaiting trial for robbery.
sentences.chinese: 几个人因抢劫正在候审。

detailed_translations.english: to wait for something

name: backdrop
trans: n. 背景；背景幕；交流声

sentences.english: ...the rugged cliffs that formed a backdrop to the village.
sentences.chinese: ...构成村庄天然屏障的崎岖峭壁。

detailed_translations.english: the  scenery  behind something that you are looking at

name: backing
trans: n. 支持；后退；支持者；衬背

sentences.english: She flew to New York to try to raise some financial backing for the project.
sentences.chinese: 她飞到纽约设法为这个计划募集一些资助。

detailed_translations.english: support or help, especially with money

name: backup
trans: n. 支持；后援；阻塞

sentences.english: There is no emergency back-up immediately available.
sentences.chinese: 没有立即就能获得的后备。

detailed_translations.english: Backup consists of extra equipment, resources, or people that you can get help or support from if necessary

name: bail
trans: n. 保释，保释人；保释金；杓

sentences.english: Carpenter is free on bail while he appeals his conviction.
sentences.chinese: 卡彭特取保获释，同时对判决提出上诉。

sentences.english: She was murdered by a man who was out on bail for rape.
sentences.chinese: 她被一名犯强奸罪获保在外的男子杀害。

sentences.english: The three men were released on bail pending an appeal.
sentences.chinese: 这三名男子获准保释等候上诉。

sentences.english: He is not likely to be granted bail .
sentences.chinese: 他不大可能获保释。

sentences.english: Carter has been refused bail and will remain in custody.
sentences.chinese: 卡特已经被拒绝保释，继续拘押。

sentences.english: The judge ordered that Jones be held without bail .
sentences.chinese: 法官下令琼斯不得保释。

sentences.english: Why can’t you ask your father to put up bail for you?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不能叫你父亲帮你交保释金？

sentences.english: Two of the defendants jumped bail and fled to New York.
sentences.chinese: 两名被告弃保潜逃到了纽约。

sentences.english: Bail was set at $30,000.
sentences.chinese: 保释金定为三万美元。

detailed_translations.english: money left with a court of law to make sure that a prisoner will return when their  trial  starts

detailed_translations.chinese: 保释，帮助某人脱离困境；往外舀水
detailed_translations.english: to escape from a situation that you do not want to be in any more

name: ballot
trans: n. 投票；投票用纸；投票总数

sentences.english: The party leader is elected by secret ballot .
sentences.chinese: 政党领袖是通过无记名投票选举产生的。

sentences.english: Workers at the plant held a ballot and rejected strike action.
sentences.chinese: 工厂工人举行投票，否决了罢工行动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投票；投票用纸；投票总数
detailed_translations.english: a system of voting, usually in secret, or an occasion when you vote in this way
to ask someone to vote for something

name: banner
trans: n. 横幅图片的广告模式

sentences.english: The onlookers were shouting, cheering, and waving banners.
sentences.chinese: 观众挥动着横幅，又是叫喊又是欢呼。

sentences.english: She’d never felt the need to carry the banner of feminism.
sentences.chinese: 她从来都不觉得有必要打出女权主义的旗号。

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of cloth on which something is written, often carried between two poles

name: bare
trans: adj. 空的；赤裸的，无遮蔽的

sentences.english: a ragged child with bare feet
sentences.chinese: 一个衣衫褴褛、光着脚的小孩

sentences.english: She felt the sun warm on her bare arms.
sentences.chinese: 她感觉到阳光照在她裸露双臂上的暖意。

sentences.english: He got 40% – a bare pass.
sentences.chinese: 他得了40分，勉强及格。

detailed_translations.english: not covered by clothes

name: barrel
trans: n. 桶；枪管，炮管

sentences.english: The wine is aged in oak barrels.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒是用橡木酒桶放陈的。

detailed_translations.english: a large curved container with a flat top and bottom, made of wood or metal, and used for storing beer, wine etc

name: bass
trans: n. 鲈鱼；男低音；低音部；椴树

sentences.english: The band features Johnson on bass (=  playing the bass guitar  ) .
sentences.chinese: 这支乐队由约翰逊弹奏低音吉他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鲈鱼；男低音；低音部；椴树
detailed_translations.english: a very low male singing voice, or a man with a voice like this
a bass instrument or voice produces low notes

name: bat
trans: n. 蝙蝠；球棒；球拍；批处理文件的扩展名

sentences.english: A bat echolocates the direction.
sentences.chinese: 蝙蝠凭回声测定方向。

sentences.english: Having been suggested by a bat, people invented sonar.
sentences.chinese: 受到蝙蝠的启发，人们发明了声呐。

sentences.english: It is technically incorrect to talk about bat ‘radar’, since they do not use radio waves.
sentences.chinese: 严密来说，说蝙蝠有“雷达”系统是错误的，因为他们并不使用无线电波。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal like a mouse with wings that flies around at night

name: battlefield
trans: n. 战场；沙场

sentences.english: ...the struggle to save America's Civil War battlefields.
sentences.chinese: …保存美国内战战场的努力。

detailed_translations.english: a place where a battle is being fought or has been fought

name: bay
trans: n. 海湾；狗吠声

sentences.english: a house with a view across the bay
sentences.chinese: 能看到海湾全景的一幢房子

sentences.english: Montego Bay
sentences.chinese: 蒙特哥湾

sentences.english: A dog suddenly howled, baying at the moon.
sentences.chinese: 一只狗忽然嚎叫起来，对月长嗥。

detailed_translations.english: a part of the sea that is partly enclosed by a curve in the land
If a dog or wolf bays, it makes loud, long cries

name: beam
trans: n. 横梁；光线；电波；船宽；[计量] 秤杆

sentences.english: ...high-energy laser beams.
sentences.chinese: …高能激光束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 横梁；光线；电波；船宽；[计量] 秤杆
detailed_translations.english: a long heavy piece of wood or metal used in building houses, bridges etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 发送；以梁支撑；用…照射；流露
detailed_translations.english: to send a radio or television signal through the air, especially to somewhere very distant

name: beast
trans: n. 野兽；畜生，人面兽心的人

sentences.english: ...the threats our ancestors faced from wild beasts.
sentences.chinese: …我们祖辈所面临的来自野兽的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, especially a large or dangerous one

name: behalf
trans: n. 代表；利益

sentences.english: She asked the doctor to speak to her parents on her behalf.
sentences.chinese: 她请医生代她同她父母谈谈。

sentences.english: On behalf of everyone here, may I wish you a very happy retirement.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我代表在座的各位祝你退休后生活愉快。

detailed_translations.english: instead of someone, or as their representative

name: beloved
trans: n. 心爱的人；亲爱的教友

sentences.english: He never recovered from the death of his beloved daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他一直没有走出失去爱女的阴影。

sentences.english: He’s always talking about his beloved computer!
sentences.chinese: 他老是在谈论他的宝贝电脑！

sentences.english: It was a gift from her beloved.
sentences.chinese: 那是她心爱的人送的礼物。

detailed_translations.english: loved very much by someone
someone who is loved very much

name: bench
trans: n. 长凳；工作台；替补队员

sentences.english: We sat on a park bench.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在公园的长椅上。

detailed_translations.english: a long seat for two or more people, especially outdoors

name: benchmark
trans: n. 基准；标准检查程序

sentences.english: benchmark data
sentences.chinese: 基准数据

sentences.english: The valuation becomes a benchmark against which to judge other prices.
sentences.chinese: 这个估价成了判断其他价格的依据。

detailed_translations.english: something that is used as a standard by which other things can be judged or measured

detailed_translations.chinese: 用基准问题测试（计算机系统等）

name: beneath
trans: prep. 在…之下

sentences.english: The top layer should now point down to the layer beneath.
sentences.chinese: 现在，顶部图层应当有小箭头指向下面的图层。

sentences.english: The fortress on the hill covered the harbour area beneath.
sentences.chinese: 山上的炮楼把下面的海港地区置于射程之内。

sentences.english: They must all be drowning beneath him, in the watery caves of the rock!
sentences.chinese: 他们一定是在他下面的水里，就在那岩石充满了水的洞中游泳了！

detailed_translations.english: in or to a lower position than something, or directly under something

name: beneficiary
trans: n. [金融] 受益人，受惠者；封臣

sentences.english: One of the main beneficiaries of the early election is thought to be the former president.
sentences.chinese: 前总统被认为是早期选举的主要受益者之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: [金融] 受益人，受惠者；封臣
detailed_translations.english: someone who gets advantages from an action or change

name: betray
trans: vt. 背叛；出卖；泄露（秘密）；露出…迹象

sentences.english: He felt that she had betrayed him.
sentences.chinese: 他感觉她背叛了自己。

sentences.english: She had betrayed her parents' trust .
sentences.chinese: 她辜负了父母对她的信任。

sentences.english: I would never betray a confidence (=  tell a secret that someone has trusted me with  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会泄露秘密。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背叛， 出卖； 失信于， 辜负； 泄露； 暴露， 显露
detailed_translations.english: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset

name: bind
trans: n. 捆绑；困境；讨厌的事情；植物的藤蔓

sentences.english: The monks are bound by vows of silence.
sentences.chinese: 僧侣们必须遵守保持缄默的誓言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合；装订；有约束力；过紧
detailed_translations.english: if you are bound by an agreement, promise etc, you must do what you have agreed to do or promised to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 捆绑；困境；讨厌的事情；植物的藤蔓
detailed_translations.english: an annoying or difficult situation

name: biography
trans: n. 传记；档案；个人简介

sentences.english: ...recent biographies of Stalin.
sentences.chinese: …近年的斯大林传记。

detailed_translations.english: a book that tells what has happened in someone’s life, written by someone else

name: bishop
trans: n. （基督教的）主教；（国际象棋的）象

sentences.english: the Bishop of Durham
sentences.chinese: 达勒姆郡的主教

detailed_translations.english: a priest with a high rank in some Christian religions, who is the head of all the churches and priests in a large area

name: bizarre
trans: adj. 奇异的（指态度，容貌，款式等）

sentences.english: a bizarre coincidence
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的巧合

sentences.english: dancers in rather bizarre costumes
sentences.chinese: 身着奇装异服的舞者

detailed_translations.english: very unusual or strange

name: blade
trans: n. 叶片；刀片，刀锋；剑

sentences.english: a razor blade
sentences.chinese: 剃刀刀片

detailed_translations.english: the flat cutting part of a tool or weapon

name: blast
trans: n. 爆炸；冲击波；一阵

sentences.english: I had the gas fire going full blast .
sentences.chinese: 我把煤气取暖器开到最大。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement of wind or air
to criticize someone or something very strongly – used especially in news reports

name: bleed
trans: vt. 使出血；榨取

sentences.english: Your nose is bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 你的鼻子流血了。

sentences.english: Tragically, she bled to death .
sentences.chinese: 非常不幸，她失血过多死了。

detailed_translations.english: to lose blood, especially because of an injury

name: blend
trans: n. 混合；掺合物

sentences.english: Blend the sugar, eggs, and flour.
sentences.chinese: 把糖、鸡蛋和面粉掺在一起。

sentences.english: a blend of tea
sentences.chinese: 混合茶叶

detailed_translations.english: to thoroughly mix together soft or liquid substances to form a single smooth substance
a mixture of different types of the same thing

name: bless
trans: vt. 祝福；保佑；赞美

sentences.english: He’s always willing to help. Bless him!
sentences.chinese: 他一向乐于助人，愿上帝保佑他！

sentences.english: ‘Jess made this card for me.’ ‘Bless!’
sentences.chinese: “杰斯给我做了这张卡。”“真不错！”

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you are fond of someone, amused by them, or pleased by something they have done

name: blessing
trans: n. 祝福；赐福；祷告

sentences.english: The priest gave the blessing.
sentences.chinese: 牧师为大家祝福。

detailed_translations.english: protection and help from God, or words spoken to ask for this

detailed_translations.chinese: 使幸福（bless的ing形式）；使神圣化；为…祈神赐福

name: boast
trans: n. 自夸；值得夸耀的事物，引以为荣的事物

sentences.english: The city boasts two excellent museums.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。

sentences.english: The Society boasts 3,000 members worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

sentences.english: It is the charity's proud boast that it has never yet turned anyone away.
sentences.chinese: 该慈善机构自吹自擂，声称从来没有拒绝过任何人。

detailed_translations.english: if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good

detailed_translations.chinese: 自夸，吹嘘；以拥有…而自豪
detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

detailed_translations.chinese: 自吹自擂， 自夸的话
detailed_translations.english: Boast is also a noun

name: bonus
trans: n. 奖金；红利；额外津贴

sentences.english: Long-term savers qualify for a cash bonus.
sentences.chinese: 长期储户可获现金红利。

sentences.english: Further additions to your pay may take the form of bonus payments.
sentences.chinese: 工资以外的钱可能以奖金的形式发放。

sentences.english: a Christmas bonus
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节奖金

sentences.english: Each worker receives an annual bonus.
sentences.chinese: 每个员工都可获得一笔年度奖金。

sentences.english: a £20,000 bonus
sentences.chinese: 一笔2万英镑的奖金

detailed_translations.english: money added to someone’s wages, especially as a reward for good work

name: boom
trans: n. 繁荣；吊杆；隆隆声

sentences.english: The boom has created job opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣创造了就业的机会。

sentences.english: the economic boom of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济繁荣

sentences.english: The economy went from boom to bust (=  from increasing to decreasing  ) very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 经济很快就从繁荣走向了萧条。

detailed_translations.english: a quick increase of business activity

name: bounce
trans: n. 跳；弹力；活力

sentences.english: Stop bouncing up and down on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 别在沙发上蹦来蹦去了。

detailed_translations.english: if a ball or other object bounces, or you bounce it, it immediately moves up or away from a surface after hitting it
the action of moving up and down on a surface

name: boundary
trans: n. 边界；范围；分界线

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: bow
trans: n. 弓；鞠躬；船首

sentences.english: She bowed and left the stage.
sentences.chinese: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。

sentences.english: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 科比特走进房间，恭敬地鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
sentences.chinese: 仆人深深一鞠躬，把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

sentences.english: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

detailed_translations.english: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience

name: breach
trans: n. 违背，违反；缺口

sentences.english: The congressman was accused of a breach of secrecy rules.
sentences.chinese: 这个国会议员被指控违反保密条例。

detailed_translations.english: an action that breaks a law, rule, or agreement
to break a law, rule, or agreement

name: breakdown
trans: n. 故障；崩溃；分解；分类；衰弱；跺脚曳步舞

sentences.english: A sudden rise in oil prices could lead to a breakdown of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 油价暴涨会导致经济崩溃。

sentences.english: The breakdown of the negotiations was not unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 谈判的失败是预料之中的事。

detailed_translations.english: a failure of a relationship, discussion or system

name: breakthrough
trans: n. 突破；突破性进展

sentences.english: The company looks poised to make a significant breakthrough in China.
sentences.chinese: 该公司看上去稳将在中国实现一次重大突破。

detailed_translations.english: an important new discovery in something you are studying, especially one made after trying for a long time

name: breed
trans: n. [生物] 品种；种类，类型

sentences.english: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙猎犬是我最喜欢的犬种。

sentences.english: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
sentences.chinese: 鹰在一年中较凉爽的季节交配繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm
if animals breed, they  mate in order to have babies

name: broadband
trans: n. 宽频；宽波段

name: browser
trans: n. [计] 浏览器；吃嫩叶的动物；浏览书本的人

sentences.english: a Web browser
sentences.chinese: 网页浏览器

detailed_translations.chinese: [计] 浏览器；吃嫩叶的动物；浏览书本的人
detailed_translations.english: a computer program that finds information on the Internet and shows it on your computer screen

name: brutal
trans: adj. 残忍的；野蛮的，不讲理的

sentences.english: a brutal man
sentences.chinese: 一个凶残的男人

detailed_translations.english: very cruel and violent

name: buck
trans: n. （美）钱，元；雄鹿；纨绔子弟；年轻的印第安人或黑人

sentences.english: He was a rebel who bucked the system (=  opposed rules or authority  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他是一个反抗体制的叛逆者。

sentences.english: He owes me ten bucks.
sentences.chinese: 他欠我十美元。

detailed_translations.english: to oppose something in a direct way
a US, Canadian, or Australian dollar

name: buddy
trans: n. 伙伴，好朋友；密友；小男孩

sentences.english: We’re good buddies.
sentences.chinese: 我们是好朋友。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伙伴，好朋友；密友；小男孩
detailed_translations.english: a friend

name: buffer
trans: n. [计] 缓冲区；缓冲器，[车辆] 减震器

sentences.english: Keep savings as a buffer against unexpected cash needs.
sentences.chinese: 备有存款来作为急需现金时的缓冲。

detailed_translations.chinese: [计] 缓冲区；缓冲器，[车辆] 减震器
detailed_translations.english: one of the two special metal springs on the front or back of a train or at the end of a railway track, to take the shock if the train hits something
to reduce the bad effects of something

name: bulk
trans: n. 体积，容量；大多数，大部分；大块

sentences.english: The bulk of consumers are based in towns.
sentences.chinese: 大多数消费者都是城镇居民。

sentences.english: The dough will rise until it is double in bulk.
sentences.chinese: 面团会发酵到原来的两倍大。

detailed_translations.english: the main or largest part of something

name: burden
trans: n. 负担；责任；船的载货量

sentences.english: His family responsibilities had started to become a burden.
sentences.chinese: 家庭责任已开始成为他的负担。

detailed_translations.english: something difficult or worrying that you are responsible for

name: bureaucracy
trans: n. 官僚主义；官僚机构；官僚政治

sentences.english: the reduction of unnecessary bureaucracy
sentences.chinese: 消除不必要的官僚体制

detailed_translations.english: a complicated official system that is annoying or confusing because it has a lot of rules, processes etc

name: burial
trans: n. 埋葬；葬礼；弃绝

sentences.english: The priest prepared the body for burial.
sentences.chinese: 牧师为尸体做好了下葬的准备。

sentences.english: the burial of solid waste
sentences.chinese: 掩埋粪便

detailed_translations.english: the act or ceremony of putting a dead body into a grave

name: burst
trans: n. 爆发，突发；爆炸

sentences.english: The pipes had burst and the house was under two feet of water.
sentences.chinese: 水管爆裂，房子被水淹了两英尺。

sentences.english: a sudden burst of activity/energy/anger/enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 活动 / 能量 / 怒火 / 热情的迸发

detailed_translations.english: if something bursts, or if you burst it, it breaks open or apart suddenly and violently so that its contents come out
the act of something bursting or the place where it has burst

name: cabinet
trans: n. 内阁；橱柜；展览艺术品的小陈列室

sentences.english: The President chose loyal supporters to serve in his cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 总统选择了忠诚的支持者到他的内阁服务。

sentences.english: Every year we used the State of the Union as an organizing tool for the cabinet and staff to come up with new policy ideas, and then we worked hard on how best to present them.
sentences.chinese: 每年国情咨文都被内阁和幕僚们作为我们提出新政策思路的一个组织工具，然后我们努力下功夫，让它们以最佳方式呈现在人们面前。

detailed_translations.english: the politicians with important positions in a government who meet to make decisions or advise the leader of the government

name: calculation
trans: n. 计算；估计；计算的结果；深思熟虑

sentences.english: Cathy did a rough calculation.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜作了一个粗略的计算。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of using numbers to find out an amount

name: canvas
trans: n. 帆布

sentences.english: a canvas bag
sentences.chinese: 帆布包

detailed_translations.english: strong cloth used to make bags, tents, shoes etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 用帆布覆盖，用帆布装备

name: capability
trans: n. 才能，能力；性能，容量

sentences.english: the country’s manufacturing capability
sentences.chinese: 该国的生产能力

sentences.english: I can speak French, but simultaneous translation is beyond my capabilities (= too difficult ).
sentences.chinese: 我能讲法语，但是同声传译我做不了。

detailed_translations.english: the natural ability, skill, or power that makes a machine, person, or organization able to do something, especially something difficult

name: capitalism
trans: n. 资本主义

sentences.english: ...the two fundamentally opposed social systems, capitalism and socialism.
sentences.chinese: …两种根本对立的社会制度，资本主义与社会主义。

detailed_translations.english: an economic and political system in which businesses belong mostly to private owners, not to the government

name: capitalist
trans: n. 资本家；资本主义者

sentences.english: Lenin had hoped to even have a working relationship with the capitalists.
sentences.chinese: 列宁甚至曾希望能与资本主义者建立合作关系。

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports capitalism
using or supporting capitalism

name: cargo
trans: n. 货物，船货

sentences.english: a cargo plane
sentences.chinese: 货机

detailed_translations.english: the goods that are being carried in a ship or plane

name: carriage
trans: n. 运输；运费；四轮马车；举止；客车厢

sentences.english: The president-elect followed in an open carriage drawn by six beautiful grey horses.
sentences.chinese: 新当选的总统紧随其后，坐着6匹灰色骏马开道的敞篷马车。

sentences.english: a railway carriage
sentences.chinese: 铁路客车厢

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle with wheels that is pulled by a horse, used in the past

name: carve
trans: vt. 雕刻；切开；开创

sentences.english: carved wooden chairs
sentences.chinese: 木雕椅子

sentences.english: Carve the meat into slices.
sentences.chinese: 把肉切成片。

detailed_translations.english: to make an object or pattern by cutting a piece of wood or stone

name: casino
trans: n. 俱乐部，赌场；娱乐场

sentences.english: Doesn’t that club have a casino upstairs?
sentences.chinese: 那家俱乐部楼上不是有赌场吗？

detailed_translations.english: a place where people try to win money by playing card games or  roulette

name: casualty
trans: n. 意外事故；伤亡人员；急诊室

sentences.english: We have had our first casualty. One runner has dropped out with cramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有了第一位伤员，有一位队员因腿部痉挛退出了。

sentences.english: Any history of bombing must also be a history of civilian casualty, for bombing saves the lives of soldiers only at the expense of other lives.
sentences.chinese: 任何空袭的历史也必定是平民伤亡的历史，因为空袭救了士兵的性命只能以其他人的生命为代价。

sentences.english: The first item always on that was the overnight casualty report from Iraq and Afghanistan, and I would often come and see that had been circled by the president or that he would be reflecting on that.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第一条永远是,这一晚在伊拉克和阿富汗,士兵的伤亡报告，我来的时候会看到那条消息,被布什总统圈了出来,他看着报告会陷入沉思。

name: catalogue
trans: n. 目录；（美）大学情况一览

sentences.english: a mail order catalog
sentences.chinese: 邮购商品目录

sentences.english: an online catalogue
sentences.chinese: 网上目录

detailed_translations.english: a complete list of things that you can look at, buy, or use, for example in a library or at an art show
to make a complete list of all the things in a group

name: cater
trans: vt. 投合，迎合；满足需要；提供饮食及服务

sentences.english: We cater to an exclusive clientele.
sentences.chinese: 我们满足一个特殊客户群的需求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投合，迎合；满足需要；提供饮食及服务
detailed_translations.english: to provide and serve food and drinks at a party, meeting etc, usually as a business

name: cattle
trans: n. 牛；牲畜（骂人的话）；家畜；无价值的人

sentences.english: herds of cattle
sentences.chinese: 成群的牛

sentences.english: a cattle rancher
sentences.chinese: 牧牛场场主

detailed_translations.english: cows and  bulls  kept on a farm for their meat or milk

name: caution
trans: n. 小心，谨慎；警告，警示

sentences.english: The physician must exercise caution when prescribing antidepressants.
sentences.chinese: 医师在开抗抑郁药处方时必须谨慎。

sentences.english: Business leaders are cautioning against hasty action that would hamper flexibility.
sentences.chinese: 企业领导人被告诫不要贸然采取行动，以免把事情搞僵。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very careful to avoid danger or risks
to warn someone that something might be dangerous, difficult etc

name: cautious
trans: adj. 谨慎的；十分小心的

sentences.english: a cautious driver
sentences.chinese: 一位谨慎的司机

sentences.english: a cautious approach to the crisis
sentences.chinese: 处理危机的谨慎态度

sentences.english: The air-pollution board has reacted with cautious optimism to the announcement.
sentences.chinese: 空气污染委员会对这项通告表示谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: careful to avoid danger or risks

name: cease
trans: n. 停止

sentences.english: The things people will do for charity never cease to amaze me (= I am always surprised by them ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们的慈善义举总是让我感到惊讶。

sentences.english: The rain ceased and the sky cleared.
sentences.chinese: 雨过天晴。

sentences.english: without cease
sentences.chinese: 不停地，持续地

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing something or stop happening
(it is a noun only in the phrase `without cease') end

name: cemetery
trans: n. 墓地；公墓

sentences.english: Her father was laid in a cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲安葬在一处公墓。

sentences.english: The body was interred at that cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 尸体下葬在那个公墓。

sentences.english: He rests in a cemetery in the western suburbs of Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 他长眠于北京西郊的一个公墓中。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land, usually not belonging to a church, in which dead people are buried

name: chamber
trans: n. （身体或器官内的）室，膛；房间；会所

sentences.english: a combustion chamber
sentences.chinese: 燃烧室

sentences.english: The heart has four chambers.
sentences.chinese: 心脏有四个腔。

detailed_translations.chinese: （身体或器官内的）室，膛；房间；会所
detailed_translations.english: an enclosed space, especially in your body or inside a machine

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…关在室内；装填（弹药等）

name: chaos
trans: n. 混沌，混乱

sentences.english: The country was plunged into economic chaos.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家陷入了经济大混乱。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

name: characterize
trans: vt. 描绘…的特性；具有…的特征

sentences.english: Bright colours characterize his paintings.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的色彩是他绘画作品的特点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 描绘…的特性；具有…的特征
detailed_translations.english: to describe the qualities of someone or something in a particular way

name: charm
trans: n. 魅力，吸引力；魔力

sentences.english: Joe’s boyish charm
sentences.chinese: 乔身上的稚趣

sentences.english: She turned on the charm (= used her charm ) to all the men.
sentences.chinese: 她对所有那些男人都施展魅力。

sentences.english: The room had no windows and all the charm of a prison cell (= used to say that something has no charm ) .
sentences.chinese: 这房间没有窗，简直就是牢房。

detailed_translations.english: a special quality someone or something has that makes people like them, feel attracted to them, or be easily influenced by them – used to show approval

name: charter
trans: n. 宪章；执照；特许状

sentences.english: ...the last charter plane carrying out foreign nationals.
sentences.chinese: …运出外国侨民的最后一班包机。

detailed_translations.english: A charter plane or boat is one which is rented for use by a particular person or group and which is not part of a regular service

detailed_translations.chinese: 宪章，共同纲领；特许状，许可证；包租
detailed_translations.english: a statement of the principles, duties, and purposes of an organization
to pay a company for the use of their aircraft, boat etc

name: chronic
trans: adj. 慢性的；长期的；习惯性的

sentences.english: chronic arthritis
sentences.chinese: 慢性关节炎

sentences.english: chronic asthma
sentences.chinese: 慢性哮喘

sentences.english: chronic heart disease
sentences.chinese: 慢性心脏病

detailed_translations.english: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

name: chunk
trans: n. 大块；矮胖的人或物

sentences.english: ice chunks
sentences.chinese: 大冰块

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚片， 大块； 相当大的部分
detailed_translations.english: a large thick piece of something that does not have an even shape

name: circulate
trans: vt. 使循环；使流通；使传播

sentences.english: Swimming helps to get the blood circulating through the muscles.
sentences.chinese: 游泳有助于肌肉的血液循环。

sentences.english: Ceiling fans circulated warm air around the room.
sentences.chinese: 吊扇使暖空气在房间里循环。

detailed_translations.english: to move around within a system, or to make something do this
to move around within a system, or to make something do this

name: circulation
trans: n. 流通，传播；循环；发行量

sentences.english: Exercise improves the circulation.
sentences.chinese: 运动能促进血液循环。

sentences.english: The Treasury Department plans to remove older coins from circulation and replace them with new ones.
sentences.chinese: 财政部打算收回市面上流通的旧版硬币，以新版取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血液循环；（资料、货币等）流通
detailed_translations.english: the movement of blood around your body

name: citizenship
trans: n. [法] 公民身份，公民资格；国籍；公民权

sentences.english: McGuirk holds dual citizenship (= the legal right of being a citizen in two countries ) in Ireland and the US.
sentences.chinese: 麦吉尔克拥有爱尔兰和美国的双重国籍。

detailed_translations.chinese: [法] 公民身份，公民资格；国籍；公民权
detailed_translations.english: the legal right of belonging to a particular country

name: civic
trans: adj. 市的；公民的，市民的

sentences.english: Jackson spent the day meeting with local religious and civic leaders.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊那天与当地的宗教领袖和市领导会面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a town or city

name: civilian
trans: n. 平民，百姓

sentences.english: Many innocent civilians were killed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 许多无辜的平民在战争中丧生。

sentences.english: It was difficult to return to civilian life after ten years in the military.
sentences.chinese: 从军十年后重新过平民生活不容易。

detailed_translations.english: anyone who is not a member of the military forces or the police
used to describe people or things that are not military

name: clarity
trans: n. 清楚，明晰；透明

sentences.english: Letters may be edited for length and clarity.
sentences.chinese: 信件可能要加以修改以求篇幅合适，意思明了。

sentences.english: a lack of clarity in the law on property rights
sentences.chinese: 产权法律含糊不清

detailed_translations.english: the clarity of a piece of writing, law, argument etc is its quality of being expressed clearly

name: clash
trans: n. 冲突，不协调；碰撞声，铿锵声

sentences.english: Troops clashed near the border.
sentences.chinese: 军队在边境附近发生了冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发生冲突；不协调；砰地相撞，发出刺耳的撞击声
detailed_translations.english: if two armies, groups etc clash, they start fighting – used in news reports

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲突； 不协调； 刺耳的撞击声
detailed_translations.english: a short fight between two armies or groups – used in news reports

name: classification
trans: n. 分类；类别，等级

sentences.english: the classification of wines according to quality
sentences.chinese: 葡萄酒按品质的分类

sentences.english: There are five job classifications.
sentences.chinese: 有五种工作类别。

detailed_translations.english: a process in which you put something into the group or class it belongs to

name: cling
trans: vi. 坚持，墨守；紧贴；附着

sentences.english: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.english: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.english: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

detailed_translations.english: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

name: clinical
trans: adj. 临床的；诊所的

sentences.english: The drug has undergone extensive clinical trials (= tests to see if it is effective in treating people ) .
sentences.chinese: 该药已经过大量的临床试验。

sentences.english: The therapy has helped people with clinical depression (= a strong feeling of sadness, for which you need medical help ) .
sentences.chinese: 该疗法对临床抑郁症病人有帮助。

detailed_translations.english: relating to treating or testing people who are sick

name: closure
trans: n. 关闭；终止，结束

sentences.english: Several military bases are threatened with closure .
sentences.chinese: 几处军事基地面临关闭。

detailed_translations.english: when a factory, school, hospital etc has to close permanently

name: cluster
trans: n. 群；簇；丛；串

sentences.english: Do this for all nodes in the cluster.
sentences.chinese: 对集群中的所有节点都这样做。

sentences.english: This can be done on any server of the cluster.
sentences.chinese: 可以在集群的任何服务器中这样做。

sentences.english: However, there are some problems in the cluster environment.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在集群环境中却存在一些问题。

detailed_translations.english: a group of things of the same kind that are very close together
if a group of people or things cluster somewhere, or are clustered somewhere, they form a small group in that place

name: coalition
trans: n. 联合；结合，合并

sentences.english: the centre-right coalition government
sentences.chinese: 政治上中间偏右的联合政府

sentences.english: an emergency meeting of the three coalition parties
sentences.chinese: 三个联盟政党召开的一次紧急会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合体， 同盟； 结合， 联合
detailed_translations.english: a union of two or more political parties that allows them to form a government or fight an election together

name: coastal
trans: adj. 沿海的；海岸的

sentences.english: the coastal waters of Britain
sentences.chinese: 英国的近海水域

sentences.english: the coastal path
sentences.chinese: 海滨小道

detailed_translations.english: in the sea or on the land near the coast

name: cocktail
trans: n. 鸡尾酒；开胃食品

sentences.english: On arrival, guests are offered wine or a champagne cocktail.
sentences.chinese: 到达时，客人们可以享用葡萄酒或一份香槟鸡尾酒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鸡尾酒； 餐前开胃小吃； 混合物
detailed_translations.english: an alcoholic drink made from a mixture of different drinks

name: cognitive
trans: adj. 认知的，认识的

sentences.english: cognitive psychology
sentences.chinese: 认知心理学

detailed_translations.english: related to the process of knowing, understanding, and learning something

name: coincide
trans: vi. 一致，符合；同时发生

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

name: collaborate
trans: vi. 合作；勾结，通敌

sentences.english: Much later he collaborated with his son Michael on the English translation of a text on food production.
sentences.chinese: 后来他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一个有关食品生产的文本翻译成英语。

detailed_translations.english: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: collaboration
trans: n. 合作；勾结；通敌

sentences.english: The company is building the centre in collaboration with the Institute of Offshore Engineering.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正与海洋工程学院合建这座中心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 合作， 协作； 勾结
detailed_translations.english: when you work together with another person or group to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: collective
trans: n. 集团；集合体；集合名词

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

name: collision
trans: n. 碰撞；冲突；（意见，看法）的抵触；（政党等的）倾轧

sentences.english: Two people were killed in a head-on collision (= between two vehicles that are moving directly towards each other ) on highway 218.
sentences.chinese: 218号公路上有两辆汽车迎面相撞，两人死亡。

sentences.english: a collision between the two countries over fishing rights
sentences.chinese: 两国为捕鱼权而发生的冲突

detailed_translations.english: an accident in which two or more people or vehicles hit each other while moving in different directions

name: colonial
trans: n. 殖民地居民

sentences.english: the struggle against colonial rule
sentences.chinese: 反抗殖民统治的斗争

sentences.english: Britain was the largest colonial power .
sentences.chinese: 英国曾是最大的殖民强国。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a country that controls and rules other countries, usually ones that are far away

name: columnist
trans: n. 专栏作家

sentences.english: Clarence Page is a columnist for the Chicago Tribune.
sentences.chinese: 克拉伦斯·佩奇是《芝加哥论坛报》的专栏记者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes articles, especially about a particular subject, that appear regularly in a newspaper or magazine

name: combat
trans: n. 战斗；争论

sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.english: These people would then be given training in vigilance and combat not just to defend themselves but also the borders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人会被提供警戒和战斗训练，不仅是为了保护自己，而且要保护边界安全。

detailed_translations.english: fighting, especially during a war

name: commence
trans: v. 开始；着手；<英>获得学位

sentences.english: Work will commence on the new building immediately.
sentences.chinese: 新大楼即将破土动工。

detailed_translations.english: to begin or to start something

name: commentary
trans: n. 评论；注释；评注；说明

sentences.english: Commentary is by Tom Ferris.
sentences.chinese: 由汤姆•费里斯现场解说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 实况报道， 解说词； 评论， 评论文章
detailed_translations.english: a spoken description of an event, given while the event is happening, especially on the television or radio

name: commentator
trans: n. 评论员，解说员；实况播音员；时事评论者

sentences.english: political commentators
sentences.chinese: 政治评论员

detailed_translations.chinese: 评论员，解说员；实况播音员；时事评论者
detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, and who writes about it or discusses it on the television or radio

name: commerce
trans: n. 贸易；商业；商务

sentences.english: measures promoting local commerce and industry
sentences.chinese: 促进地方工商业发展的措施

detailed_translations.english: the buying and selling of goods and services

name: commissioner
trans: n. 理事；委员；行政长官；总裁

sentences.english: ...Alaska's commissioner of education.
sentences.chinese: …阿拉斯加州的教育要员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 理事；委员；行政长官；总裁
detailed_translations.english: someone who is officially in charge of a government department in some countries

name: commodity
trans: n. 商品，货物；日用品

sentences.english: agricultural commodities
sentences.chinese: 农业商品

sentences.english: Commodity prices fell sharply.
sentences.chinese: 商品价格急剧下跌。

detailed_translations.english: a product that is bought and sold

name: communist
trans: n. 共产党员；共产主义者

sentences.english: Without the communists in France, the resistance might not have succeeded in World War II.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有法国的共产主义者，二战中的抵抗运动可能不会成功。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is a member of a political party that supports communism, or who believes in communism
relating to communism

name: companion
trans: n. 同伴；朋友；指南；手册

sentences.english: For ten years he had been her constant companion .
sentences.chinese: 十年来他一直陪伴她左右。

sentences.english: His dog became his closest companion .
sentences.chinese: 他的狗成了他最亲密的伙伴。

sentences.english: a travelling companion
sentences.chinese: 旅伴

detailed_translations.english: someone you spend a lot of time with, especially a friend

name: comparable
trans: adj. 可比较的；比得上的

sentences.english: A car of comparable size would cost far more abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同样大小的汽车在国外要贵得多。

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

name: compassion
trans: n. 同情；怜悯

sentences.english: I was shocked by the doctor’s lack of compassion .
sentences.chinese: 我对这个医生如此缺乏同情心感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of sympathy for someone who is suffering, and a desire to help them

name: compel
trans: vt. 强迫，迫使；强使发生

sentences.english: ...the introduction of legislation to compel cyclists to wear a helmet.
sentences.chinese: …强制骑车人戴头盔的法律的引入。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something

name: compelling
trans: adj. 引人注目的；强制的；激发兴趣的

sentences.english: His life makes a compelling story .
sentences.chinese: 他的一生是个引人入胜的故事。

detailed_translations.english: very interesting or exciting, so that you have to pay attention

name: compensate
trans: vt. 补偿，赔偿；付报酬

sentences.english: the government’s promise to compensate victims of the flood
sentences.chinese: 政府对水灾灾民给予补偿的许诺

sentences.english: The firm will compensate workers for their loss of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 公司将补偿工人的收入损失。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone money because they have suffered injury, loss, or damage

name: compensation
trans: n. 补偿；报酬；赔偿金

sentences.english: People who are wrongly arrested may be paid compensation .
sentences.chinese: 被误抓的人有可能得到补偿费。

detailed_translations.english: money paid to someone because they have suffered injury or loss, or because something they own has been damaged

name: competence
trans: n. 能力，胜任；权限；作证能力；足以过舒适生活的收入

sentences.english: Typing is considered by most employers to be a basic competence.
sentences.chinese: 大多数雇主认为打字是一项基本技能。

detailed_translations.chinese: 能力，胜任；权限；作证能力；足以过舒适生活的收入
detailed_translations.english: the ability to do something well

name: competent
trans: adj. 胜任的；有能力的；能干的；足够的

sentences.english: A competent mechanic should be able to fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 一名合格的机修工应该能够解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

name: compile
trans: vt. 编译；编制；编辑；[图情] 汇编

sentences.english: The document was compiled by the Department of Health.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件是由卫生部汇编的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 编译；编制；编辑；[图情] 汇编
detailed_translations.english: to make a book, list, record etc, using different pieces of information, music etc

name: complement
trans: n. 补语；余角；补足物

sentences.english: The team needs players who complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 球队需要能够相互取长补短的队员。

sentences.english: This wine would be a nice complement to grilled dishes.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒配烧烤食物会很不错。

detailed_translations.english: to make a good combination with someone or something else
someone or something that emphasizes the good qualities of another person or thing

name: complexity
trans: n. 复杂，复杂性；复杂错综的事物

sentences.english: a design of great complexity
sentences.chinese: 一项非常复杂的设计

detailed_translations.english: the state of being complicated

name: compliance
trans: n. 顺从，服从；承诺

sentences.english: Inspectors were sent to visit nuclear sites and verify compliance with the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 监察员被派去参观核址并核实条约的遵守情况。

detailed_translations.english: when someone obeys a rule, agreement, or demand

name: complication
trans: n. 并发症；复杂；复杂化；混乱

sentences.english: The fact that the plane was late added a further complication to our journey.
sentences.chinese: 飞机误点给我们的旅行带来了更大的麻烦。

sentences.english: Pneumonia is one of the common complications faced by bed-ridden patients.
sentences.chinese: 肺炎是卧床病人所面临的常见并发症之一。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or situation that makes something more difficult to understand or deal with

name: comply
trans: vi. 遵守；顺从，遵从；答应

sentences.english: The commander said that the army would comply with the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官说过部队会遵从停火协议。

sentences.english: Some beaches had failed to comply with environmental regulations.
sentences.chinese: 一些海滩没能遵守环保规定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

name: composition
trans: n. 作文，作曲，作品；[材] 构成；合成物；成分

sentences.english: Some minerals have complex chemical compositions.
sentences.chinese: 有些矿物的化学构成很复杂。

sentences.english: a composition by jazzman Dave Brubeck, called ‘Chromatic Fantasy’
sentences.chinese: 爵士音乐家戴夫•布鲁贝克的作品《半音阶幻想曲》

sentences.english: The Journals contain accounts of literary composition.
sentences.chinese: 《期刊》中有关于文学创作的报道。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something is made up of different parts, things, or members

name: compromise
trans: n. 妥协，和解；折衷

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

name: compute
trans: n. 计算；估计；推断

sentences.english: Final results had not yet been computed.
sentences.chinese: 最终的结果还未计算出来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算；估算；用计算机计算
detailed_translations.english: to calculate a result, answer, sum etc

name: conceal
trans: vt. 隐藏；隐瞒

sentences.english: The shadows concealed her as she crept up to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她借着阴影蹑手蹑脚地走向房子。

sentences.english: The path was concealed by long grass.
sentences.chinese: 小路隐藏在长长的草里。

sentences.english: a concealed weapon
