sentences.chinese: 藏匿的武器

detailed_translations.english: to hide something carefully

name: concede
trans: vi. 让步

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

name: conceive
trans: vi. 怀孕；设想；考虑

sentences.english: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
sentences.chinese: 他想出了一个把旧发电站改造为艺术中心的主意。

sentences.english: God is often conceived of as male.
sentences.chinese: 上帝常常被想象为男性。

sentences.english: She is unable to conceive.
sentences.chinese: 她不能怀孕。

sentences.english: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 他们的第一个小孩是在新婚之夜怀上的。

detailed_translations.english: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind; to imagine sth

name: conception
trans: n. 怀孕；概念；设想；开始

sentences.english: the conception of parliamentary democracy
sentences.chinese: 议会民主的概念

sentences.english: changing conceptions of the world
sentences.chinese: 这个世界不断变化的观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea about what something is like, or a general understanding of something

name: concession
trans: n. 让步；特许（权）；承认；退位

sentences.english: The British were not prepared to make any concessions .
sentences.chinese: 英国人没有打算作出让步。

sentences.english: the import/export concessions that had been granted to the island
sentences.chinese: 同意给该岛的进出口特许权

detailed_translations.english: something that you allow someone to have in order to end an argument or a disagreement

name: condemn
trans: vt. 谴责；判刑，定罪；声讨

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: confer
trans: vt. 授予；给予

sentences.english: He conferred with Hill and the others in his office.
sentences.chinese: 他和希尔以及他办公室里的其他人进行了商议。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something with other people, so that everyone can express their opinions and decide on something
to officially give someone a title etc, especially as a reward for something they have achieved

name: confession
trans: n. 忏悔，告解；供认；表白

sentences.english: Sanchez’s confession was read out to the court.
sentences.chinese: 桑切斯的供词在法庭上宣读了出来。

sentences.english: At 3 a.m. Higgins broke down and made a full confession .
sentences.chinese: 凌晨三点，希金斯崩溃了，交代了一切。

sentences.english: I have a confession – I like Britney Spears’ music.
sentences.chinese: 我得承认，我喜欢布兰妮•斯皮尔斯的音乐。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that you have done something wrong, illegal, or embarras-sing, especially a formal statement

name: configuration
trans: n. 配置；结构；外形

sentences.english: ...Stonehenge, in southwestern England, an ancient configuration of giant stones.
sentences.chinese: …史前巨石柱群，位于英国西南部，是一座古代巨石阵列。

detailed_translations.chinese: 配置， 布局， 构造
detailed_translations.english: the shape or arrangement of the parts of something

name: confine
trans: n. 界限，边界;约束；限制

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

name: confirmation
trans: n. 确认；证实；证明；批准

sentences.english: There has still been no official confirmation of the report.
sentences.chinese: 这则报道仍未得到官方证实。

detailed_translations.english: a statement, document etc that says that something is definitely true

name: confront
trans: vt. 面对；遭遇；比较

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

detailed_translations.english: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

name: confrontation
trans: n. 对抗；面对；对质

sentences.english: She had stayed in her room to avoid another confrontation.
sentences.chinese: 她待在自己的房间里，以避免再次发生冲突。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is a lot of angry disagreement between two people or groups

name: congratulate
trans: vt. 祝贺；恭喜；庆贺

sentences.english: He never even stopped to congratulate me.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至没有过来向我祝贺。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that you are happy because they have achieved something or because something nice has happened to them

name: congregation
trans: n. 集会；集合；圣会

sentences.english: The congregation knelt to pray.
sentences.chinese: 会众跪下祈祷。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people gathered together in a church

name: congressional
trans: adj. 国会的；会议的；议会的

sentences.english: The president explained his plans to congressional leaders.
sentences.chinese: 总统向国会领导人说明了他的计划。

detailed_translations.english: A congressional policy, action, or person relates to the U.S. Congress.

name: conquer
trans: vt. 战胜，征服；攻克，攻取

sentences.english: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: conscience
trans: n. 道德心，良心

sentences.english: Well, at least I can face them all with a clear conscience (= the knowledge that you have done nothing wrong ) .
sentences.chinese: 好吧，至少我可以问心无愧地面对他们所有人。

sentences.english: I can’t tell you what to do – it’s a matter of conscience (= something that you must make a moral judgment about ) .
sentences.chinese: 我不能告诉你怎么办——这是良心问题。

sentences.english: a crisis of conscience among medical staff (= a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what is the right thing to do )
sentences.chinese: 医务人员中的良心危机

detailed_translations.english: the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is morally right or wrong

name: consciousness
trans: n. 意识；知觉；觉悟；感觉

sentences.english: The painful memories eventually faded from her consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 那些痛苦的回忆最终从她的意识中淡去了。

sentences.english: Hypnosis is an altered state of consciousness .
sentences.chinese: 催眠状态是一种被改变的意识状态。

sentences.english: research into human consciousness
sentences.chinese: 对人类意识的研究

detailed_translations.english: your mind and your thoughts

name: consecutive
trans: adj. 连贯的；连续不断的

sentences.english: It had rained for four consecutive days.
sentences.chinese: 雨接连下了四天。

sentences.english: Can they win the title for the third consecutive season?
sentences.chinese: 他们能连续第三个赛季赢得冠军称号吗？

detailed_translations.english: consecutive numbers or periods of time follow one after the other without any interruptions

name: consensus
trans: n. 一致；舆论；合意

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

name: consent
trans: n. 同意；（意见等的）一致；赞成

sentences.english: The chairman was elected by common consent (= with most people agreeing ) .
sentences.chinese: 主席是大家一致推选出来的。

sentences.english: divorce by mutual consent
sentences.chinese: 双方均同意的离婚

sentences.english: Her father reluctantly consented to the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲勉强答应了这桩婚事。

detailed_translations.english: agreement about something
to give your permission for something or agree to do something

name: conserve
trans: n. 果酱；蜜饯

sentences.english: We must conserve our woodlands for future generations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须为子孙后代保护林地。

sentences.english: efforts to conserve fish stocks
sentences.chinese: 保护鱼类资源的努力

detailed_translations.english: to protect something and prevent it from changing or being damaged

name: consistency
trans: n. [计] 一致性；稠度；相容性

sentences.english: She scores goals with remarkable consistency.
sentences.chinese: 她以非凡的连贯性进球得分。

detailed_translations.english: how thick, smooth etc a substance is

name: consolidate
trans: vt. 巩固，使固定；联合

sentences.english: The company has consolidated its position as the country’s leading gas supplier.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司巩固了作为该国主要煤气供应商的地位。

sentences.english: We consolidate information from a wide range of sources.
sentences.chinese: 我们把来自各种渠道的信息加以汇总。

detailed_translations.english: to strengthen the position of power or success that you have, so that it becomes more effective or continues for longer

name: constituency
trans: n. （选区的）选民；支持者；（一批）顾客

sentences.english: a rural constituency
sentences.chinese: 一个乡村选区

sentences.english: constituency boundaries
sentences.chinese: 选区的分界线

sentences.english: He represents the Essex constituency of Epping Forest.
sentences.chinese: 他代表埃平森林区的埃塞克斯郡选区。

detailed_translations.chinese: （选区的）选民；支持者；（一批）顾客
detailed_translations.english: an area of a country that elects a representative to a parliament

name: constitute
trans: vt. 组成，构成；建立；任命

sentences.english: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

detailed_translations.english: to be the parts that together form sth

name: constitution
trans: n. 宪法；体制；章程；构造；建立，组成；体格

sentences.english: The right to speak freely is written into the Constitution of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 言论自由的权利被写入美国宪法。

sentences.english: She’s got a strong constitution – she’ll recover in no time.
sentences.chinese: 她体质强壮，很快就会恢复。

sentences.english: What’s the chemical constitution of the dye?
sentences.chinese: 这种染料的化学成分是什么？

detailed_translations.english: a set of basic laws and principles that a country or organization is governed by

name: constitutional
trans: n. 保健散步；保健运动

sentences.english: a constitutional crisis
sentences.chinese: 宪法危机

detailed_translations.chinese: 宪法的；本质的；体质上的；保健的
detailed_translations.english: connected with the constitution of a country or organization
a walk you take because it is good for your health

name: constraint
trans: n. [数] 约束；局促，态度不自然；强制

sentences.english: the constraints of family life
sentences.chinese: 家庭生活的约束

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 约束；局促，态度不自然；强制
detailed_translations.english: something that limits your freedom to do what you want

name: consultation
trans: n. 咨询；磋商；[临床] 会诊；讨论会

sentences.english: They retired to another room for private consultation.
sentences.chinese: 他们退到另一房间秘密磋商。

sentences.english: This is a critical question that we must answer together through consultation and coordination.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个我们必须通过磋商和协调共同回答的关键问题。

detailed_translations.english: a discussion in which people who are affected by or involved in something can give their opinions

name: contemplate
trans: vt. 沉思；注视；思忖；预期

sentences.english: He had even contemplated suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至想过自杀。

sentences.english: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
sentences.chinese: 杰克去度假，仔细思考一下他的未来。

sentences.english: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 他微微含笑注视着她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑；深思；细想；注视，凝视
detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you might do in the future

name: contempt
trans: n. 轻视，蔑视；耻辱

sentences.english: The public is treated with contempt by broadcasters.
sentences.chinese: 公众受到了节目主持人的轻蔑对待。

sentences.english: How could she have loved a man who so clearly held her in contempt ?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么会爱上一个明显看不起她的男人呢？

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that someone or something is not important and deserves no respect

name: contend
trans: vi. 竞争；奋斗；斗争；争论

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

name: contender
trans: n. 竞争者；争夺者

sentences.english: Her trainer said yesterday that she would be a strong contender for a place on the Olympic team.
sentences.chinese: 她的教练昨天说，她会是取得奥运代表队里一个席位的一名强有力的竞争者。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is in competition with other people or things

name: content
trans: n. 内容，目录；满足；容量

sentences.english: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing and camera work.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒课程的内容包括稿件写作、剪辑和摄像操作。

detailed_translations.english: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc

name: contention
trans: n. 争论，争辩；争夺；论点

sentences.english: His case has become a source of contention between civil liberties activists and the government.
sentences.chinese: 他的案子已变成了公民自由活动家们和政府之间的争论缘由。

detailed_translations.english: a strong opinion that someone expresses

name: continually
trans: adv. 不断地；频繁地

sentences.english: The desert continually encroaches on the fertile land.
sentences.chinese: 沙漠在不断地侵蚀肥沃土地。

sentences.english: If you continually question why he included this section at all, then you will be frustrated.
sentences.chinese: 如果您不断地询问他究竟为什么要包含此部分，那么您将感到失落。

name: contractor
trans: n. 承包人；立契约者

sentences.english: a roofing contractor
sentences.chinese: 盖屋顶的承包商

detailed_translations.english: a person or company that agrees to do work or provide goods for another company

name: contradiction
trans: n. 矛盾；否认；反驳

sentences.english: apparent contradictions in the defendant’s testimony
sentences.chinese: 被告证词中的明显矛盾

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾， 不一致； 否认， 反驳
detailed_translations.english: a difference between two statements, beliefs, or ideas about something that means they cannot both be true

name: contrary
trans: n. 相反；反面

sentences.english: Two contrary views emerged.
sentences.chinese: 出现了两种相反的观点。

sentences.english: The men shouted contrary orders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人大声喊叫的命令互相矛盾。

sentences.english: It wasn’t a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那不是好事，恰恰相反，是个巨大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: contrary ideas, opinions, or actions are completely different and opposed to each other
used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by someone else, or to answer no to a question

name: contributor
trans: n. 贡献者；投稿者；捐助者

sentences.english: campaign contributors
sentences.chinese: 竞选捐助人

name: conversion
trans: n. 转换；变换；[金融] 兑换；改变信仰

sentences.english: ...the conversion of disused rail lines into cycle routes.
sentences.chinese: …把废弃的铁路改变成自行车道。

detailed_translations.english: when you change something from one form, purpose, or system to a different one

name: convict
trans: n. 罪犯

sentences.english: a convicted murderer
sentences.chinese: 已定罪的谋杀犯

sentences.english: an escaped convict
sentences.chinese: 越狱犯

detailed_translations.english: to prove or officially announce that someone is guilty of a crime after a trial in a law court
someone who has been proved to be guilty of a crime and sent to prison

name: conviction
trans: n. 定罪；确信；证明有罪；确信，坚定的信仰

sentences.english: It was a reasonable explanation, but his voice lacked conviction .
sentences.chinese: 这解释合情合理，只是他的语气不坚定。

sentences.english: It took her so much effort to speak that what she said carried great conviction (= showed she felt sure of what she said ) .
sentences.chinese: 她费了很大的劲在说，因此说出来的话显得很确定。

sentences.english: They had no previous convictions.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有前科。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sure about something and having no doubts

name: cooperate
trans: vi. 合作，配合；协力

sentences.english: They agreed to co-operate with Brazil on a programme to protect the rain forests.
sentences.chinese: 他们同意和巴西合作进行一个保护热带雨林的项目。

sentences.english: I advised my client to cooperate fully with the police.
sentences.chinese: 我建议我的当事人要全力与警方配合。

detailed_translations.english: to work with someone else to achieve something that you both want

name: cooperative
trans: n. 合作社

sentences.english: He was doing his best to be cooperative.
sentences.chinese: 他在尽全力配合。

sentences.english: a cooperative witness
sentences.chinese: 肯配合的目击者

detailed_translations.english: willing to cooperate

name: coordinate
trans: n. 坐标；同等的人或物

sentences.english: Matching bag and accessories provide a complete ensemble of colour coordinates.
sentences.chinese: 颜色协调的包和饰品使全套服装的颜色搭配齐全了。

detailed_translations.english: one of a set of numbers which give the exact position of a point on a map, computer screen etc
equal in importance or rank in a sentence
to organize an activity so that the people involved in it work well together and achieve a good result

name: coordination
trans: n. 协调，调和；对等，同等

sentences.english: Too much alcohol affects your coordination.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒太多会影响你动作的协调。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which your muscles move together when you perform a movement

name: coordinator
trans: n. 协调者；[自] 协调器；同等的人或物

sentences.english: But then, zero hour arrives. The AWACS plane becomes the coordinator of the raids.
sentences.chinese: 时钟跳过零点，AWACS飞机立刻成为了空袭的协调中心。

sentences.english: RM Inventory management: Cooperate with supply coordinator for the warehouse management.
sentences.chinese: 原料仓库管理：配合供应协调员做原料仓库管理。

sentences.english: Subsequent requests are treated similarly: the clients always contact the central coordinator node, and the coordinator node retrieves the data from the correct node.
sentences.chinese: 后续请求也被同等对待：客户端总是联系中心协调者节点，而协调者节点会从正确的节点检索数据。

detailed_translations.english: someone who organizes the way people work together in a particular activity

name: cop
trans: n. 巡警，警官

sentences.english: the local cop
sentences.chinese: 本地警察

sentences.english: a narcotics cop
sentences.chinese: 缉毒警官

sentences.english: He pulled out his badge and said he was a cop.
sentences.chinese: 他拿出警徽说自己是警察。

detailed_translations.english: a police officer

name: copper
trans: n. 铜；铜币；警察

sentences.english: He offered to do the job for a few coppers.
sentences.chinese: 他说他来做这份工作，给他几个铜板就行。

sentences.english: His hair has reverted back to its original copper hue.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发恢复到了原来的铜色。

detailed_translations.english: a soft reddish-brown metal that allows electricity and heat to pass through it easily, and is used to make electrical wires, water pipes etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Cu
Copper is sometimes used to describe things that are reddish-brown in colour

name: copyright
trans: n. 版权，著作权

sentences.english: Who owns the copyright of this book?
sentences.chinese: 谁拥有这本书的版权？

sentences.english: The database will be protected by copyright .
sentences.chinese: 这个数据库将受到版权保护。

detailed_translations.english: the legal right to be the only producer or seller of a book, play, film, or record for a specific length of time

name: correction
trans: n. 改正，修正

sentences.english: I just need to make a few corrections , and then we can send it to the printer.
sentences.chinese: 我只要修改几个地方，然后就可以把它发送到打印机。

detailed_translations.english: a change made in something in order to make it right or better

name: correlate
trans: n. 相关物；相关联的人

sentences.english: Obesity correlates with increased risk for hypertension and stroke.
sentences.chinese: 过度肥胖与高血压和中风的发病风险增加密切相关。

detailed_translations.english: if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other
if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other

name: correlation
trans: n. [数] 相关，关联；相互关系

sentences.english: ...the correlation between smoking and disease.
sentences.chinese: …吸烟和疾病之间的关联。

detailed_translations.english: a connection between two ideas, facts etc, especially when one may be the cause of the other

name: correspond
trans: vi. 符合，一致；相应；通信

sentences.english: The two halves of the document did not correspond.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件的前后两部分不相符。

sentences.english: The French ‘baccalauréate’ exam roughly corresponds to English A levels.
sentences.chinese: 法国的毕业会考大致相当于英国的高级程度考试。

detailed_translations.english: if two things or ideas correspond, the parts or information in one relate to the parts or information in the other

name: correspondence
trans: n. 通信；一致；相当

sentences.english: The magazine is unable to enter into any correspondence on medical matters.
sentences.chinese: 本杂志无法答复有关医学方面的来信。

sentences.english: All correspondence between us must cease.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间的所有通信必须停止。

detailed_translations.english: the process of sending and receiving letters

name: correspondent
trans: n. 通讯记者；客户；通信者；代理商行

sentences.english: The result was correspondent with my wishes.
sentences.chinese: 结果与我的愿望是一致的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通讯员，记者；异地代理商；代理银行
detailed_translations.english: someone who is employed by a newspaper or a television station etc to report news from a particular area or on a particular subject

name: corresponding
trans: adj. 相当的，相应的；一致的；通信的

sentences.english: The war and the corresponding fall in trade have had a devastating effect on the country.
sentences.chinese: 战争以及由此所导致的贸易量下降对这个国家产生了致命的影响。

sentences.english: Sales are up 10% on the corresponding period last year.
sentences.chinese: 销售比去年同期增加了10%。

detailed_translations.english: caused by or connected with something you have already mentioned

name: corrupt
trans: adj. 腐败的，贪污的；堕落的

sentences.english: Young prisoners are being corrupted by the older, long-term offenders.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的囚犯正在被年纪较大、刑期长的犯人带坏。

sentences.english: Corrupt judges have taken millions of dollars in bribes.
sentences.chinese: 腐败的法官接受了几百万美元的贿赂。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone to start behaving in an immoral or dishonest way
using your power in a dishonest or illegal way in order to get an advantage for yourself

name: corruption
trans: n. 贪污，腐败；堕落

sentences.english: officials charged with bribery and corruption
sentences.chinese: 被指控受贿和贪污的官员

sentences.english: The investigation uncovered widespread corruption within the police force.
sentences.chinese: 这项调查揭发出了警察机关内部普遍的腐败。

detailed_translations.english: dishonest, illegal, or immoral behaviour, especially from someone with power

name: costly
trans: adj. 昂贵的；代价高的

sentences.english: Such a database would be extremely costly to set up.
sentences.chinese: 建立这样一个数据库要花很多钱。

sentences.english: His delay in making a decision could prove costly in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 他的优柔寡断长久下去要付出巨大代价。

detailed_translations.english: very expensive, especially wasting a lot of money

name: councillor
trans: n. 议员；顾问；参赞（等于councilor）

sentences.english: Write to your local councillor to complain.
sentences.chinese: 写信给你们当地的市政议员投诉。

detailed_translations.english: a member of a council

name: counselling
trans: n. 辅导；建议

name: counsellor
trans: n. 顾问；参赞；辅导员（等于counselor）；律师；法律顾问

sentences.english: Are you seeing a counsellor?
sentences.chinese: 你是不是在看心理辅导员？

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to help and support people with problems

name: counter
trans: n. 柜台；对立面；计数器；（某些棋盘游戏的）筹码

sentences.english: He wondered if the girl behind the counter recognised him.
sentences.chinese: 他在想柜台后面的那个女孩是否认出了他。

sentences.english: Set the video counter to zero before you press play.
sentences.chinese: 在按播放键之前，把录像机上的计数器调到零。

detailed_translations.english: the place where you pay or are served in a shop, bank, restaurant etc

name: counterpart
trans: n. 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

name: countless
trans: adj. 无数的；数不尽的

sentences.english: a famous film clip which has been shown countless times
sentences.chinese: 播放了无数次的一段著名电影选段

detailed_translations.english: too many to be counted

name: coup
trans: n. 政变；妙计；出乎意料的行动；砰然的一击

sentences.english: Haiti’s first elected President was deposed in a violent military coup .
sentences.chinese: 海地的第一位民选总统在一场动荡的军事政变中被废黜。

sentences.english: a coup attempt by junior officers
sentences.chinese: 低级军官发动的一场军事政变

sentences.english: He evaded capture after the failed coup .
sentences.chinese: 政变失败后他逃脱了抓捕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 政变；妙计；出乎意料的行动；砰然的一击
detailed_translations.english: a sudden and sometimes violent attempt by citizens or the army to take control of the government

name: courtesy
trans: n. 礼貌；好意；恩惠

sentences.english: It’s a matter of common courtesy to acknowledge letters.
sentences.chinese: 确认收到来信是起码的礼貌。

sentences.english: The president paid a courtesy call on Emperor Akihito.
sentences.chinese: 总统礼节性地拜访了明仁天皇。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour and respect for other people

detailed_translations.chinese: 殷勤的；被承认的；出于礼节的
detailed_translations.english: A courtesy call or a courtesy visit is a formal visit that you pay someone as a way of showing them politeness or respect

name: craft
trans: n. 工艺；手艺；太空船

sentences.english: traditional rural crafts
sentences.chinese: 传统的乡村手工艺

sentences.english: arts and crafts
sentences.chinese: 手工艺

detailed_translations.english: a job or activity in which you make things with your hands, and that you usually need skill to do
to make something using a special skill, especially with your hands

name: crawl
trans: n. 爬行；养鱼池；匍匐而行

sentences.english: We crawled into bed at 2 am.
sentences.chinese: 我们凌晨两点爬上了床。

detailed_translations.english: to move along on your hands and knees with your body close to the ground
a way of swimming in which you lie on your stomach and move one arm, and then the other, over your head

name: creator
trans: n. 创造者；创建者

sentences.english: ...Ian Fleming, the creator of James Bond.
sentences.chinese: …伊恩·弗莱明，詹姆斯·邦德的创作者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who made or invented a particular thing

name: credibility
trans: n. 可信性；确实性

sentences.english: The police have lost their credibility.
sentences.chinese: 警察已经失去了他们的可信性。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of deserving to be believed and trusted

name: credible
trans: adj. 可靠的，可信的

sentences.english: Her excuse was barely credible.
sentences.chinese: 她的借口无法让人信服。

sentences.english: a credible alternative to nuclear power
sentences.chinese: 原子能的可靠替代物

detailed_translations.english: deserving or able to be believed or trusted

name: creep
trans: n. 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者

sentences.english: He crept back up the stairs, trying to avoid the ones that creaked.
sentences.chinese: 他蹑手蹑脚地回楼上，尽量避开那些嘎吱作响的梯级。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；蔓延；慢慢地移动；起鸡皮疙瘩
detailed_translations.english: if something such as an insect, small animal, or car creeps, it moves slowly and quietly

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者

name: critique
trans: n. 批评；评论文章

sentences.english: She had brought a book, a feminist critique of Victorian lady novelists.
sentences.chinese: 她带来了一本书，一本从女权主义角度对维多利亚时期女小说家进行的评论。

detailed_translations.english: a detailed explanation of the problems of something such as a set of political ideas
to say how good or bad a book, play, painting, or set of ideas is

name: crown
trans: n. 王冠；花冠；王权；顶点

sentences.english: a hat with a high crown
sentences.chinese: 高顶帽

detailed_translations.english: the top part of a hat or someone’s head
to place a crown on the head of a new king or queen as part of an official ceremony in which they become king or queen

name: crude
trans: n. 原油；天然的物质

sentences.english: a crude wooden bridge
sentences.chinese: 粗糙的木桥

sentences.english: crude oil/metal
sentences.chinese: 原油；未经提炼的金属

detailed_translations.english: not developed to a high standard, or made with little skill

name: crush
trans: n. 粉碎；迷恋；压榨；拥挤的人群

sentences.english: His leg was crushed in the accident.
sentences.chinese: 他的腿在事故中被压断。

sentences.english: Two people were crushed to death in the rush to escape.
sentences.chinese: 两个人在逃生过程中被踩死。

detailed_translations.english: to press something so hard that it breaks or is damaged

name: crystal
trans: n. 结晶，晶体；水晶；水晶饰品

sentences.english: ice/salt crystals
sentences.chinese: 冰 / 盐的结晶体

sentences.english: a pair of crystal earrings
sentences.chinese: 一对水晶耳环

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of a substance with many even sides, that is formed naturally when the substance becomes solid

name: cult
trans: n. 祭仪（尤其指宗教上的）；礼拜；狂热信徒

sentences.english: O’Brien has a cult of devoted readers.
sentences.chinese: 奥布赖恩有一批忠实的读者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 异教， 教派； 狂热的崇拜
detailed_translations.english: an extreme religious group that is not part of an established religion

name: cultivate
trans: vt. 培养；陶冶；耕作

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

name: curiosity
trans: n. 好奇，好奇心；珍品，古董，古玩

sentences.english: I opened the packet just to satisfy my curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 我打开包裹只是为了满足我的好奇心。

sentences.english: The news aroused a lot of curiosity among local people.
sentences.chinese: 这条消息在当地人中间引起了很大的好奇心。

sentences.english: She decided to follow him out of curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 她出于好奇决定跟踪他。

sentences.english: Margaret looked at him with curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特好奇地看着他。

sentences.english: a man of immense intellectual curiosity
sentences.chinese: 求知欲极强的一个男人

sentences.english: It was idle curiosity that made me ask.
sentences.chinese: 我只是好奇地随便问了一下。

detailed_translations.english: the desire to know about something

name: custody
trans: n. 保管；监护；拘留；抚养权

sentences.english: The mother is usually awarded custody (= legally allowed to have custody ) .
sentences.chinese: 母亲通常会获得监护权。

sentences.english: a dispute over who should have custody of the children
sentences.chinese: 关于孩子监护权归属问题的争执

sentences.english: The couple will retain joint custody (= they will both have custody ) of their daughters.
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩将继续保留对女儿的共同监护权。

sentences.english: Allen is fighting a bitter custody battle over his three children.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦为获得自己三个孩子的监护权拼死力争。

detailed_translations.english: the right to take care of a child, given to one of their parents when they have  divorced

name: cutting
trans: n. [机] 切断；剪辑；开凿

sentences.english: ...notice boards crowded with newspaper cuttings.
sentences.chinese: …贴满了剪报的布告栏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开凿出来的公路，铁路；剪报
detailed_translations.english: an article that has been cut from a newspaper or magazine

name: cynical
trans: adj. 愤世嫉俗的；冷嘲的

sentences.english: a cynical view of human nature
sentences.chinese: 认为人性本恶的一种观点

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤世嫉俗的， 怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: unwilling to believe that people have good, honest, or sincere reasons for doing something

name: dam
trans: n. [水利] 水坝；障碍

sentences.english: They built a dam along the seashore to retain the seawater.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿海岸筑起一道堤坝以拦住海水。

detailed_translations.english: to stop the water in a river or stream from flowing by building a special wall across it
a special wall built across a river or stream to stop the water from flowing, especially in order to make a lake or produce electricity

name: damaging
trans: v. 破坏（damage的现在分词形式）；损害

name: dawn
trans: n. 黎明；开端

sentences.english: When dawn broke (= the first light of the day appeared ) , we were still 50 miles from Calcutta.
sentences.chinese: 破晓的时候，我们离加尔各答还有50英里。

sentences.english: I was up at the crack of dawn (= very early in the morning ) to get the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我一大早就起来赶飞机。

sentences.english: We worked from dawn to dusk (= through the whole day while it is light ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们从早干到晚。

sentences.english: the cold light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 清冷的晨曦

sentences.english: The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，破晓时天朗气清。

detailed_translations.english: the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears
if day or morning dawns, it begins

name: debris
trans: n. 碎片，残骸

sentences.english: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

detailed_translations.english: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

name: debut
trans: n. 初次登台；开张

sentences.english: She made her debut in a 1937 production of "Hamlet."
sentences.chinese: 她在1937年《哈姆雷特》的演出中首次登台。

detailed_translations.english: the first public appearance of an entertainer, sports player etc or of something new and important

name: decision-making
trans: n. 决策

sentences.english: attempts to involve workers in decision-making
sentences.chinese: 让工人们参与决策的尝试

detailed_translations.english: the process of making important decisions

name: decisive
trans: adj. 决定性的；果断的，坚定的

sentences.english: a decisive factor/victory/battle
sentences.chinese: 决定性的因素 / 胜利 / 战役

sentences.english: a decisive leader
sentences.chinese: 果断的领袖

detailed_translations.english: very important for the final result of a particular situation

name: declaration
trans: n. （纳税品等的）申报；宣布；公告；申诉书

sentences.english: to issue/sign a declaration
sentences.chinese: 发布 / 签署公告

sentences.english: the declaration of war
sentences.chinese: 宣战

sentences.english: the Declaration of Independence (= of the United States)
sentences.chinese: （美国）独立宣言

detailed_translations.english: an official or formal statement, especially about the plans of a government or an organization; the act of making such a statement

name: dedicated
trans: adj. 专用的；专注的；献身的

sentences.english: a dedicated graphics processor
sentences.chinese: 专用图形处理器

detailed_translations.english: made for or used for only one particular purpose

detailed_translations.chinese: 以…奉献；把…用于（dedicate的过去式和过去分词）

name: dedication
trans: n. 奉献；献身；赠言

sentences.english: To reach a high level of skill requires talent, dedication, and a lot of hard work.
sentences.chinese: 要达到高级水平需要天分，还需要全身心的投入和很多的努力。

detailed_translations.english: hard work or effort that someone puts into a particular activity because they care about it a lot

name: deed
trans: n. 行动；功绩；证书；[法] 契据

sentences.english: After the morning’s good deeds he deserved a rest.
sentences.chinese: 上午做了好事之后，他理应休息一下。

sentences.english: She tried to strangle her baby and her lover helped her finish the evil deed .
sentences.chinese: 她试图掐死自己的宝宝，她的情人帮着完成了这个罪恶的勾当。

detailed_translations.chinese: 行动；功绩；证书；[法] 契据
detailed_translations.english: something someone does, especially something that is very good or very bad

name: deem
trans: vt. 认为，视作；相信

sentences.english: French and German were deemed essential.
sentences.chinese: 法语和德语被认为是必需的。

detailed_translations.english: to think of something in a particular way or as having a particular quality

name: default
trans: n. 违约；缺席；缺乏；系统默认值

sentences.english: Mortgage defaults have risen in the last year.
sentences.chinese: 按揭借款违约在近一年里呈上升趋势。

sentences.english: to default on a loan/debt
sentences.chinese: 拖欠借款 / 债务

detailed_translations.english: failure to do something that you are supposed to do according to the law or because it is your duty
to not do something that you are supposed to do, especially that you are legally supposed to do

name: defect
trans: n. 缺点，缺陷；不足之处

sentences.english: All the cars are tested for defects before they leave the factory.
sentences.chinese: 所有汽车在出厂前都经过品质检验。

sentences.english: a genetic defect
sentences.chinese: 遗传缺陷

detailed_translations.english: a fault or a lack of something that means that something or someone is not perfect
to leave your own country or group in order to go to or join an opposing one

name: defensive
trans: n. 防御；守势

sentences.english: The prince drew up his forces in a strong defensive position.
sentences.chinese: 亲王将部队布成坚固的防御阵势。

sentences.english: The rockets are a purely defensive measure against nuclear attack.
sentences.chinese: 火箭弹纯粹是针对核攻击的防御性措施。

detailed_translations.english: used or intended to protect someone or something against attack

name: deficiency
trans: n. 缺陷，缺点；缺乏；不足的数额

sentences.english: They did blood tests on him for signs of vitamin deficiency.
sentences.chinese: 他们给他做了血检看是否有缺乏维生素的迹象。

sentences.english: There are deep deficiencies in this law.
sentences.chinese: 这条法律存在严重的缺陷。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of something that is necessary

name: deficit
trans: n. 赤字；不足额

sentences.english: the country’s widening budget deficit
sentences.chinese: 这个国家日益严重的预算赤字

sentences.english: the US’s foreign trade deficit
sentences.chinese: 美国的对外贸易逆差

detailed_translations.english: the difference between the amount of something that you have and the higher amount that you need

name: defy
trans: n. 挑战；对抗

sentences.english: This was the first (and last) time that I dared to defy my mother.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一次（也是最后一次）胆敢违抗我母亲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 藐视；公然反抗；挑衅；使落空
detailed_translations.english: If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way

name: delegate
trans: n. 代表

sentences.english: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

detailed_translations.chinese: 委派…为代表； 授 ， 把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc

name: delegation
trans: n. 代表团；授权；委托

sentences.english: A trade delegation will visit Kuwait.
sentences.chinese: 一个贸易代表团将访问科威特。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who represent a company, organization etc

name: delicate
trans: adj. 微妙的；精美的，雅致的；柔和的；易碎的；纤弱的；清淡可口的

sentences.english: his delicate hands
sentences.chinese: 他纤细的手

sentences.english: delicate hand-cut glass
sentences.chinese: 易碎的手工刻花玻璃

sentences.english: The sun can easily damage a child’s delicate skin .
sentences.chinese: 阳光很容易晒伤小孩娇嫩的皮肤。

detailed_translations.english: small and having a beautiful shape or appearance

name: demon
trans: n. 恶魔；魔鬼；精力充沛的人；邪恶的事物

sentences.english: He was speeding down the motorway as if pursued by a demon.
sentences.chinese: 他在高速公路上飞速行驶，就像有魔鬼在追赶他似的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恶魔；魔鬼；精力充沛的人；邪恶的事物
detailed_translations.english: an evil  spirit  or force

name: denial
trans: n. 否认；拒绝；节制；背弃

sentences.english: The government issued an official denial of the rumour.
sentences.chinese: 政府发表了正式声明，否认谣言。

sentences.english: His girlfriend is in denial, and refuses to admit that he will soon die.
sentences.chinese: 他的女友不肯接受事实，拒不相信他很快就要死了。

detailed_translations.english: a statement saying that something is not true

name: denounce
trans: vt. 谴责；告发；公然抨击；通告废除

sentences.english: The group denounced the failure by the authorities to take action.
sentences.chinese: 该团体谴责当局没有采取行动。

sentences.english: She denounced him to the police.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方告发了他。

detailed_translations.english: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public

name: dense
trans: adj. 稠密的；浓厚的；愚钝的

sentences.english: a dense rurally-based population
sentences.chinese: 居住在乡村的密集人口

sentences.english: dense fog/smoke/fumes
sentences.chinese: 浓雾 / 烟；浓烈的气体

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of people, things, plants, etc. with little space between them

name: density
trans: n. 密度

sentences.english: areas of high population density
sentences.chinese: 人口密度高的地区

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which an area is filled with people or things

name: dependence
trans: n. 依赖；依靠；信任；信赖

sentences.english: ...the city's traditional dependence on tourism.
sentences.chinese: …这个城市对旅游业的传统依赖。

detailed_translations.english: when you depend on the help and support of someone or something else in order to exist or be successful

name: depict
trans: vt. 描述；描画

sentences.english: a book depicting life in pre-revolutionary Russia
sentences.chinese: 描写革命前俄国人生活的一本书

detailed_translations.english: to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc

name: deploy
trans: n. 部署

sentences.english: So far, however, we have said nothing about how to deploy it.
sentences.chinese: 到现在，我们还没说任何如何部署的内容。

sentences.english: You can then customize and deploy these artifacts in the usual way.
sentences.chinese: 然后，您可以以常规的方式定制和部署这些工件。

sentences.english: Now that you have seen the anatomy of each component, you can deploy them.
sentences.chinese: 您已经了解了对每个组件的剖析，现在可以部署它们了。

name: deployment
trans: n. 调度，部署

name: deposit
trans: n. 存款；押金；订金；保证金；沉淀物

sentences.english: You are advised to deposit your valuables in the hotel safe.
sentences.chinese: 建议您把贵重物品存到酒店保险箱里。

sentences.english: As the river slows down, it deposits a layer of soil.
sentences.chinese: 河水流速变慢时，一层泥土便沉积下来。

sentences.english: I’d like to make a deposit (= pay some money ) into my savings account.
sentences.chinese: 我想存一笔钱到我的储蓄账户里。

sentences.english: fatty deposits on the heart
sentences.chinese: 心脏上沉积的脂肪层

detailed_translations.english: to put money or something valuable in a bank or other place where it will be safe
an amount of money that is paid into a bank account

name: deprive
trans: vt. 使丧失，剥夺

sentences.english: They've been deprived of the fuel necessary to heat their homes.
sentences.chinese: 他们无法得到住房取暖必需的燃料。

detailed_translations.english: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

name: deputy
trans: n. 代理人，代表

sentences.english: ...Jack Lang, France's minister for culture, and his deputy, Catherine Tasca.
sentences.chinese: …法国文化部长杰克·朗和他的副手凯瑟琳·塔斯卡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副职， 副手； 代表， 代理人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is directly below another person in rank, and who is officially in charge when that person is not there

name: descend
trans: vi. 下降；下去；下来；遗传；屈尊

sentences.english: Our plane started to descend.
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞机开始下降。

sentences.english: I heard his footsteps descending the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我听到他下楼的脚步声。

detailed_translations.english: to move from a higher level to a lower one
to move from a higher level to a lower one

name: descent
trans: n. 下降；血统；袭击

sentences.english: Passengers must fasten their seat belts prior to descent.
sentences.chinese: 乘客在飞机降落之前必须系好安全带。

sentences.english: young men and women of Asian descent
sentences.chinese: 亚裔男女青年

sentences.english: There is a gradual descent to the sea.
sentences.chinese: 有一片斜坡缓缓伸延到海边。

detailed_translations.english: the process of going down

name: designate
trans: vt. 指定；指派；标出；把…定名为

sentences.english: This floor has been designated a no-smoking area.
sentences.chinese: 这楼层已定为无烟区。

sentences.english: Buildings are designated by red squares on the map.
sentences.chinese: 在地图上建筑物用红色方块标明。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that sth has a particular character or name; to describe sth in a particular way

name: desirable
trans: n. 合意的人或事物

sentences.english: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
sentences.chinese: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。

sentences.english: a desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 理想的社区

sentences.english: It is desirable that you should have some familiarity with computers.
sentences.chinese: 应该对电脑有所熟悉，这是很有益处的。

sentences.english: It is desirable to keep the cost as low as possible.
sentences.chinese: 把成本控制得越低越好。

detailed_translations.english: something that is desirable is worth having or doing

name: desktop
trans: n. 桌面；台式机

sentences.english: We have stopped making desktops because no one is making money from them.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经停止生产台式电脑了，因为不赚钱。

detailed_translations.english: the main area on a computer where you can find the  icon s  that represent programs, and where you can do things to manage the information on the computer

name: destructive
trans: adj. 破坏的；毁灭性的；有害的，消极的

sentences.english: the destructive power of modern weapons
sentences.chinese: 现代武器的破坏力

detailed_translations.english: causing damage to people or things

name: detain
trans: vt. 拘留；留住；耽搁

sentences.english: Two suspects have been detained by the police for questioning .
sentences.chinese: 两名嫌疑人被警方拘留审问。

sentences.english: He was detained in Washington on urgent business.
sentences.chinese: 他因紧急事务耽搁在了华盛顿。

detailed_translations.english: to officially prevent someone from leaving a place

name: detection
trans: n. 侦查，探测；发觉，发现；察觉

sentences.english: ...the early detection of breast cancer.
sentences.chinese: …乳腺癌的早期发现。

detailed_translations.english: when something is found that is not easy to see, hear etc, or the process of looking for it

name: detention
trans: n. 拘留；延迟；挽留

sentences.english: ...the detention without trial of government critics.
sentences.chinese: …对政府批评者未经审判而进行的关押。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being kept in prison

name: deteriorate
trans: vi. 恶化，变坏

sentences.english: Ethel’s health has deteriorated.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞尔的健康状况恶化了。

sentences.english: America’s deteriorating economy
sentences.chinese: 美国日渐恶化的经济

detailed_translations.english: to become worse

name: devastate
trans: vt. 毁灭；毁坏

sentences.english: The city centre was devastated by the bomb.
sentences.chinese: 市中心被这枚炸弹摧毁了。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something very badly or completely

name: devil
trans: n. 魔鬼；撒旦；家伙；恶棍；淘气鬼；冒失鬼

sentences.english: What on earth is wrong with the poor devil?
sentences.chinese: 这可怜的家伙到底怎么了？

detailed_translations.chinese: 魔鬼；撒旦；家伙；恶棍；淘气鬼；冒失鬼
detailed_translations.english: the most powerful evil spiritin some religions, especially in Christianity

detailed_translations.chinese: 虐待，折磨；（用扯碎机）扯碎；（替作家，律师等）做助手；抹辣味料烤制或煎煮

name: devise
trans: n. 遗赠

sentences.english: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
sentences.chinese: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

detailed_translations.english: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

name: diagnose
trans: vt. 诊断；断定

sentences.english: How did they diagnose you?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么给你的诊断的？

sentences.english: What tools do you need to help you diagnose the problem, and where do you get them?
sentences.chinese: 您需要什么工具来帮助您诊断问题，可以从哪里获得这些工具？

sentences.english: Evidently this springs from some defect in their nature, but it is one not altogether easy either to diagnose of to cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形显然源于他们本性上的某种缺陷，但是这种缺陷既不容易诊断也不容易治疗。

detailed_translations.english: to find out what illness someone has, or what the cause of a fault is, after doing tests, examinations etc

name: diagnosis
trans: n. 诊断

sentences.english: An exact diagnosis can only be made by obtaining a blood sample.
sentences.chinese: 只有抽取血样才能作出准确的诊断。

detailed_translations.english: the process of discovering exactly what is wrong with someone or something, by examining them closely

name: dictate
trans: n. 命令；指示

sentences.english: Federal funds have to be used as dictated by Washington.
sentences.chinese: 联邦款项得按照华盛顿规定的途径使用。

sentences.english: The US government attempted to dictate the terms of the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府企图规定协议的条款。

sentences.english: teenagers following the dictates of fashion
sentences.chinese: 赶时髦的青少年

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone exactly what they must do or how they must behave
an order, rule, or principle that you have to obey

name: dictator
trans: n. 独裁者；命令者

sentences.english: the downfall of the hated dictator
sentences.chinese: 遭人痛恨的独裁者的垮台

detailed_translations.english: a ruler who has complete power over a country, especially one whose power has been gained by force

name: differentiate
trans: vt. 区分，区别

sentences.english: What differentiates these two periods of history?
sentences.chinese: 这两个历史时期的差别在哪里？

detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

detailed_translations.chinese: 区分， 区别； 使不同， 使有差异
detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

name: dignity
trans: n. 尊严；高贵

sentences.english: We do this because we believe in the dignity and value of every person.
sentences.chinese: 我们这样做是因为我们相信每个人的尊严和价值。

sentences.english: They have to be treated well, with dignity.
sentences.chinese: 必须善待申请人，让人有尊严。

sentences.english: This award must be shared with everyone who strives for justice and dignity.
sentences.chinese: 我一定要与所有为正义和尊严奋斗的人分享此奖。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to behave in a calm controlled way even in a difficult situation

name: dilemma
trans: n. 困境；进退两难；两刀论法

sentences.english: a moral dilemma
sentences.chinese: 道德上进退两难的窘境

sentences.english: This placed Robert Kennedy in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。

sentences.english: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

name: dimension
trans: n. 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt. 标出尺寸

sentences.english: You can have a spiritual dimension to your life without being religious.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不信宗教，也可以在生命中拥有精神层面的内容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt标出尺寸
detailed_translations.english: a part of a situation or a quality involved in it

name: diminish
trans: vt. 使减少；使变小

sentences.english: The party’s share of the electorate has diminished steadily.
sentences.chinese: 支持这个政党的选民比例持续下降。

sentences.english: These drugs diminish blood flow to the brain.
sentences.chinese: 这些药物会减少流向脑部的血液量。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

detailed_translations.chinese: 减少， 减小， 降低
detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

name: dip
trans: n. 下沉，下降；倾斜；浸渍，蘸湿

sentences.english: Dip each apple in the syrup until thickly coated.
sentences.chinese: 把每个苹果在糖浆里蘸一下，直到被厚厚地裹上糖浆。

detailed_translations.english: to put something into a liquid and lift it out again
to put something into a liquid and lift it out again

name: diplomat
trans: n. 外交家，外交官；有外交手腕的人；处事圆滑机敏的人

sentences.english: French diplomats
sentences.chinese: 法国外交官

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially represents their government in a foreign country

name: diplomatic
trans: adj. 外交的；外交上的；老练的

sentences.english: Diplomatic efforts to end the fighting began on October 25.
sentences.chinese: 停战的外交努力于10月25日开始。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving the work of diplomats

name: directory
trans: n. [计] 目录；工商名录；姓名地址录

sentences.english: I couldn’t find your number in the telephone directory.
sentences.chinese: 我在电话簿上找不到你的电话号码。

sentences.english: a new business directory
sentences.chinese: 新的商业名录

detailed_translations.english: a book or list of names, facts etc, usually arranged in alphabetical order

name: disastrous
trans: adj. 灾难性的；损失惨重的；悲伤的

sentences.english: a disastrous first marriage
sentences.chinese: 以失败告终的第一次婚姻

sentences.english: The move proved disastrous (= was disastrous ) for the company.
sentences.chinese: 这一行动对公司来说是一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: very bad, or ending in failure

name: discard
trans: n. 抛弃；被丢弃的东西或人

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

name: discharge
trans: n. 排放；卸货；解雇

sentences.english: Sewage is discharged directly into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 污水被直接排放到海里。

sentences.english: the discharge of toxic waste into the sea
sentences.chinese: 有毒废物向海里的排放

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, liquid, smoke etc, or to allow it to escape
when gas, liquid, smoke etc is sent out, or the substance that is sent out

name: disclose
trans: vt. 公开；揭露

sentences.english: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.english: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

name: disclosure
trans: n. [审计] 披露；揭发；被揭发出来的事情

sentences.english: the disclosure of private medical information
sentences.chinese: 私人医疗信息的泄露

detailed_translations.chinese: [审计] 披露；揭发；被揭发出来的事情

name: discourse
trans: n. 论述；谈话；演讲

sentences.english: "I do not know. " And thus ended their discourse.
sentences.chinese: “我也不晓得。”就这样，他们的谈话结束了。 。

sentences.english: They listened to his discourse on human relations.
sentences.chinese: 他们听他作关于人际关系的演讲。

sentences.english: In discourse thou must attend to what is said, and in every movement thou must observe what is doing.
sentences.chinese: 在谈话中你必须注意所说的话，在任何活动中你都必须观察在做什么。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演讲， 谈话， 论文
detailed_translations.english: a serious speech or piece of writing on a particular subject

name: discretion
trans: n. 自由裁量权；谨慎；判断力；判定；考虑周到

sentences.english: British newspapers no longer feel they must treat the royal family with discretion.
sentences.chinese: 英国报界不再觉得他们非得审慎对待王室不可了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自由裁量权；谨慎；判断力；判定；考虑周到
detailed_translations.english: the ability to deal with situations in a way that does not offend, upset, or embarrass people or tell any of their secrets

name: discrimination
trans: n. 歧视；区别，辨别；识别力

sentences.english: laws to prevent discrimination
sentences.chinese: 防止歧视的法律

sentences.english: shape discrimination
sentences.chinese: 形状识别力

detailed_translations.english: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: dismissal
trans: n. 解雇；免职

sentences.english: Wilson was claiming compensation for unfair dismissal .
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊正在就无理解雇要求赔偿。

sentences.english: No dismissals have been announced yet.
sentences.chinese: 尚未宣布有人被解雇。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is removed from their job

name: displace
trans: vt. 取代；置换；转移；把…免职；排水

sentences.english: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

sentences.english: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
sentences.chinese: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

detailed_translations.english: to take the place or position of something or someone

name: disposal
trans: n. 处理；支配；清理；安排

sentences.english: bomb disposal experts
sentences.chinese: 拆弹专家

detailed_translations.english: when you get rid of something

name: dispose
trans: n. 处置；性情

sentences.english: Chinese vases are disposed around the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 中国花瓶摆放在展馆四周。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things or put them in their places

name: dispute
trans: n. 辩论；争吵

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: disrupt
trans: vt. 破坏；使瓦解；使分裂；使中断；使陷于混乱

sentences.english: Traffic was disrupted by a hoax bomb.
sentences.chinese: 有人虚报有炸弹，造成了交通混乱。

sentences.english: Climate change could disrupt the agricultural economy.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化可能给农业经济带来不良影响。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from continuing in its usual way by causing problems

name: disruption
trans: n. 破坏，毁坏；分裂，瓦解

sentences.english: The strike caused widespread disruption .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成了大规模的混乱。

name: dissolve
trans: n. 叠化画面；画面的溶暗

sentences.english: Stir until the sugar dissolves.
sentences.chinese: 一直搅拌到糖溶解掉。

detailed_translations.english: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it

name: distinction
trans: n. 区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: distinctive
trans: adj. 有特色的，与众不同的

sentences.english: a rock band with a distinctive sound
sentences.chinese: 音色独特的摇滚乐队

detailed_translations.english: having a special quality, character, or appearance that is different and easy to recognize

name: distort
trans: vt. 扭曲；使失真；曲解

sentences.english: His account was badly distorted by the press.
sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

name: distress
trans: n. 危难，不幸；贫困；悲痛

sentences.english: The dream had distressed her greatly.
sentences.chinese: 这场梦使她深感不安。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very upset

name: disturbing
trans: v. 干扰；打断（disturb的ing形式）

sentences.english: a disturbing increase in the crime rate
sentences.chinese: 令人不安的犯罪率增幅

detailed_translations.english: worrying or upsetting

name: divert
trans: vt. 转移；使…欢娱；使…转向

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

name: divine
trans: n. 牧师；神学家

sentences.english: divine power
sentences.chinese: 神的力量

sentences.english: divine love
sentences.chinese: 上帝的慈爱

detailed_translations.chinese: 神圣的；非凡的；天赐的；极好的
detailed_translations.english: coming from or relating to God or a god

name: doctrine
trans: n. 主义；学说；教义；信条

sentences.english: traditional doctrines of divine power
sentences.chinese: 神力的传统教义

sentences.english: Marxist doctrine
sentences.chinese: 马克思主义学说

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs that form an important part of a religion or system of ideas

name: documentation
trans: n. 文件, 证明文件, 史实, 文件编制

sentences.english: Applicants must provide supporting documentation .
sentences.chinese: 申请人必须提供证明文件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文件, 证明文件, 史实, 文件编制
detailed_translations.english: official documents, reports etc that are used to prove that something is true or correct

name: domain
trans: n. 领域；域名；产业；地产

sentences.english: Looking after the house was viewed as a woman’s domain.
sentences.chinese: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

detailed_translations.english: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

name: dominance
trans: n. 优势；统治；支配

sentences.english: The latest fighting appears to be an attempt by each group to establish dominance over the other.
sentences.chinese: 最近的战斗似乎是冲突各方在试图争夺控制权。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being more powerful, more important, or more noticeable than other people or things

name: donor
trans: n. 捐赠者；供者；赠送人

sentences.english: We urgently need more assistance from donor countries (= countries that give money, food etc to help in poor countries or disaster areas ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们急需捐赠国的更多援助。

sentences.english: An anonymous donor (= whose name is unknown ) has given £500 towards the restoration fund.
sentences.chinese: 一位匿名捐赠者向重建基金捐了500英镑。

sentences.english: ...the severe shortage of donor organs.
sentences.chinese: …捐献器官的严重匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 捐献的；经人工授精出生的
detailed_translations.english: Donor organs or parts are organs or parts of the body which people allow doctors to use to help people who are ill

name: dose
trans: n. 剂量；一剂，一服

sentences.english: In short, we badly need another very big dose of stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 简言之，我们很需要另一个很大剂量的刺激计划。

sentences.english: There are other questions too, including what dose of green tea catechins is ideal.
sentences.chinese: 也有一些别的问题，包括多少剂量的绿茶儿茶素是理想的。

sentences.english: All have a generous dose of herbs and spices, everything from chervil and celery seed to cloves and peppercorns.
sentences.chinese: 从山萝卜到芹菜籽，从丁香到胡椒籽，每一样均含有大剂量的药草和香料成分。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of a medicine or a drug that you should take

name: drain
trans: n. 排水；下水道，排水管；消耗

sentences.english: He flushed the drain.
sentences.chinese: 他用水冲排水沟。

sentences.english: The boat drifted helplessly along the drain until some people saw him.
sentences.chinese: 船儿无助地顺着排水沟漂流直到有人看见他。

detailed_translations.english: something that continuously uses a lot of time, money etc

name: drift
trans: n. 漂流，漂移；趋势；漂流物

sentences.english: Smoke drifted up from the jungle ahead of us.
sentences.chinese: 我们前方的丛林里有烟升起。

sentences.english: Jenni spent the year drifting around Europe.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮这一年来一直在欧洲各地漂泊。

sentences.english: a drift towards longer working hours
sentences.chinese: 工作时间不知不觉的变长

sentences.english: the drift from the countryside to the cities
sentences.chinese: 大量人口从乡村往城市的流动

detailed_translations.english: to move slowly on water or in the air
a slow change or development from one situation, opinion etc to another

name: driving
trans: n. 驾驶；操纵

name: drown
trans: vt. 淹没；把…淹死

sentences.english: Many people drowned when the boat overturned.
sentences.chinese: 船翻后许多人淹死了。

sentences.english: Jane was drowned in the river.
sentences.chinese: 简在那条河里溺水身亡。

detailed_translations.english: to die from being under water for too long, or to kill someone in this way

name: dual
trans: n. 双数；双数词

sentences.english: a dual system of education
sentences.chinese: 二元[双元]教育体系

detailed_translations.english: having two of something or two parts

name: dub
trans: n. 笨蛋；鼓声

sentences.english: It was dubbed into Spanish for Mexican audiences.
sentences.chinese: 它已为墨西哥观众配成西班牙语了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 配音；轻点；打击；授予称号
detailed_translations.english: to change the original spoken language of a film or television programme into another language

name: dumb
trans: adj. 哑的，无说话能力的；不说话的，无声音的

sentences.english: What a dumb question.
sentences.chinese: 多么愚蠢的问题。

sentences.english: a bunch of dumb kids
sentences.chinese: 一帮笨孩子

sentences.english: ‘What is it?’ I asked, playing dumb (= pretending to be stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: “那是什么？” 我装傻问道。

sentences.english: She’s no dumb blonde (= a pretty woman with blonde hair who seems stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: 她可不是那种没有头脑的金发女郎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 哑的；暂不说话的；愚笨的
detailed_translations.english: stupid

name: duo
trans: n. 二重奏；二重唱；二人组

sentences.english: the comedy duo Reeves and Mortimer
sentences.chinese: 喜剧搭档里夫斯和莫蒂默

detailed_translations.english: a piece of music for two performers

name: dynamic
trans: n. 动态；动力

sentences.english: a dynamic and unstable process
sentences.chinese: 不断变化的、不稳定的过程

detailed_translations.chinese: 有活力的；动力的；不断变化的
detailed_translations.english: continuously moving or changing
something that causes action or change

name: eager
trans: adj. 渴望的；热切的；热心的

sentences.english: He’s a bright kid and eager to learn.
sentences.chinese: 他是个聪明的孩子，热爱学习。

sentences.english: She’s a very hard worker and very eager to please.
sentences.chinese: 她工作很卖力，而且很希望别人满意。

sentences.english: A crowd of eager young students were already waiting outside.
sentences.chinese: 一群急不可待的青年学生已经在外面等着。

detailed_translations.english: very keen and excited about something that is going to happen or about something you want to do

name: earnings
trans: n. 收入

sentences.english: an employee’s average weekly earnings
sentences.chinese: 雇员的平均周薪

sentences.english: The company’s earnings have dropped by 5% in the first quarter.
sentences.chinese: 公司第一季度的利润下降了5%。

detailed_translations.english: the money that you receive for the work that you do

name: ease
trans: n. 轻松，舒适；安逸，悠闲

sentences.english: She lived a life of ease.
sentences.chinese: 她过着悠闲自在的生活。

sentences.english: The plan should ease traffic congestion in the town.
sentences.chinese: 这项计划对城里的交通拥挤状况应该有所缓解。

detailed_translations.english: lack of difficulty
to become or to make sth less unpleasant, painful, severe, etc.

name: echo
trans: n. 回音；效仿

sentences.english: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声过后是响亮的回声。

sentences.english: ‘He's gone! ’ Viv echoed.
sentences.chinese: “他去了！”维夫重复道。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
to repeat what someone else has just said

name: ecological
trans: adj. 生态的，生态学的

sentences.english: an ecological disaster
sentences.chinese: 生态灾难

detailed_translations.english: connected with the way plants, animals, and people are related to each other and to their environment

name: educator
trans: n. 教育家；教育工作者；教师

sentences.english: What more could an educator hope for than a student's desire to learn.
sentences.chinese: 除了学生的学习兴趣，教育者们别无所求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 教育家；教育工作者；教师
detailed_translations.english: a teacher or someone involved in the process of educating people

name: effectiveness
trans: n. 效力

sentences.english: Sometimes you have to sacrifice efficiency for effectiveness.
sentences.chinese: 有时候你需要牺牲效率来达到效果。

sentences.english: However, its viability and effectiveness still have to be established.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它的有效性和可行性尚有待验证。

sentences.english: So, how do you manage and measure the effectiveness of your IT governance solution for your business?
sentences.chinese: 那么，您如何管理并度量面向您的企业的 IT 治理解决方案的有效性呢？

name: efficiency
trans: n. 效率；效能；功效

sentences.english: considerable advancements in energy efficiency
sentences.chinese: 能源效率的显著提高

detailed_translations.chinese: 效率； 功效， 效能
detailed_translations.english: the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

name: ego
trans: n. 自我；自负；自我意识

sentences.english: That promotion really boosted her ego (= made her feel better about herself ).
sentences.chinese: 那次晋升确实增强了她的自信心。

sentences.english: I need someone to massage my bruised ego (= when you feel less confident than before ).
sentences.chinese: 我需要有人来安抚我受挫的自信心。

sentences.english: a fragile ego
sentences.chinese: 脆弱的自尊心

detailed_translations.chinese: 自我，自己，个人思考和感觉能力
detailed_translations.english: the opinion that you have about yourself

name: elaborate
trans: adj. 精心制作的；详尽的；煞费苦心的

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

name: electoral
trans: adj. 选举的；选举人的

name: elevate
trans: vt. 提升；举起；振奋情绪等；提升…的职位

sentences.english: Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
sentences.chinese: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

sentences.english: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.
sentences.chinese: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

detailed_translations.english: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

name: eligible
trans: n. 合格者；适任者；有资格者

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

name: elite
trans: n. 精英；精华；中坚分子

sentences.english: a struggle for power within the ruling elite
sentences.chinese: 统治阶层内部的争权夺利

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

name: embark
trans: vi. 从事，着手；上船或飞机

sentences.english: He's embarking on a new career as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 他正开始一个当作家的新生涯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上船； 着手， 开始工作
detailed_translations.english: to go onto a ship or a plane, or to put or take something onto a ship or plane

name: embarrassment
trans: n. 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据

sentences.english: He could not hide his embarrassment at his children’s rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 他无法掩饰自己孩子的无礼给他带来的难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you are embarrassed

name: embassy
trans: n. 大使馆；大使馆全体人员

sentences.english: the American Embassy in Paris
sentences.chinese: 美国驻巴黎大使馆

detailed_translations.chinese: 大使馆； 大使馆全体成员
detailed_translations.english: a group of officials who represent their government in a foreign country, or the building they work in

name: embed
trans: vt. 栽种；使嵌入，使插入；使深留脑中

sentences.english: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
sentences.chinese: 负罪感在她的性格里根深蒂固。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…嵌入， 扎牢； 使深留脑中
detailed_translations.english: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

name: embody
trans: vt. 体现，使具体化；具体表达

sentences.english: She embodies everything I admire in a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她具备了我所钦佩的教师该具备的一切素质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现，使具体化；具体表达
detailed_translations.english: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

name: emergence
trans: n. 出现，浮现；发生；露头

sentences.english: The day after that, the emergence of a new competitor.
sentences.chinese: 今后的每一天都可能出现新的竞争对手。

sentences.english: Language emerges and develops with the emergence and development of society.
sentences.chinese: 语言是随着社会的产生而产生，随着社会的发展而发展的。

sentences.english: They prefer to wait for the emergence of a new physics theory of everything.
sentences.chinese: 他们更倾向于等待新的可以解释一切的理论的出现.

detailed_translations.english: when something begins to be known or noticed

name: empirical
trans: adj. 经验主义的，完全根据经验的；实证的

sentences.english: empirical evidence
sentences.chinese: 实验证据

detailed_translations.english: based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas

name: empower
trans: vt. 授权，允许；使能够

sentences.english: The Voting Rights Act was needed to empower minority groups.
sentences.chinese: 《选举权法案》对于赋予少数民族自主权是必不可少的。

detailed_translations.english: to give a person or organization the legal right to do something

name: enact
trans: vt. 颁布；制定法律；扮演；发生

sentences.english: a drama enacted on a darkened stage
sentences.chinese: 在灯光暗淡的舞台上演的戏剧

detailed_translations.chinese: 颁布；制定法律；扮演；发生
detailed_translations.english: to act in a play, story etc

name: encompass
trans: vt. 包含；包围，环绕；完成

sentences.english: The study encompasses the social, political, and economic aspects of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究涵盖了这一局势的社会、政治和经济三方面。

detailed_translations.english: to include a wide range of ideas, subjects, etc

name: encouragement
trans: n. 鼓励

sentences.english: With encouragement, Sally is starting to play with the other children.
sentences.chinese: 萨莉受到了鼓励，开始和其他孩子玩起来。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["words of encouragement"]}
sentences.chinese: 鼓励的话

detailed_translations.english: when you encourage someone or something, or the things that encourage them

name: encouraging
trans: v. 鼓励，支持（encourage的ing形式）

name: endeavour
trans: n. 尽力，竭力

sentences.english: But I will endeavour to banish every painful thought, and think only of what will make me happy: your affection, and the invariable kindness of my dear uncle and aunt.
sentences.chinese: 可是我一定会竭力打消一切苦痛的念头，只去想一些能使我高兴的事───譬如想想你的亲切以及亲爱的舅父母对我始终如一的关切。

detailed_translations.chinese: 竭力做到，试图或力图（做某事）
detailed_translations.english: to try very hard

name: endless
trans: adj. 无止境的；连续的；环状的；漫无目的的

sentences.english: an endless stream of visitors
sentences.chinese: 川流不息的游客

sentences.english: The possibilities are endless.
sentences.chinese: 有无限的可能性。

sentences.english: He’s been in a lot of trouble – drugs, guns, blackmail – the list is endless.
sentences.chinese: 他麻烦太多了——毒品、枪支、敲诈——说都说不完。

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount, size, or number

name: endorse
trans: vt. 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

name: endorsement
trans: n. 认可，支持；背书；签注（文件）

sentences.english: There should be no suggestion of endorsement of the product or the company by WHO.
sentences.chinese: 世卫组织不得对任何产品或公司提供支持建议。

name: endure
trans: vt. 忍耐；容忍

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: enforce
trans: vt. 实施，执行；强迫，强制

sentences.english: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
sentences.chinese: 停车限制将会严格执行。

sentences.english: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

detailed_translations.english: to make people obey a rule or law

name: enforcement
trans: n. 执行，实施；强制

name: engagement
trans: n. 婚约；约会；交战；诺言

sentences.english: Their engagement was announced in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们订婚的消息在报上公布了。

sentences.english: This is his only public speaking engagement on the tour.
sentences.chinese: 这是他此行唯一一场公开演讲。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between two people to marry, or the period of time they are engaged

name: engaging
trans: v. 参加（engage的ing形式）；保证；雇用

sentences.english: an engaging smile
sentences.chinese: 迷人的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 迷人的， 美丽动人的
detailed_translations.english: pleasant and attracting your interest

name: enquire
trans: vi. 询问；调查；问候（等于inquire）

sentences.english: I am writing to confirm /enquire/inform you…
sentences.chinese: 我写信是要确认/询问/通知你…

sentences.english: I recently e-mailed one website to enquire why my goods had not yet arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我最近给一个网站发邮件去询问为什么我订购的商品还没有到达。

sentences.english: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.
sentences.chinese: 你们无论进那一城，那一村，要打听那里谁是好人，就住在他家，直住到走的时候。

name: enrich
trans: vt. 使充实；使肥沃；使富足

sentences.english: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 施上肥料使土壤肥沃。

sentences.english: Education can greatly enrich your life.
sentences.chinese: 教育可以大大充实生活。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

name: enrol
trans: vi. 注册；参军

name: ensue
trans: vi. 跟着发生，接着发生；继起

sentences.english: If the Europeans did not reduce subsidies, a trade war would ensue.
sentences.chinese: 如果欧洲不减少补贴，贸易战将随即爆发。

detailed_translations.english: If something ensues, it happens immediately after another event, usually as a result of it

name: enterprise
trans: n. 企业；事业；进取心；事业心

sentences.english: state/public enterprise (=one owned by the government)
sentences.chinese: 国有企业/公共事业单位

sentences.english: We’re looking for young people with enterprise and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 我们在寻找有事业心和创造力的年轻人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 事业,企(事)业单位；事业心,进取心
detailed_translations.english: a company, organization, or business

name: enthusiast
trans: n. 狂热者，热心家

detailed_translations.english: someone who is very interested in a particular activity or subject

name: entitle
trans: vt. 称做…；定名为…；给…称号；使…有权利

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

name: entity
trans: n. 实体；存在；本质

sentences.english: The mind exists as a separate entity.
sentences.chinese: 思想作为一个独立的实体存在。

sentences.english: Good design brings a house and garden together as a single entity.
sentences.chinese: 优秀的设计能把一所房子和花园合为一体。

detailed_translations.english: something that exists as a single and complete unit

name: epidemic
trans: n. 传染病；流行病；风尚等的流行

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

name: equality
trans: n. 平等；相等；[数] 等式

sentences.english: ...equality of the sexes.
sentences.chinese: …性别平等。

detailed_translations.chinese: 等同； 平等； 相等
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people have the same rights, advantages etc

name: equation
trans: n. 方程式，等式；相等；[化学] 反应式

sentences.english: When children enter the equation , further tensions may arise within a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 有了孩子以后，婚姻中可能出现新的矛盾。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or situation in which several things must be considered and dealt with

name: erect
trans: vt. 使竖立；建造；安装

sentences.english: an imposing town hall, erected in 1892
sentences.chinese: 一座气势宏伟的市政厅，建于1892年

sentences.english: Police have erected barriers across the main roads into the town.
sentences.chinese: 警察在进城的主要道路上设立了路障。

sentences.english: It took a couple of hours to erect the tent.
sentences.chinese: 搭帐篷花了几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a building or wall

name: escalate
trans: vt. 使逐步上升

sentences.english: The costs were escalating alarmingly.
sentences.chinese: 成本在以惊人的速度增长。

sentences.english: policies that escalate their own costs
sentences.chinese: 促使其自身成本增加的政策

sentences.english: escalating crime
sentences.chinese: 愈演愈烈的犯罪活动

detailed_translations.english: to become higher or increase, or to make something do this

name: essence
trans: n. 本质，实质；精华；香精

sentences.english: In essence his message was very simple.
sentences.chinese: 实质上他想表达的意思很简单。

detailed_translations.english: the most basic and important quality of something

name: establishment
trans: n. 确立，制定；公司；设施

sentences.english: the establishment of NATO in 1949
sentences.chinese: 1949年北约组织的建立

detailed_translations.english: the act of starting an organization, relationship, or system

name: eternal
trans: adj. 永恒的；不朽的

sentences.english: the Christian promise of eternal life
sentences.chinese: 基督教承诺的永生

sentences.english: She’s an eternal optimist (= she always expects that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 她永远是个乐观主义者。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for ever and having no end

name: evacuate
trans: vt. 疏散，撤退；排泄

sentences.english: Police evacuated the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方将该地区人员全部疏散。

detailed_translations.english: to send people away from a dangerous place to a safe place

name: evoke
trans: vt. 引起，唤起；博得

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.english: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

sentences.english: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唤起， 引起， 使人想起
detailed_translations.english: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

name: evolutionary
trans: adj. 进化的；发展的；渐进的

sentences.english: the evolutionary development of birds
sentences.chinese: 鸟类的进化过程

sentences.english: Some scientists have rejected evolutionary theory.
sentences.chinese: 有些科学家拒绝接受进化论。

sentences.english: He is in favour of gradual, evolutionary social change.
sentences.chinese: 他支持渐进的社会变革。
