detailed_translations.english: relating to the way in which plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: exaggerate
trans: vt. 使扩大；使增大

sentences.english: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.chinese: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

name: excellence
trans: n. 优秀；美德；长处

sentences.english: ...the top award for excellence in journalism and the arts.
sentences.chinese: …新闻与艺术界的最高杰出奖。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something has the quality of excellence, they are extremely good in some way

name: exceptional
trans: n. 超常的学生

sentences.english: an exceptional student
sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.english: A review panel concluded that there were no exceptional circumstances that would warrant a lesser penalty for him.
sentences.chinese: 一个评估小组作出结论：没有什么例外情况可使他获得从轻惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: unusually good

name: excess
trans: n. 超过，超额；过度，过量；无节制

sentences.english: The government was unable to curb the excesses of the secret police.
sentences.chinese: 政府无法约束秘密警察的过分行为。

sentences.english: the worst excesses of journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作中那些最糟糕的越轨行为

detailed_translations.english: harmful actions that are socially or morally unacceptable

name: exclusion
trans: n. 排除；排斥；驱逐；被排除在外的事物

sentences.english: Your essays tend to concentrate on one theme to the exclusion of everything else.
sentences.chinese: 你的文章往往会集中于一个主题而不顾及其他各个方面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 排除；排斥；驱逐；被排除在外的事物
detailed_translations.english: when someone is not allowed to take part in something or enter a place

name: exclusive
trans: n. 独家新闻；独家经营的项目；排外者

sentences.english: Bel Air is an exclusive suburb of Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 贝莱尔是洛杉矶郊外一处高级住宅区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢华的，高级的；独有的，独享的；排斥的，排他的；不包括…的，不把…计算在内的
detailed_translations.english: available or belonging only to particular people, and not shared
an important or exciting story that is printed in only one newspaper, because that newspaper was the first to find out about it

name: exclusively
trans: adv. 唯一地；专有地；排外地

sentences.english: ...an exclusively male domain.
sentences.chinese: …一个由男性独占的领域。

detailed_translations.english: Exclusively is used to refer to situations or activities that involve only the thing or things mentioned, and nothing else

name: execute
trans: vt. 实行；执行；处死

sentences.english: 13 people were summarily executed (= killed without any trial or legal process ) by the guerrillas.
sentences.chinese: 有13人被游击队员就地处决。

sentences.english: The job involves drawing up and executing a plan of nursing care.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作包括拟订和实施一个护理计划。

detailed_translations.english: to kill someone, especially legally as a punishment

name: execution
trans: n. 执行，实行；完成；死刑

sentences.english: a public execution
sentences.chinese: 当众处死

sentences.english: The two men face execution (= They will be killed as a punishment ).
sentences.chinese: 两名男子面临处决。

sentences.english: Torture and summary execution (= execution without a trial or any legal process ) are common.
sentences.chinese: 严刑拷打和不经审判就地处决相当普遍。

sentences.english: He was granted a stay of execution (= delay in carrying out an execution ).
sentences.chinese: 他被准予缓期处决。

detailed_translations.chinese: 死刑； 实行， 执行， 履行； 演奏， 表演
detailed_translations.english: when someone is killed, especially as a legal punishment

name: exert
trans: vt. 运用，发挥；施以影响

sentences.english: They exerted considerable influence within the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们在校内施加了很大的影响力。

sentences.english: Environmental groups are exerting pressure on the government to tighten pollution laws.
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织在向政府施加压力，要求从严执行环保法律法规。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

name: exile
trans: n. 流放，充军；放逐，被放逐者；流犯

sentences.english: the exiled former president
sentences.chinese: 流亡国外的前总统

sentences.english: political exiles
sentences.chinese: 政治流亡者

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to leave their country, especially for political reasons
a person who is forced to live away from his or her own country

name: exit
trans: n. 出口，通道；退场

sentences.english: We made for the nearest exit.
sentences.chinese: 我们走向最近的出口。

sentences.english: an exit door
sentences.chinese: 出口门

sentences.english: Two men were blocking her exit.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人挡住了她出去的路。

detailed_translations.english: a door or space through which you can leave a public room, building etc
to leave a place

name: expenditure
trans: n. 支出，花费；经费，消费额

sentences.english: huge cuts in public expenditure
sentences.chinese: 大幅度削减公共开支

sentences.english: government expenditure on education
sentences.chinese: 政府的教育开支

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["spending by a company on buildings, machinery, equipment etc"],"COLLOINEXA":["capital expenditure"]}
sentences.chinese: 〔公司的〕资本开支

detailed_translations.chinese: 经费， 支出额； 花费， 支出， 消耗
detailed_translations.english: the total amount of money that a government, organization, or person spends during a particular period of time

name: experimental
trans: adj. 实验的；根据实验的；试验性的

sentences.english: experimental teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 试验性教学方法

detailed_translations.english: based on new ideas, forms or methods that are used to find out what effect they have

name: expire
trans: vi. 期满；终止；死亡；呼气

sentences.english: My passport expires next week.
sentences.chinese: 我的护照下周就到期了。

sentences.english: Ophelia expires in Act IV of Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 奥菲莉娅在《哈姆雷特》第四幕中死去。

detailed_translations.english: (of a document, an agreement, etc.) to be no longer valid because the period of time for which it could be used has ended

name: explicit
trans: adj. 明确的；清楚的；直率的；详述的

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

name: explicitly
trans: adv. 明确地；明白地

sentences.english: You have to grant us control explicitly.
sentences.chinese: 你们必须允许我们明确地控制。

sentences.english: Tell them explicitly you want to continue the friendship.
sentences.chinese: 明确地告诉他们你想继续这段友谊。

sentences.english: Therefore, you need to include these in your source files explicitly.
sentences.chinese: 因此，您需要将这些都明确地包含进源文件中。

name: exploitation
trans: n. 开发，开采；利用；广告推销；剥削

detailed_translations.english: the development and use of minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

name: explosive
trans: n. 炸药；爆炸物

sentences.english: ...one-hundred-and-fifty pounds of Semtex explosive.
sentences.chinese: …150磅的塞姆汀塑料炸药。

sentences.english: Because the gas is highly explosive, it needs to be kept in high-pressure containers.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种气体极易爆炸，因此需要保存在高压容器内。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that can cause an explosion
able or likely to explode

name: extract
trans: n. 汁；摘录；榨出物；选粹

sentences.english: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
sentences.chinese: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

detailed_translations.english: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

name: extremist
trans: n. 极端主义者，过激分子

sentences.english: The bomb was planted by right-wing extremists.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹是右翼极端分子放置的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has extreme political opinions and aims, and who is willing to do unusual or illegal things in order to achieve them

name: facilitate
trans: vt. 促进；帮助；使容易

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

detailed_translations.english: to make an action or a process possible or easier

name: faction
trans: n. 派别；内讧；小集团；纪实小说

sentences.english: struggles between the different factions within the party
sentences.chinese: 党内的派系斗争

sentences.english: the leaders of the warring factions
sentences.chinese: 交战各派的领导人

detailed_translations.english: a small group of people within a larger group, who have different ideas from the other members, and who try to get their own ideas accepted

name: faculty
trans: n. 科，系；能力；全体教员

sentences.english: Both faculty and students oppose the measures.
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生都反对这些措施。

detailed_translations.english: all the teachers in a university

name: fade
trans: n. [电影][电视] 淡出；[电影][电视] 淡入

sentences.english: the fading evening light
sentences.chinese: 渐暗的暮色

sentences.english: a pair of faded jeans
sentences.chinese: 一条褪了色的牛仔裤

sentences.english: The sun had faded the curtains.
sentences.chinese: 太阳把窗帘晒得褪了色。

detailed_translations.english: to lose colour and brightness, or to make something do this

name: fairness
trans: n. 公平；美好；清晰；顺利性

sentences.english: the basic fairness of the judicial system
sentences.chinese: 司法制度的基本公正性

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being fair

name: fatal
trans: adj. 致命的；重大的；毁灭性的；命中注定的

sentences.english: potentially fatal diseases
sentences.chinese: 潜在致命的疾病

sentences.english: If it is not treated correctly, the condition can prove fatal (= be fatal ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果治疗不当，这种病可能会致命。

detailed_translations.english: resulting in someone’s death

name: fate
trans: n. 命运

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wish such a fate on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 就算是我不共戴天的仇敌，我也不希望他遭遇这样的命运。

detailed_translations.english: the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period

name: favourable
trans: n. 有利

sentences.english: favourable film reviews
sentences.chinese: 正面的影评

sentences.english: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
sentences.chinese: 回应是一边倒的肯定。

sentences.english: The disease spreads quickly under favourable conditions.
sentences.chinese: 这种病在合适的条件下会传播得很快。

detailed_translations.english: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them

name: feat
trans: n. 功绩，壮举；技艺表演

sentences.english: A racing car is an extraordinary feat of engineering.
sentences.chinese: 赛车是工程学的一项非凡业绩。

detailed_translations.english: something that is an impressive achievement, because it needs a lot of skill, strength etc to do

name: feminist
trans: n. 女权主义者

sentences.english: She’s been an outspoken feminist for over twenty years.
sentences.chinese: 20多年来，她一直是个直言不讳的女权主义者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports the idea that women should have the same rights and opportunities as men
Feminist groups, ideas, and activities are involved in feminism

name: fibre
trans: n. 纤维；纤维制品

sentences.english: Fruit and vegetables are high in fibre content .
sentences.chinese: 水果和蔬菜的纤维素含量很高。

sentences.english: food that is high in dietary fibre
sentences.chinese: 富含膳食纤维的食物

sentences.english: Nylon is a man-made fibre.
sentences.chinese: 尼龙是一种人造纤维。

detailed_translations.english: the part of food that helps to keep a person healthy by keeping the bowels working and moving other food quickly through the body

name: fierce
trans: adj. 凶猛的；猛烈的；暴躁的

sentences.english: fierce guard dogs
sentences.chinese: 凶猛的看门狗

sentences.english: fierce fighting in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里的激烈战斗

detailed_translations.english: a fierce person or animal is angry or ready to attack, and looks very frightening

name: film-maker
trans: n. 电影制作人

name: filter
trans: n. 滤波器；[化工] 过滤器；筛选；滤光器

sentences.english: The water in the tank is constantly filtered.
sentences.chinese: 鱼缸里的水在不停地被过滤。

sentences.english: The ozone layer filters harmful UV rays from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 臭氧层过滤掉有害的太阳紫外线。

sentences.english: coffee filter papers
sentences.chinese: 咖啡滤纸

sentences.english: filter cigarettes (= with a filter at the end )
sentences.chinese: 过滤嘴香烟

detailed_translations.english: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment
something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

name: fine
trans: n. 罚款

sentences.english: Many people regard Beethoven’s fifth symphony as his finest work.
sentences.chinese: 很多人认为贝多芬的第五交响曲是他最杰出的作品。

sentences.english: He’s a very fine player.
sentences.chinese: 他是个很优秀的选手。

sentences.english: It’s a fine idea.
sentences.chinese: 这是个很妙的主意。

sentences.english: Hatfield House is a fine example of Jacobean architecture.
sentences.chinese: 哈特菲尔德宅第是英王詹姆斯一世时期建筑的典范。

sentences.english: The restaurant was chosen for its good food and fine wines .
sentences.chinese: 这家餐厅因其美酒佳肴而入选。

detailed_translations.english: very good or of a very high standard

name: firearm
trans: n. 火器；枪炮

sentences.english: He was charged with illegal possession of a firearm.
sentences.chinese: 他被控非法持有火器。

detailed_translations.english: a gun

name: fit
trans: n. 合身；发作；痉挛

sentences.english: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child.
sentences.chinese: 这些腰带、和服和其他衣服都做得适合孩子穿。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used
if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it

name: fixture
trans: n. 设备；固定装置；固定于某处不大可能移动之物

sentences.english: light fixtures
sentences.chinese: 照明设备

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that is fixed inside a house or building and is sold as part of the house

name: flaw
trans: n. 瑕疵，缺点；一阵狂风；短暂的风暴；裂缝，裂纹

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

name: flawed
trans: adj. 有缺陷的；有瑕疵的；有裂纹的

sentences.english: a flawed concept
sentences.chinese: 有错误的观念

detailed_translations.chinese: 有缺陷的；有瑕疵的；有裂纹的
detailed_translations.english: spoiled by having mistakes, weaknesses, or by being damaged

name: flee
trans: vt. 逃跑，逃走；逃避

sentences.english: His attackers turned and fled.
sentences.chinese: 袭击他的人转身逃走了。

sentences.english: Masaari spent six months in prison before fleeing the country .
sentences.chinese: 正有蹲了六个月监狱，然后逃出了该国。

detailed_translations.english: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

name: fleet
trans: n. 舰队；港湾；小河

sentences.english: Atalanta was fleet of foot (= able to run quickly ) .
sentences.chinese: 阿塔兰特跑起来很快。

detailed_translations.english: fast or quick
a group of ships, or all the ships in a navy

name: flesh
trans: n. 肉；肉体

sentences.english: a freshwater fish with firm white flesh
sentences.chinese: 一种肉色雪白、肉质紧实的淡水鱼

detailed_translations.english: the soft part of the body of a person or animal that is between the skin and the bones

name: flexibility
trans: n. 灵活性；弹性；适应性

sentences.english: Employees expect flexibility in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 员工们盼望工作安排有弹性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to change or be changed easily to suit a different situation

name: flourish
trans: n. 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

name: fluid
trans: n. 流体；液体

sentences.english: He is not allowed solid food yet, only fluids.
sentences.chinese: 他还不能吃固体食物，只能进流食。

sentences.english: a powerful cleaning fluid
sentences.chinese: 一种强力清洁液

detailed_translations.english: a liquid
fluid movements are smooth, relaxed, and graceful

name: footage
trans: n. 英尺长度；连续镜头；以尺计算长度

sentences.english: old footage from the First World War
sentences.chinese: 第一次世界大战时期的旧影像

detailed_translations.english: cinema film showing a particular event

name: foreigner
trans: n. 外地人，外国人

sentences.english: Some of the local people are suspicious of foreigners.
sentences.chinese: 有些当地人不信任外国人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who comes from a different country

name: forge
trans: n. 熔炉，锻铁炉；铁工厂

sentences.english: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的信用卡，并假冒我的签名。

sentences.english: a forged passport
sentences.chinese: 假护照

detailed_translations.english: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way
to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects

name: formula
trans: n. [数] 公式，准则；配方；婴儿食品

sentences.english: We’re still searching for a peace formula.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍在寻找和平方案。

sentences.english: There is no magic formula (= a method that is certain to be successful ) that will transform sorrow into happiness.
sentences.chinese: 没有妙方可以化悲为喜。

sentences.english: With viewing figures up a million, the programme has a winning formula .
sentences.chinese: 收视人数增加了一百万，这个节目的确拥有吸引观众的法宝。

sentences.english: the formula for calculating distance
sentences.chinese: 计算距离的公式

detailed_translations.english: a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule

name: formulate
trans: vt. 规划；用公式表示；明确地表达

sentences.english: By visualizing where you want to be, you start helping your mind formulate ways to achieve that next goal in your life.
sentences.chinese: 通过把你想达到的程度形象化，你就开始帮助自己的头脑制定目标——为了达到你生活中的下一个目标。

sentences.english: With so much content floating around these days, if you want your writing to be read then you've got to take up an interesting topic, thoughtfully formulate your thoughts, and back up your argument.
sentences.chinese: 每天面对这么多漂浮在你身边的信息和内容，如果您希望您的文字被别人阅读，那么你可要找一个有趣的话题，花店功夫制定您的想法，并支持你的论点。

detailed_translations.english: to develop something such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done

name: forth
trans: adv. 向前，向外；自…以后

sentences.english: The house was still burning, pouring forth thick black smoke.
sentences.chinese: 房子仍在燃烧，冒出浓浓的黑烟。

detailed_translations.english: going out from a place or point, and moving forwards or outwards

name: forthcoming
trans: n. 来临

sentences.english: the forthcoming elections
sentences.chinese: 即将到来的选举

sentences.english: Keep an eye on the noticeboards for forthcoming events .
sentences.chinese: 请注意布告牌上的活动预告。

detailed_translations.english: a forthcoming event, meeting etc is one that has been planned to happen soon

name: foster
trans: vt. 培养；养育，抚育；抱（希望等）

sentences.english: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.chinese: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.english: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

detailed_translations.english: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

name: fragile
trans: adj. 脆的；易碎的

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

name: franchise
trans: n. 特权；公民权；经销权；管辖权

sentences.english: a franchise holder
sentences.chinese: 特许经营权持有人

sentences.english: a franchise agreement
sentences.chinese: 特许经营协议

detailed_translations.chinese: 特权；公民权；经销权；管辖权
detailed_translations.english: permission given by a company to someone who wants to sell its goods or services

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…以特许（或特权）；赋予公民权
detailed_translations.english: to give or sell a franchise to someone

name: frankly
trans: adv. 真诚地，坦白地

sentences.english: Frankly, I think the Internet is overrated.
sentences.chinese: 坦率地说，我认为因特网被高估了。

sentences.english: His behaviour was frankly disgraceful.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为老实说是可耻的。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you are saying what you really think about something

name: frustrated
trans: v. 挫败；阻挠（frustrate的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: He gets frustrated when people don’t understand what he’s trying to say.
sentences.chinese: 人们不懂他在说什么时，他就会很懊丧。

sentences.english: The government has deliberately frustrated his efforts to gain work permits for his foreign staff.
sentences.chinese: 政府蓄意挫败了他为其外国员工取得工作许可证的努力。

detailed_translations.english: someone who wants to develop a particular skill but has not been able to do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 挫败；阻挠（frustrate的过去式和过去分词形式）
detailed_translations.english: If someone or something frustrates a plan or attempt to do something, they prevent it from succeeding

name: frustrating
trans: v. 使沮丧（frustrate的ing形式）

sentences.english: My job can be very frustrating sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我的工作令人很沮丧。

sentences.english: This is an immensely frustrating experience for the student.
sentences.chinese: 对于学生来说，这是非常令人沮丧的经历。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel annoyed, upset, or impatient because you cannot do what you want to do

name: frustration
trans: n. 挫折

sentences.english: There are moments when he feels great frustration and it bursts out of him.
sentences.chinese: 会有这样的时刻:当他感觉很好挫折和它爆发出来了。

sentences.english: Your frustration could be an indication that you just need some input or assistance.
sentences.chinese: 你的挫折可能是在暗示你只是需要一些意见或援助。

sentences.english: But before you give up, I’d like you to ask yourself what your frustration is telling you.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在你放弃之前，我希望你能问下自己，你的挫折在向你传达着怎样的讯息。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being prevented from achieving what you are trying to achieve

name: functional
trans: adj. 功能的

sentences.english: The two departments have slight functional differences.
sentences.chinese: 这两个部门功能稍有不同。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the purpose of something

name: fundraising
trans: n. 筹款；资金募集

sentences.english: an Action Pack full of fundraising ideas
sentences.chinese: 讲了许多募捐方法的一本《行动宝盒》

detailed_translations.english: the activity of collecting money for a specific purpose, especially in order to help people who are ill, old etc

name: funeral
trans: n. 葬礼；麻烦事

sentences.english: The funeral will be held at St. Martin’s Church.
sentences.chinese: 葬礼将在圣马丁教堂举行。

sentences.english: Hundreds of mourners attended the funeral of the two boys.
sentences.chinese: 数百名哀悼者参加了那两个男孩的葬礼。

sentences.english: the minister who conducted the funeral service
sentences.chinese: 主持葬礼的牧师

sentences.english: Nelson’s funeral procession down the Thames
sentences.chinese: 沿泰晤士河而下为纳尔逊送葬的队伍

sentences.english: Ramdas set fire to the funeral pyre .
sentences.chinese: 拉姆达斯点燃了火葬柴堆。

detailed_translations.english: a religious ceremony for burying or cremating someone who has died

name: gallon
trans: n. 加仑（容量单位）

sentences.english: a 20 gallon fish tank
sentences.chinese: 一个20加仑的鱼缸

sentences.english: The car does about 50 miles per gallon.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车每加仑油能开50英里左右。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring liquids, equal to eight pints. In Britain this is 4.55 litres, and in the US it is 3.79 litres.

name: gambling
trans: n. 赌博；投机

sentences.english: The lottery is probably the most popular form of gambling.
sentences.chinese: 彩票可能是最普遍的一种赌博形式。

sentences.english: gambling debts
sentences.chinese: 赌债

sentences.english: The police raided a number of illegal gambling dens (= places for illegal gambling ).
sentences.chinese: 警方突击搜查了几个非法赌窟。

detailed_translations.english: when people risk money or possessions on the result of something which is not certain, such as a card game or a horse race

name: gathering
trans: n. 聚集；集会；收款

sentences.english: a select gathering of 20 or 30 people
sentences.chinese: 二三十名特邀人士的聚会

detailed_translations.english: a meeting of a group of people

name: gaze
trans: n. 凝视；注视

sentences.english: Patrick sat gazing into space  (= looking straight in front, not at any particular person or thing ).
sentences.chinese: 帕特里克坐着，茫然地看着前方。

detailed_translations.english: to look at someone or something for a long time, giving it all your attention, often without realizing you are doing so
a long steady look

name: gear
trans: n. 齿轮；装置，工具；传动装置

sentences.english: His mountain bike had 18 gears.
sentences.chinese: 他的山地自行车有18挡。

sentences.english: Andy drove cautiously along in third gear.
sentences.chinese: 安迪挂着三挡小心地行驶。

sentences.english: Does this thing have a reverse gear?
sentences.chinese: 这玩意儿有倒挡吗？

sentences.english: Any cyclist can climb a difficult hill; you just change gear.
sentences.chinese: 谁都能骑上难爬的山坡，只要换挡就行了。

sentences.english: Don’t turn off the engine while you’re still in gear.
sentences.chinese: 还挂着挡的时候不要关发动机。

sentences.english: It’s a good habit to take the car out of gear while you’re at a stoplight.
sentences.chinese: 等红灯时换空挡的习惯很好。

sentences.english: Colleges are not always geared to the needs of mature students.
sentences.chinese: 大学并不总是去适应成年学生的需要。

sentences.english: My training was geared toward winning gold.
sentences.chinese: 我的训练是为赢得金牌去规划的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 齿轮，传动装置，排挡；用具，设备；衣服
detailed_translations.english: the machinery in a vehicle such as a car, truck, or bicycle that you use to go comfortably at different speeds
If someone or something is geared to or toward a particular purpose, they are organized or designed in order to achieve that purpose

name: generic
trans: adj. 类的；一般的；属的；非商标的

sentences.english: With this generic list node structure, you can now define lists and list operations that work regardless of the type of data stored in them.
sentences.chinese: 使用这个通用的列表节点结构，您现在可以定义列表和不需要考虑存储在列表中的数据类型的列表操作。

sentences.english: If your client code needs this kind of specific functionality, then this generic layer is not enough -- at least as it has been described so far.
sentences.chinese: 如果您的客户机代码需要这种特定的功能，那么这个一般层是不够的 ― 至少从迄今对它描述来看是不够的。

name: genocide
trans: n. 种族灭绝；灭绝整个种族的大屠杀

sentences.english: The military leaders were accused of genocide.
sentences.chinese: 军方领导人被指控实施种族大屠杀。

detailed_translations.chinese: 种族灭绝；灭绝整个种族的大屠杀
detailed_translations.english: the deliberate murder of a whole group or race of people

name: glance
trans: n. 一瞥；一滑；闪光

sentences.english: Wyatt glanced around the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 怀亚特环视了一下餐馆。

sentences.english: Emily glanced over her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 埃米莉回头看了一眼。

sentences.english: He gave her a quick glance and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速地瞥了她一眼，笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to quickly look at someone or something
a quick look

name: glimpse
trans: n. 一瞥，一看

sentences.english: I glimpsed a figure at the window.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥见窗前有个身影。

sentences.english: They caught a glimpse of a dark green car.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞥见一辆深绿色的汽车。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly

name: glorious
trans: adj. 光荣的；辉煌的；极好的

sentences.english: a truly glorious future
sentences.chinese: 无比美好的将来

sentences.english: a glorious victory
sentences.chinese: 光荣的胜利

sentences.english: glorious views of the coast
sentences.chinese: 沿海的迷人景色

detailed_translations.english: having or deserving great fame, praise, and honour

name: glory
trans: n. 光荣，荣誉；赞颂

sentences.english: She dreamt of future glory as an Olympic champion.
sentences.chinese: 她梦想着将来能得到奥运冠军的荣誉。

sentences.english: Goran’s moment of glory came when he defeated Rafter.
sentences.chinese: 戈兰击败拉夫特，迎来了荣耀的一刻。

sentences.english: He began the season in a blaze of glory , scoring seven goals in as many games.
sentences.chinese: 这个赛季一开始他便光芒四射，七场比赛进了七个球。

detailed_translations.english: the importance, honour, and praise that people give someone they admire a lot

name: governance
trans: n. 管理；统治；支配

sentences.english: ...he will meet with officials from several countries to discuss ways to promote good governance.
sentences.chinese: ...他将与诸国官员会面，讨论如何促进对国家的良性管理。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of governing

name: grace
trans: n. 优雅；恩惠；魅力；慈悲

sentences.english: Lena moved with the grace of a dancer.
sentences.chinese: 莉娜走路姿势有着舞者般的优美。

sentences.english: He conducted himself with grace and dignity throughout the trial.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审讯过程中他表现得文雅而有尊严。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth way of moving that looks natural, relaxed, and attractive

name: grasp
trans: n. 抓住；理解；控制

sentences.english: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
sentences.chinese: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。

sentences.english: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住手柄一拉。

sentences.english: A short opening paragraph enables the reader to quickly grasp what the article is about.
sentences.chinese: 开篇的小段落使读者很快就能掌握文章的大意。

sentences.english: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

detailed_translations.english: to take and hold something firmly
the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

name: grave
trans: n. 墓穴，坟墓；死亡

sentences.english: Matthew’s life is in grave danger .
sentences.chinese: 马修的生命危在旦夕。

sentences.english: The report expressed grave concern over the technicians’ lack of training.
sentences.chinese: 报告中对技术人员缺乏培训深表忧虑。

sentences.english: I have grave doubts about his ability.
sentences.chinese: 我十分怀疑他的能力。

sentences.english: The situation is becoming very grave.
sentences.chinese: 形势变得非常严峻。

detailed_translations.english: grave problems, situations, or worries are very great or bad
the place in the ground where a dead body is buried
to cut, carve, sculpt, or engrave

name: gravity
trans: n. 重力，地心引力；严重性；庄严

sentences.english: the force of gravity
sentences.chinese: 重力

sentences.english: I could not hide from her the gravity of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不能向她隐瞒情况的严重性。

detailed_translations.english: the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another  planet

name: grid
trans: n. 网格；格子，栅格；输电网

sentences.english: the national grid
sentences.chinese: 国家电网

detailed_translations.english: the network of electricity supply wires that connects  power stations  and provides electricity to buildings in an area

name: grief
trans: n. 悲痛；忧伤；不幸

sentences.english: The grief she felt over Helen’s death was almost unbearable.
sentences.chinese: 她因海伦的去世而悲痛难当。

detailed_translations.english: extreme sadness, especially because someone you love has died

name: grin
trans: n. 露齿笑

sentences.english: He grins, delighted at the memory.
sentences.chinese: 想起往事，他咧嘴笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to smile widely
a wide smile

name: grind
trans: n. 磨；苦工作

sentences.english: a stone for grinding knives and scissors
sentences.chinese: 磨刀剪的石头

sentences.english: The lenses are ground to a high standard of precision.
sentences.chinese: 镜片被磨到很高的精确度。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smooth or sharp by rubbing it on a hard surface or by using a machine

a movement in  skateboarding  or  rollerblading  , which involves moving sideways along the edge of something, so that the bar connecting the wheels of the  skateboard  or  rollerblade  presses hard against the edge

name: grip
trans: n. 紧握；柄；支配；握拍方式；拍柄绷带

sentences.english: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
sentences.chinese: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。

sentences.english: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
sentences.chinese: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。

sentences.english: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
sentences.chinese: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.english: He released his grip and stepped back.
sentences.chinese: 他放开手往后退去。

detailed_translations.english: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

name: gross
trans: n. 总额，总数

sentences.english: He abused the Admiral in the grossest terms.
sentences.chinese: 他用最粗俗的字眼辱骂那位海军上将。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone's speech or behaviour is gross, you think it is very coarse, vulgar, or unacceptable

name: guerrilla
trans: n. 游击战；游击队

sentences.english: left-wing guerrillas
sentences.chinese: 左翼游击队员

detailed_translations.english: a member of a small unofficial military group that fights in small groups

name: guidance
trans: n. 指导，引导；领导

sentences.english: I went to a counselor for guidance on my career.
sentences.chinese: 我去找了一位顾问给我作职业指导。

detailed_translations.english: help and advice that is given to someone about their work, education, or personal life

name: guilt
trans: n. 犯罪，过失；内疚

sentences.english: He used to buy them expensive presents, out of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 出于内疚，他以前总是给他们买昂贵的礼物。

sentences.english: He felt an enormous sense of guilt when he thought about how he’d treated her.
sentences.chinese: 他想到自己那样对待她，心里非常歉疚。

sentences.english: He did not deny his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 他没有否认自己有罪。

sentences.english: His guilt was proved beyond all doubt by the prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 他的罪行已被原告方证实确凿无疑。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of shame and sadness because you know that you have done something wrong

name: gut
trans: n. 内脏；肠子；剧情；胆量；海峡；勇气；直觉；肠

sentences.english: He had a gut feeling that Sarah was lying.
sentences.chinese: 他凭直觉感到萨拉在撒谎。

sentences.english: Let's have your gut reaction to the facts as we know them.
sentences.chinese: 请告诉我们你对这些我们了解的事实的直觉反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 内脏；肠子；剧情；胆量；海峡；勇气；直觉；肠
detailed_translations.english: a reaction or feeling that you are sure is right, although you cannot give a reason for it

detailed_translations.chinese: 取出内脏；摧毁（建筑物等）的内部
detailed_translations.english: to remove the organs from inside a fish or animal in order to prepare it for cooking

detailed_translations.chinese: 简单的；本质的，根本的；本能的，直觉的
detailed_translations.english: A gut feeling is based on instinct or emotion rather than reason

name: hail
trans: n. 冰雹；致敬；招呼；一阵

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

name: halfway
trans: adj. 中途的；不彻底的

sentences.english: He was halfway up the ladder.
sentences.chinese: 他梯子上到了一半。

detailed_translations.english: Halfway means in the middle of a place or between two points, at an equal distance from each of them
at a middle point in space or time between two things

name: halt
trans: n. 停止；立定；休息

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

name: handful
trans: n. 少数；一把；棘手事

sentences.english: The boy picked up a handful of stones and started throwing them at us.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩捡起一把石子，开始朝我们扔过来。

sentences.english: There were only a handful of people there.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：那里只有几个人。

detailed_translations.english: an amount that you can hold in your hand

name: handling
trans: n. 处理

name: handy
trans: adj. 便利的；手边的，就近的；容易取得的；敏捷的

sentences.english: It’s quite a handy little tool.
sentences.chinese: 这件小工具非常有用。

sentences.english: It’s very handy having a light above your desk.
sentences.chinese: 书桌上方有盏灯很有用。

sentences.english: Take your swimming trunks with you – they might come in handy (= be useful ).
sentences.chinese: 带上你的游泳裤，可能会派上用场的。

detailed_translations.english: useful

name: harassment
trans: n. 骚扰；烦恼

sentences.english: African-Americans have been complaining about police harassment for years.
sentences.chinese: 美国黑人多年来一直抱怨受到警察的骚扰。

detailed_translations.english: when someone behaves in an unpleasant or threatening way towards you

name: hardware
trans: n. 计算机硬件；五金器具

sentences.english: 英文例句:To be totally secure, you need a piece of hardware that costs about $200.
sentences.chinese: 为保证绝对安全，你需要一个花费约为两百美元的硬件。

sentences.english: ...a shop from which an uncle had sold hardware and timber.
sentences.chinese: …一家叔叔曾经在那里卖五金器具和木材的店铺。

detailed_translations.english: computer machinery and equipment, as opposed to the programs that make computers work

name: harmony
trans: n. 协调；和睦；融洽；调和

sentences.english: the gorgeous vocal harmonies on ‘Mexicali Rose’
sentences.chinese: 《墨西哥玫瑰》的精彩和声演唱

sentences.english: three-part harmonies
sentences.chinese: 三部和声

detailed_translations.english: notes of music combined together in a pleasant way

name: harsh
trans: adj. 严厉的；严酷的；刺耳的；粗糙的；刺目的

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

name: harvest
trans: n. 收获；产量；结果

sentences.english: every year at harvest time
sentences.chinese: 每年在收获的季节

sentences.english: Plum growers are expecting a bumper harvest this year.
sentences.chinese: 种植李树的农民期盼着今年有个好收成。

detailed_translations.english: the time when crops are gathered from the fields, or the act of gathering them
to gather crops from the fields

name: hatred
trans: n. 憎恨；怨恨；敌意

sentences.english: A look of pure hatred flashed across her face.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上闪过十足的仇恨表情。

sentences.english: the old hatreds and prejudices that simmered below the surface
sentences.chinese: 长久以来憋在心中的仇恨与偏见

detailed_translations.english: an angry feeling of extreme dislike for someone or something

name: haunt
trans: n. 栖息地；常去的地方

sentences.english: The pub is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former landlord.
sentences.chinese: 据说这个酒吧里经常有一位前任房主的鬼魂出没。

detailed_translations.chinese: 常出没于；使苦恼，使担忧；萦绕在心头，缠绕
detailed_translations.english: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often
a place that someone likes to go to often

name: hazard
trans: n. 危险，冒险；冒险的事

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.
sentences.chinese: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿他人和自己的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

detailed_translations.english: to risk sth or put it in danger
something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

name: heighten
trans: vt. 提高；增高；加强；使更显著

sentences.english: There are fears that the march will heighten racial tension.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心这次游行会加深种族间的紧张局势。

sentences.english: Increased levels of fat in the diet could heighten the risk of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 饮食中脂肪摄入量的提升会增加患癌症的风险。

detailed_translations.english: if something heightens a feeling, effect etc, or if a feeling etc heightens, it becomes stronger or increases

name: heritage
trans: n. 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权

sentences.english: the importance of preserving the national heritage
sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.english: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权
detailed_translations.english: the traditional beliefs, values, customs etc of a family, country, or society

name: hierarchy
trans: n. 层级；等级制度

sentences.english: a rigid social hierarchy
sentences.chinese: 严格的社会等级制度

sentences.english: She worked her way up through the corporate hierarchy to become president.
sentences.chinese: 她在公司一步一步升到了总裁的位置。

detailed_translations.english: a system of organization in which people or things are divided into levels of importance

name: high-profile
trans: adj. 高调的；备受瞩目的；知名度高的

sentences.english: a high-profile public figure
sentences.chinese: 一位引人注目的公众人物

name: hint
trans: n. 暗示；线索

sentences.english: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
sentences.chinese: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。

sentences.english: ‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint .’
sentences.chinese: “听着，我不能告诉你。”“得了，给我一点暗示吧。”

sentences.english: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
sentences.chinese: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣，但他不明白我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning

name: homeland
trans: n. 祖国；故乡

sentences.english: Many are planning to return to their homeland.
sentences.chinese: 很多人正计划回到自己的祖国去。

detailed_translations.english: the country where someone was born

name: hook
trans: n. 挂钩，吊钩

sentences.english: We hooked the trailer to the back of the car.
sentences.chinese: 我们把拖车挂在汽车尾部。

sentences.english: a dress that hooks at the back
sentences.chinese: 从后背用钩扣的连衣裙

detailed_translations.english: to fasten or hang sth on sth else using a hook; to be fastened or hanging in this way

name: hopeful
trans: n. 有希望成功的人

sentences.english: Things might get better, but it doesn’t look very hopeful right now.
sentences.chinese: 情况也许会好转，但目前看来希望不大。

detailed_translations.english: making you believe that sth you want will happen; bringing hope

name: horizon
trans: n. [天] 地平线；视野；眼界；范围

sentences.english: In the distance, the dot of a boat appeared on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 远处小黑点般的一条小船出现在地平线上。

sentences.english: a course of study that will broaden your horizons
sentences.chinese: 一门能开阔眼界的课程

detailed_translations.english: the line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky

name: horn
trans: n. 喇叭，号角；角

sentences.english: A mature cow has horns.
sentences.chinese: 成年母牛头上长有角。

detailed_translations.english: a container in the shape of an animal’s horn, used in the past for drinking from, carrying  gunpowder  etc

name: hostage
trans: n. 人质；抵押品

sentences.english: The group are holding two tourists hostage (= keeping them as hostages ) .
sentences.chinese: 这伙人挟持了两名游客作为人质。

sentences.english: a family taken hostage at gunpoint
sentences.chinese: 在枪口下被劫为人质的一家人

detailed_translations.english: someone who is kept as a prisoner by an enemy so that the other side will do what the enemy demands

name: hostile
trans: n. 敌对

sentences.english: Southampton fans gave their former coach a hostile reception .
sentences.chinese: 南安普敦队的球迷对球队的前任教练很不友善。

sentences.english: Carr wouldn’t meet Feng’s stare, which was openly hostile .
sentences.chinese: 卡尔不愿意面对冯公然敌视的目光。

sentences.english: his hostile attitude
sentences.chinese: 他敌对的态度

detailed_translations.english: angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them

name: hostility
trans: n. 敌意；战争行动

sentences.english: The last decade has witnessed a serious rise in the levels of racism and hostility to black and ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 过去的10年里，种族主义及对黑人和少数民族的敌意变得更加严重了。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is unfriendly and full of anger towards another person

name: humanitarian
trans: n. 人道主义者；慈善家；博爱主义者；基督凡人论者

sentences.english: And on each of those issues we have said that we would consider that and, in fact, have provided some humanitarian support.
sentences.chinese: 对于每一件这样的事情，我们都说过，我们将会对此进行考虑，事实上，我们向他们提供了人道主义援助。

sentences.english: But part of trying to do what is right for the Burmese people is to provide humanitarian assistance in this time of extreme need.
sentences.chinese: 但是，对缅甸人民来说，正确的行动部分是为他们提供人道主义援助，而在目前这个时刻更是极端的需要”。

sentences.english: But otherwise, it is best left to the humanitarian experts, who will be there after you are gone and therefore need to preserve their independence and their impartiality.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果不能，最好将这些任务留给人道主义专家，这些专家在部队撤退之后仍将留在那，因此需要保持他们的独立和公正。

name: humanity
trans: n. 人类；人道；仁慈；人文学科

sentences.english: We want a clean healthy environment for all humanity .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望全人类拥有一个干净健康的生存环境。

sentences.english: crimes against humanity
sentences.chinese: 反人类罪

sentences.english: We must never forget our common humanity.
sentences.chinese: 我们永远不要忘记共同的人性。

detailed_translations.english: people in general

name: humble
trans: adj. 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

name: hydrogen
trans: n. [化学] 氢

sentences.english: Water contains hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水含有氢和氧。

sentences.english: Water can be reduced to oxygen and hydrogen by electrolysis.
sentences.chinese: 水通过电解可以分解为氧和氢。

sentences.english: The first bubbles to escape from the liquid are a mixture of air and hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 从该液体中最先逸出的气泡是空气和氢的混合物。

detailed_translations.english: Hydrogen is a colourless gas that is the lightest and commonest element in the universe

name: identification
trans: n. 鉴定，识别；认同；身份证明

sentences.english: Do you have any identification?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

sentences.english: His body was taken to Brighton mortuary for identification.
sentences.chinese: 他的尸体被送到布赖顿停尸所确认身份。

detailed_translations.english: official papers or cards, such as your passport, that prove who you are

name: ideological
trans: adj. 思想的；意识形态的

sentences.english: The party is split by ideological differences.
sentences.chinese: 意识形态上的差异造成该政党分裂。

detailed_translations.english: based on strong beliefs or ideas, especially political or economic ideas

name: ideology
trans: n. 意识形态；思想意识；观念学

sentences.english: the ideologies of fascism and terrorism
sentences.chinese: 法西斯主义和恐怖主义的意识形态

sentences.english: a new ideology based on individualism
sentences.chinese: 基于个人主义的新思想体系

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave

name: idiot
trans: n. 笨蛋，傻瓜；白痴

sentences.english: ‘You are an idiot, ’ he tells them.
sentences.chinese: ‘你确实是傻瓜，’他对他们说。

sentences.english: Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的读者，假设你是一个白痴。再假设你是一名国会成员。不过我的话说重复了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is mentally ill or has a very low level of intelligence

name: ignorance
trans: n. 无知，愚昧；不知，不懂

sentences.english: Excuse my ignorance, but how does it actually work?
sentences.chinese: 请原谅我的无知，它究竟是如何运作的？

detailed_translations.english: lack of knowledge or information about something

name: imagery
trans: n. 像；意象；比喻；形象化

sentences.english: Their dreams commonly involved complex stories with visual imagery.
sentences.chinese: 他们的梦里常常有很多复杂的情节，充满了生动的画面。

detailed_translations.english: the use of words or pictures to describe ideas or actions in poems, books, films etc

name: immense
trans: adj. 巨大的，广大的；无边无际的；非常好的

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: imminent
trans: adj. 即将来临的；迫近的

sentences.english: A new trade agreement is imminent.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的贸易协定即将签署。

detailed_translations.english: an event that is imminent, especially an unpleasant one, will happen very soon

name: implementation
trans: n. [计] 实现；履行；安装启用

sentences.english: They do, however, greatly affect the implementation of those patterns.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它们的确对那些模式的 实现影响很大。

sentences.english: If I now scroll down to the actual implementation, now does this work or not work?
sentences.chinese: 如果现在我向下滚动到实际的执行中，这个是可用的还是不可用的呢？

sentences.english: One file describes the interface to your service, while the other file describes your implementation of it.
sentences.chinese: 一个文件描述到您的服务的接口，而另一个文件描述这个接口的实现。

name: imprison
trans: vt. 监禁；关押；使…下狱

sentences.english: The government imprisoned all opposition leaders.
sentences.chinese: 政府把反对派领导人全部监禁起来。

sentences.english: She was imprisoned within his strong arms.
sentences.chinese: 她被他强壮的手臂搂着。

sentences.english: Many elderly people feel imprisoned in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人感到待在自己家里跟坐牢一样。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone in prison or to keep them somewhere and prevent them from leaving

name: imprisonment
trans: n. 监禁，关押；坐牢；下狱

sentences.english: She was sentenced to seven years' imprisonment.
sentences.chinese: 她被判处7年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: Imprisonment is the state of being imprisoned

name: inability
trans: n. 无能力；无才能

sentences.english: Her inability to concentrate could cause an accident.
sentences.chinese: 她无法集中注意力可能会导致意外。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being unable to do something

name: inadequate
trans: adj. 不充分的，不适当的

sentences.english: inadequate resources
sentences.chinese: 资源缺乏

sentences.english: The new air conditioning system proved inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 新的空调系统不够好。

detailed_translations.english: not good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose

name: inappropriate
trans: adj. 不适当的；不相称的

sentences.english: There is no suggestion that clients have been sold inappropriate policies.
sentences.chinese: 没有迹象表明向客户出售过不适当的保险单。

detailed_translations.english: not suitable or right for a particular purpose or in a particular situation

name: incidence
trans: n. 发生率；影响；[光] 入射；影响范围

sentences.english: an area with a high incidence of crime
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率高的地区

sentences.english: the angle of incidence
sentences.chinese: 入射角

detailed_translations.english: the extent to which sth happens or has an effect

name: inclined
trans: v. 使…倾向（incline的过去分词）

sentences.english: Commandos are inclined to shoot first and ask questions later.
sentences.chinese: 突击队员往往会先开枪，然后再问话。

sentences.english: He was inclined to self-pity.
sentences.chinese: 他爱自怜。

detailed_translations.english: to be likely to do something or behave in a particular way

name: inclusion
trans: n. 包含；内含物

sentences.english: With the recent inclusions, there will be 28 delegates in all.
sentences.chinese: 连同新近加入的成员，总共将有28位代表。

detailed_translations.english: the act of including someone or something in a larger group or set, or the fact of being included in one

name: incur
trans: vt. 招致，引发；蒙受

sentences.english: And operational downtime caused by reliability or performance problems can incur opportunity costs if customers are unable to access your system or the business is unable to do its work.
sentences.chinese: 并且如果顾客不能访问你的系统或业务不能进行工作，那么由可靠性或性能问题引起的运作停工就会招致机会成本。

detailed_translations.english: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

name: indicator
trans: n. 指示器；[试剂] 指示剂；[计] 指示符；压力计

sentences.english: All the main economic indicators suggest that trade is improving.
sentences.chinese: 所有主要的经济指标都表明贸易情况正在改善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示器；[试剂] 指示剂；[计] 指示符；压力计
detailed_translations.english: something that can be regarded as a sign of something else

name: indictment
trans: n. 起诉书；控告

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: induce
trans: vt. 诱导；引起；引诱；感应

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

name: indulge
trans: vi. 沉溺；满足；放任

sentences.english: Only rarely will she indulge in a glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 她只是偶尔才会喝上杯葡萄酒。

sentences.english: He returned to Ohio so that he could indulge his passion for football.
sentences.chinese: 他重返俄亥俄以释放自己对足球的激情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉溺， 纵容自己， 肆意从事
detailed_translations.english: If you indulge in something or if you indulge yourself, you allow yourself to have or do something that you know you will enjoy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉溺于，满足；纵容，迁就
detailed_translations.english: to let someone have or do whatever they want, even if it is bad for them

name: inequality
trans: n. 不平等；不同；不平均

sentences.english: People are concerned about corruption and social inequality.
sentences.chinese: 人们对腐败和社会不公感到担忧。

detailed_translations.english: an unfair situation, in which some groups in society have more money, opportunities, power etc than others

name: infamous
trans: adj. 声名狼藉的；无耻的；邪恶的；不名誉的

sentences.english: an infamous killer
sentences.chinese: 臭名昭著的杀手

sentences.english: Los Angeles’ infamous smog
sentences.chinese: 恶名远播的洛杉矶雾霾

detailed_translations.chinese: 声名狼藉的；无耻的；邪恶的；不名誉的
detailed_translations.english: well known for being bad or evil

name: infant
trans: n. 婴儿；幼儿；未成年人

sentences.english: An infant’s skin is very sensitive.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的皮肤非常敏感。

sentences.english: infant formula milk
sentences.chinese: 婴(幼)儿配方奶

detailed_translations.english: a baby or very young child
intended for babies or very young children

name: infect
trans: vt. 感染，传染

sentences.english: People with the virus may feel perfectly well, but they can still infect others.
sentences.chinese: 带有这种病毒的人可能毫无症状，却仍可能传染他人。

sentences.english: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他们可能用中产阶级思想去影响别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone a disease

name: inflict
trans: vt. 造成；使遭受（损伤、痛苦等）；给予（打击等）

sentences.english: ...the damage being inflicted on industries by the recession.
sentences.chinese: …经济衰退给工业造成的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 造成；使遭受（损伤、痛苦等）；给予（打击等）
detailed_translations.english: To inflict harm or damage on someone or something means to make them suffer it

name: influential
trans: adj. 有影响的；有势力的

sentences.english: He had influential friends.
sentences.chinese: 他有一些有影响力的朋友。

sentences.english: a highly influential art magazine
sentences.chinese: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave

name: inherent
trans: adj. 固有的；内在的；与生俱来的，遗传的

sentences.english: Every business has its own inherent risks.
sentences.chinese: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

sentences.english: I’m afraid the problems you mention are inherent in the system.
sentences.chinese: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

name: inhibit
trans: vt. 抑制；禁止

sentences.english: An unhappy family life may inhibit children’s learning.
sentences.chinese: 不幸福的家庭生活可能会阻碍儿童的学习。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from growing or developing well

name: initiate
trans: n. 开始；新加入者，接受初步知识者

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

name: inject
trans: vt. 注入；注射

sentences.english: His son was injected with strong drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子被注射了强效的药。

detailed_translations.english: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

name: injection
trans: n. 注射；注射剂；充血；射入轨道

sentences.english: The nurse gave me a tetanus injection.
sentences.chinese: 护士给我打了破伤风预防针。

sentences.english: The children hate having injections.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们讨厌打针。

sentences.english: a fuel injection system
sentences.chinese: 燃料注入系统

detailed_translations.english: an act of putting a drug into someone’s body using a special needle

name: injustice
trans: n. 不公正；不讲道义

sentences.english: The movie deals with injustices suffered by Native Americans.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影讲述印第安人受到的不公正待遇。

sentences.english: He had developed a deep sense of social injustice.
sentences.chinese: 他深深感到社会的不公。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people are treated very unfairly and not given their rights

name: inmate
trans: n. (尤指)同院病人；同狱犯人；同被(收容所)收容者

sentences.english: ...education for prison inmates.
sentences.chinese: …对囚犯们的教育。

detailed_translations.chinese: (尤指)同院病人；同狱犯人；同被(收容所)收容者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is being kept in a prison

name: insertion
trans: n. 插入；嵌入；插入物

name: insider
trans: n. 内部的人，会员；熟悉内情者

sentences.english: an insider’s view of the way that a Japanese company works
sentences.chinese: 业内人士对日本公司运作方式的看法

detailed_translations.chinese: 内部的人，会员；熟悉内情者
detailed_translations.english: someone who has a special knowledge of a particular organization because they are part of it

name: inspect
trans: vt. 检查；视察；检阅

sentences.english: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.english: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it

name: inspection
trans: n. 视察，检查

sentences.english: An inspection was carried out at the school.
sentences.chinese: 有人来学校视察了一遍。

sentences.english: However, on closer inspection, a number of problems emerged.
sentences.chinese: 然而，经进一步检查，很多问题冒了出来。

detailed_translations.english: an official visit to a building or organization to check that everything is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed

name: inspiration
trans: n. 灵感；鼓舞；吸气；妙计

sentences.english: The Malvern Hills have provided inspiration for many artists and musicians over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 几十年来，莫尔文丘陵为很多艺术家和音乐家提供了灵感。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes to the altar as if seeking inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他抬头看看祭坛，似乎在寻求灵感。

sentences.english: He draws inspiration from ordinary scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他从日常生活中得到灵感。

sentences.english: Mary Quant’s inspiration comes from the glam style of the seventies.
sentences.chinese: 玛莉·官的灵感来自70年代的魅惑风格。

sentences.english: He had a sudden flash of inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他突然灵感闪现。

sentences.english: He has always been a source of inspiration for me.
sentences.chinese: 他一直是我灵感的源泉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵感； 鼓舞人心的人
detailed_translations.english: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

name: instinct
trans: n. 本能，直觉；天性

sentences.english: Her instinct told her that something was wrong.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她有些不对劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 本能； 直觉， 生性
detailed_translations.english: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know something, which is not learned

name: institutional
trans: adj. 制度的；制度上的

sentences.english: accusations of institutional racism in the police force
sentences.chinese: 对警察队伍中已形成风气的种族主义的谴责

detailed_translations.english: institutional attitudes and behaviour have existed for a long time in an organization and have become accepted as normal even though they are bad

name: instruct
trans: vt. 指导；通知；命令；教授

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

name: instrumental
trans: n. 器乐曲；工具字，工具格

sentences.english: ...a CD of vocal and instrumental music.
sentences.chinese: …一张声乐和器乐光盘。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐器的；有帮助的；仪器的，器械的
detailed_translations.english: instrumental music is for instruments, not for voices
a piece of music in which no voices are used, only instruments

name: insufficient
trans: adj. 不足的，不充足的；不胜任的；缺乏能力的

sentences.english: Insufficient resources have been devoted to the health service.
sentences.chinese: 用于医疗保健服务的资源不足。

detailed_translations.english: not enough, or not great enough

name: insult
trans: n. 侮辱；凌辱；无礼

sentences.english: Nobody insults my family and gets away with it!
sentences.chinese: 谁也别想侮辱了我的家人之后就这么算了！

sentences.english: I hope Andy won’t be insulted if I don’t come.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不来，希望安迪不要介意。

sentences.english: 200 for all that work? It’s an insult.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：干那么多工作才给200美元？这简直是侮辱。

detailed_translations.english: to offend someone by saying or doing something they think is rude
a remark or action that is offensive or deliberately rude

name: intact
trans: adj. 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的

sentences.english: Only the medieval tower had remained intact.
sentences.chinese: 只有这座中世纪塔楼保存完好。

sentences.english: His reputation survived intact.
sentences.chinese: 他的声望丝毫未受影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的
detailed_translations.english: not broken, damaged, or spoiled

name: intake
trans: n. 摄取量；通风口；引入口；引入的量

sentences.english: Your intake of alcohol should not exceed two units per day.
sentences.chinese: 你每天酒精摄入量不能超过两个单位。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of food, drink etc that you take into your body

name: integral
trans: n. 积分；部分；完整

sentences.english: Rituals, celebrations, and festivals form an integral part of every human society.
sentences.chinese: 仪式、庆典和节日是每个人类社会不可缺少的组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is an integral part of something is an essential part of that thing

name: integrated
trans: adj. 综合的；完整的；互相协调的

sentences.english: an integrated public transport system
sentences.chinese: 综合公共交通体系

sentences.english: a racially integrated community
sentences.chinese: 一个各种族和谐相处的社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合的；完整的；互相协调的
detailed_translations.english: an integrated system, institution etc combines many different groups, ideas, or parts in a way that works well

detailed_translations.chinese: 整合；使…成整体（integrate的过去分词）

name: integration
trans: n. 集成；综合

sentences.english: problems of racial integration
sentences.chinese: 种族融合的问题

detailed_translations.english: the combining of two or more things so that they work together effectively

name: integrity
trans: n. 完整；正直；诚实；廉正

sentences.english: I have always regarded him as a man of integrity.
sentences.chinese: 我一直把他当作一个正直诚实的人。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest and strong about what you believe to be right

name: intellectual
trans: n. 知识分子；凭理智做事者

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: intensify
trans: vt. 使加强，使强化；使变激烈

sentences.english: In Junethe civil war intensified.
sentences.chinese: 6月份内战更加激烈了。

sentences.english: His mother’s death intensified his loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 母亲的过世使他感到更加孤单。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in degree or strength, or to make something do this

name: intensity
trans: n. 强度；强烈；[电子] 亮度；紧张

sentences.english: The intensity of the hurricane was frightening.
sentences.chinese: 飓风的猛烈程度令人恐惧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈，剧烈；〔光、声等的〕强度
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being felt very strongly or having a strong effect

name: intensive
trans: n. 加强器

sentences.english: a one-week intensive course in English
sentences.chinese: 为期一周的英语强化课程

sentences.english: a day of intensive negotiations
sentences.chinese: 紧张谈判的一天

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time

name: intent
trans: n. 意图；目的；含义

sentences.english: his intent gaze
sentences.chinese: 他专注的凝视

detailed_translations.chinese: 专心的， 专注的； 急切的
detailed_translations.english: giving careful attention to something so that you think about nothing else
what you intend to do

name: interactive
trans: adj. 交互式的；相互作用的

sentences.english: interactive computer systems
sentences.chinese: 交互式电脑系统

sentences.english: the museum’s interactive exhibits
sentences.chinese: 博物馆的互动展品

detailed_translations.chinese: 互相作用的，互相影响的
detailed_translations.english: an interactive computer program, television system etc allows you to communicate directly with it, and does things in reaction to your actions

name: interface
trans: n. 界面；<计>接口；交界面

sentences.english: ...the development of better user interfaces.
sentences.chinese: …更好用户界面的开发。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which you see the information from a computer program on a screen, or how you type information into the program

detailed_translations.chinese: （使通过界面或接口）接合，连接；[计算机]使联系
detailed_translations.english: if you interface two parts of a computer system, or if they interface, you connect them

name: interfere
trans: vi. 干涉；妨碍；打扰

sentences.english: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

name: interference
trans: n. 干扰，冲突；干涉

sentences.english: Industrial relations should be free from state interference.
sentences.chinese: 劳资关系应不受政府干预。

detailed_translations.english: an act of interfering

name: interim
trans: n. 过渡时期，中间时期；暂定

sentences.english: an interim report
sentences.chinese: 中期报告

sentences.english: He received an interim payment of £10,000.
sentences.chinese: 他收到暂时支付的一万英镑。

sentences.english: An interim government was established.
sentences.chinese: 一个临时政府成立了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 临时的，暂时的；中间的；间歇的
detailed_translations.english: intended to be used or accepted for a short time only, until something or someone final can be made or found

detailed_translations.chinese: 过渡时期，中间时期；暂定
detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two events

name: interior
trans: n. 内部；本质

sentences.english: The interior walls are all painted white.
sentences.chinese: 室内墙壁都粉刷成了白色。

sentences.english: The interior of the church was dark.
sentences.chinese: 教堂里很暗。

detailed_translations.english: inside or indoors
the inner part or inside of something

name: intermediate
trans: n. [化学] 中间物；媒介

sentences.english: an intermediate coursebook
sentences.chinese: 中级课本

sentences.english: an intermediate stage/step in a process
sentences.chinese: 中间阶段 / 步骤

detailed_translations.english: having more than a basic knowledge of sth but not yet advanced

name: intervene
trans: vi. 干涉；调停；插入

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: intervention
trans: n. 介入；调停；妨碍

sentences.english: government intervention to regulate prices
sentences.chinese: 政府介入控制物价

detailed_translations.english: the act of becoming involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: intimate
trans: n. 知己；至交

sentences.english: an intimate friend of Picasso’s
sentences.chinese: 毕加索的一个密友

sentences.english: an intimate relationship
sentences.chinese: 亲密的关系

sentences.english: She’s on intimate terms with people in government.
sentences.chinese: 她与政府官员关系密切。

detailed_translations.english: having an extremely close friendship
a close personal friend
to make people understand what you mean without saying it directly

name: intriguing
trans: adj. 有趣的；迷人的

sentences.english: The magazine carries an intriguing mixture of high fashion, gossip and racing.
sentences.chinese: 这本杂志内容丰富有趣，有关时尚、花边新闻和赛马的内容都有。

detailed_translations.english: something that is intriguing is very interesting because it is strange, mysterious, or unexpected

name: investigator
trans: n. 研究者；调查者；侦查员

sentences.english: police investigators
sentences.chinese: 警探

detailed_translations.english: someone who investigates things, especially crimes

name: invisible
trans: adj. 无形的，看不见的；无形的；不显眼的，暗藏的

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

name: invoke
trans: vt. 调用；祈求；引起；恳求

sentences.english: a painting that invokes images of the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 使人联想到落基山脉的画

sentences.english: During his speech, he invoked the memory of Harry Truman.
sentences.chinese: 他演讲时使人想起哈里 · 杜鲁门。

detailed_translations.english: to make a particular idea, image, or feeling appear in people’s minds by describing an event or situation, or by talking about a person

name: involvement
trans: n. 牵连；包含；混乱；财政困难

sentences.english: School officials say they welcome parental involvement.
sentences.chinese: 校方说他们欢迎学生父母参与。

name: ironic
trans: adj. 讽刺的；反话的

sentences.english: Your car was stolen at the police station! How ironic!
sentences.chinese: 你的车在警察局被偷！真让人哭笑不得！

sentences.english: It’s ironic that her husband smoked for thirty years, and yet she’s the one who died of lung cancer.
sentences.chinese: 具有讽刺意味的是，她丈夫吸烟30年，而死于肺癌的却是她。

sentences.english: In an ironic twist , the most trustworthy character in the film turned out to be the thief.
sentences.chinese: 影片中故事情节来了一个出乎意料的转折，最可信赖的人原来是小偷。

detailed_translations.english: an ironic situation is one that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true

name: ironically
trans: adv. 讽刺地；说反话地

sentences.english: Ironically, his cold got better on the last day of his holiday.
sentences.chinese: 具有讽刺意味的是，他的感冒竟在假期的最后一天有所好转。

detailed_translations.chinese: 具有讽刺意味地；嘲讽地
detailed_translations.english: used when talking about a situation in which the opposite of what you expected happens or is true

name: irony
trans: n. 讽刺；反语；具有讽刺意味的事

sentences.english: Life is full of little ironies.
sentences.chinese: 生活中充满了小小的讽刺。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true

name: irrelevant
trans: adj. 不相干的；不切题的

sentences.english: We’re focussing too much on irrelevant details.
sentences.chinese: 我们过于关注不相干的细节。

sentences.english: Students viewed Latin as boring and irrelevant.
sentences.chinese: 学生认为拉丁语无聊且无关紧要。

detailed_translations.english: not useful or not relating to a particular situation, and therefore not important

name: isolation
trans: n. 隔离；孤立；[电] 绝缘；[化学] 离析

sentences.english: Because of its geographical isolation, the area developed its own unique culture.
sentences.chinese: 由于地理上的隔绝，该地区发展了自己独特的文化。

sentences.english: The mansion sits in splendid isolation on top of the hill (= it is far from everything and looks impressive ).
sentences.chinese: 宅邸位于山顶，远离尘嚣。

sentences.english: a patient’s isolation period
sentences.chinese: 病人的隔离期

detailed_translations.english: when one group, person, or thing is separate from others

name: judicial
trans: adj. 公正的，明断的；法庭的；审判上的

sentences.english: ...an independent judicial system.
sentences.chinese: …一个独立的司法体系。

sentences.english: ...efforts to manipulate the judicial process.
sentences.chinese: …操纵审判程序的努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公正的，明断的；法庭的；审判上的
detailed_translations.english: Judicial means relating to the legal system and to judgments made in a court of law

name: junction
trans: n. 连接，接合；交叉点；接合点

sentences.english: the junction of Abbot Road and Mill Street
sentences.chinese: 阿伯特路与米尔街的交叉口

sentences.english: Junction 5 on the M40
sentences.chinese: 40号高速公路上的第5交叉口

detailed_translations.english: a place where one road, track etc joins another

name: jurisdiction
trans: n. 司法权，审判权，管辖权；权限，权力

sentences.english: The British police have no jurisdiction over foreign bank accounts.
sentences.chinese: 英国警方对外国银行的账户没有司法管辖权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 司法权，审判权，管辖权；权限，权力
detailed_translations.english: the right to use an official power to make legal decisions, or the area where this right exists

name: just
trans: adv. 只是，仅仅；刚才，刚刚；正好，恰好；实在；刚要

sentences.english: A good strong cup of coffee is just what I need right now.
sentences.chinese: 我现在正需要喝一杯浓浓的咖啡。

sentences.english: The house was large and roomy; just right for us.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子大而宽敞，正合我们的需要。

sentences.english: She looks just like her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去就像她妈妈。

sentences.english: It’s nothing serious – just a small cut.
sentences.chinese: 不要紧，只不过是个小伤口。

sentences.english: John’s just told me that he’s getting married.
sentences.chinese: 约翰刚刚告诉我他要结婚了。

detailed_translations.english: exactly

name: justification
trans: n. 理由；辩护；认为有理，认为正当；释罪

sentences.english: Hoggart felt, with some justification, that his colleagues had let him down.
sentences.chinese: 霍加特觉得同事令他失望，这是有理由的。

detailed_translations.english: a good and acceptable reason for doing something

name: kidnap
trans: vt. 绑架；诱拐；拐骗

sentences.english: Police appealed for wit­nesses after a woman was kidnapped at gunpoint.
sentences.chinese: 一名妇女遭到持枪绑架，警方呼吁目击者挺身而出。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone somewhere illegally by force, often in order to get money for returning them

name: kidney
trans: n. [解剖] 肾脏；腰子；个性

sentences.english: a kidney transplant
sentences.chinese: 肾脏移植

detailed_translations.english: one of the two organs in your lower back that separate waste products from your blood and make urine

name: kingdom
trans: n. 王国；界；领域

sentences.english: the United Kingdom
sentences.chinese: 联合王国

sentences.english: the animal/plant/mineral kingdom
sentences.chinese: 动物界/植物界/矿物界〔大自然三界〕

detailed_translations.english: a country ruled by a king or queen

name: lad
trans: n. 少年，小伙子；家伙

sentences.english: a young lad
sentences.chinese: 小伙子

sentences.english: Things were different when I was a lad.
sentences.chinese: 我年轻的时候，情况可不大相同。

detailed_translations.english: a boy or young man

name: landlord
trans: n. 房东，老板；地主

sentences.english: His landlord doubled the rent.
sentences.chinese: 他的房东把房租提高了一倍。

detailed_translations.english: a man who rents a room, building, or piece of land to someone

name: landmark
trans: n. [航]陆标；地标；界标；里程碑；纪念碑；地界标；划时代的事

name: lap
trans: n. 一圈；膝盖；下摆；山坳

sentences.english: Rubens Barrichello finished a lap ahead of his team-mate.
sentences.chinese: 鲁本斯·巴里切罗领先队友一圈跑完全程。

detailed_translations.english: a single journey arounda race track
if water laps something or laps against something such as the shore or a boat, it moves against it or hits it in small waves

name: large-scale
trans: adj. 大规模的，大范围的；大比例尺的

sentences.english: a large-scale rescue operation
sentences.chinese: 大规模的营救行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 大规模的， 大范围的
detailed_translations.english: using or involving a lot of effort, people, supplies etc

name: laser
trans: n. 激光

sentences.english: laser surgery
sentences.chinese: 激光(外科)手术

detailed_translations.english: a beam of light produced by a laser

name: latter
trans: adj. 后者的；近来的；后面的；较后的

sentences.english: In the latter case, buyers pay a 15% commission.
sentences.chinese: 在后一种情况下，买家付15%的佣金。

detailed_translations.english: being the second of two people or things, or the last in a list just mentioned

name: lawn
trans: n. 草地；草坪

sentences.english: I spent all morning mowing the lawn (= cutting the grass ).
sentences.chinese: 我整个上午都在修剪草坪。

sentences.english: a carefully tended lawn
sentences.chinese: 受到细心呵护的草坪

detailed_translations.english: an area of ground in a garden or park that is covered with short grass

name: lawsuit
trans: n. 诉讼（尤指非刑事案件）；诉讼案件

sentences.english: The dispute culminated last week in a lawsuit against the government.
sentences.chinese: 这场针对政府诉讼案的争论在上星期达到了高潮。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or organization brings to a court of law to be settled

name: layout
trans: n. 布局；设计；安排；陈列

sentences.english: All the flats in the building had the same layout.
sentences.chinese: 大楼里所有的公寓布局都是一样的。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something such as a town, garden, or building is arranged

name: leak
trans: n. 泄漏；漏洞，裂缝

sentences.english: The roof is leaking.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶在漏水。

sentences.english: A tanker is leaking oil off the coast of Scotland.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰海岸附近有一艘油轮漏油。

sentences.english: 英语例句：The boat had sprung a leak (= a hole had appeared in it ).
sentences.chinese: 小船出现了漏洞。

detailed_translations.english: if a container, pipe, roof etc leaks, or if it leaks gas, liquid etc, there is a small hole or crack in it that lets gas or liquid flow through
a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow into or out of something

name: leap
trans: vi. 跳，跳跃

sentences.english: She leapt over the fence.
sentences.chinese: 她跳过篱笆。

sentences.english: He threw a stick into the river and the dog went after it in a flying leap.
sentences.chinese: 他把一根枝条扔到河里，那条狗一个飞跃就追了过去。

detailed_translations.english: to jump high into the air or to jump in order to land in a different place
a big jump

name: legacy
trans: n. 遗赠，遗产

sentences.english: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
sentences.chinese: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
detailed_translations.english: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

name: legendary
trans: adj. 传说的，传奇的

sentences.english: Lonnie Johnson, the legendary blues guitarist
sentences.chinese: 传奇蓝调吉他手朗尼·约翰逊

sentences.english: Her singing was legendary.
sentences.chinese: 她唱歌非常有名。

detailed_translations.english: very famous and admired

name: legislation
trans: n. 立法；法律

sentences.english: This is a very important piece of legislation (= law ).
sentences.chinese: 这是一条非常重要的法规。

detailed_translations.english: a law or set of laws

name: legislative
trans: adj. 立法的；有立法权的

sentences.english: The new assemblies will have no legislative power.
sentences.chinese: 新的议会将没有立法权。

sentences.english: new legislative measures to stem the flow of drugs into the US
sentences.chinese: 遏制毒品流入美国的新的立法措施

detailed_translations.english: concerned with making laws

name: legislature
trans: n. 立法机关；立法机构

sentences.english: The proposals before the legislature include the creation of two special courts to deal exclusively with violent crimes.
sentences.chinese: 摆在议会面前的提案包括建立两个特殊法庭专门审理暴力犯罪案件。
