detailed_translations.english: an institution that has the power to make or change laws

name: legitimate
trans: adj. 合法的；正当的；合理的；正统的

sentences.english: So all of this is a legitimate source of concern.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这些情况都是引发忧虑的合理根源。

sentences.english: Even though I had legitimate reasons ( bullshit ). You know I have to make them dividends ( bullshit ).
sentences.chinese: 即使我有合法的理由（胡说）。你知道我必须支付利息（胡说）。

sentences.english: Often, as in this case, there is no intentional hoaxing: It is a legitimate, straightforward photograph of something curious.
sentences.chinese: 就像此事一样，它们通常都是无意的闹剧：这是某些稀奇的东西合法的、易懂的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当的， 合理的； 合法的
detailed_translations.english: fair or reasonable

name: lengthy
trans: adj. 漫长的，冗长的；啰唆的

sentences.english: A lengthy period of training is required.
sentences.chinese: 需要很长一段时间的培训。

sentences.english: An accident is causing some lengthy delays.
sentences.chinese: 一起事故造成长时间的延误。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time, often too long

name: lesbian
trans: adj. [心理] 女同性恋的

sentences.english: ...a woman who had contacts in the homosexual and lesbian community.
sentences.chinese: …和男、女同性恋团体有联系的一个女人。

detailed_translations.english: Lesbian is used to describe homosexual women
a woman who is sexually attracted to other women

name: lesser
trans: adj. 较少的；次要的；更小的

name: lethal
trans: adj. 致命的，致死的

sentences.english: a lethal dose of heroin
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的海洛因

sentences.english: a lethal weapon
sentences.chinese: 致命的武器

sentences.english: death by lethal injection
sentences.chinese: 注入致命剂量造成的死亡

sentences.english: a lethal cocktail of drink and pills
sentences.chinese: 一种酒和药的致命混合物

detailed_translations.english: causing death, or able to cause death

name: liable
trans: adj. 有责任的，有义务的；应受罚的；有…倾向的；易…的

sentences.english: The car is liable to overheat on long trips.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车跑长途容易过热。

detailed_translations.english: likely to be affected by a particular kind of problem, illness etc

name: liberal
trans: adj. 自由主义的；慷慨的；不拘泥的；宽大的

sentences.english: I had quite liberal parents.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母思想很开明。

sentences.english: a liberal supply of drinks
sentences.chinese: 饮料的充足供应

detailed_translations.english: willing to understand and respect other people’s ideas, opinions, and feelings

name: liberation
trans: n. 释放，解放

sentences.english: They pant after liberation.
sentences.chinese: 他们渴望解放。

sentences.english: All his life was submerged in the liberation of the people.
sentences.chinese: 他的一生全部献身于人民的解放事业。

sentences.english: They consecrated their lives to the liberation of their motherland.
sentences.chinese: 他们把生命献给了祖国的解放事业。

name: liberty
trans: n. 自由；许可；冒失

sentences.english: the fight for liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 争取自由和平等的斗争

detailed_translations.english: the freedom and the right to do whatever you want without asking permission or being afraid of authority

name: license
trans: n. 执照，许可证；特许

sentences.english: No special license will be regranted to anyone from now on.
sentences.chinese: 特殊许可证今后不得向任何人再行发放。

sentences.english: Remind me to renew the driver's license.It will lapse next month.
sentences.chinese: 提醒我更换驾驶执照，它下个月就失效了。

sentences.english: The next time the client connects to the server, it will obtain another license.
sentences.chinese: 在客户端下一次连接到服务器时，它将获得另一个许可证。

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for someone to do or produce something, or for an activity to take place

name: lifelong
trans: adj. 终身的

sentences.english: She became a lifelong friend of ours.
sentences.chinese: 她成了我们一辈子的朋友。

sentences.english: David finally realized his lifelong ambition.
sentences.chinese: 戴维终于实现了他毕生的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: continuing or existing all through your life

name: likelihood
trans: n. 可能性，可能

sentences.english: Using a seatbelt will reduce the likelihood of serious injury in a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 系安全带可以降低在车祸中受重伤的可能性。

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which something can reasonably be expected to happen

name: limb
trans: n. 肢，臂；分支；枝干

sentences.english: She would be able to stretch out her cramped limbs and rest for a few hours.
sentences.chinese: 她将可以伸开蜷缩的四肢，休息几个小时。

sentences.english: She sat on a limb of the tree and looked down.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：她坐在一根大树枝上往下看.

detailed_translations.english: an arm or leg

name: linear
trans: adj. 线的，线型的；直线的，线状的；长度的

sentences.english: a linear diagram
sentences.chinese: 线形图

sentences.english: linear measurements
sentences.chinese: 长度量度

detailed_translations.english: consisting of lines, or in the form of a straight line

name: line-up
trans: vt. 排成直线；排成行

name: linger
trans: vi. 徘徊；苟延残喘；磨蹭

sentences.english: He surprised all the doctors by lingering on for several weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他拖了几个星期才去世，让所有的医生都很惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: to continue looking at or dealing with something for longer than is usual or desirable

name: listing
trans: n. 列表，清单

detailed_translations.english: an official or public list

name: literacy
trans: n. 读写能力；精通文学

sentences.english: a new adult literacy campaign
sentences.chinese: 新一轮成人识字[扫盲]运动

detailed_translations.chinese: 识字， 有文化， 读写能力
detailed_translations.english: the state of being able to read and write

name: liver
trans: n. 肝脏；生活者，居民

sentences.english: Three weeks ago, it was discovered the cancer had spread to his liver.
sentences.chinese: 三周前，发现癌已扩散到了他的肝脏。

detailed_translations.english: a large organ in your body that produces bile and cleans your blood

name: lobby
trans: n. 大厅；休息室；会客室；游说议员的团体

sentences.english: a hotel lobby
sentences.chinese: 宾馆大堂

sentences.english: I’ll meet you in the entrance lobby.
sentences.chinese: 我们在入口大厅见。

sentences.english: The group is lobbying for a reduction in defence spending.
sentences.chinese: 该团体正在游说政府削减国防开支。

detailed_translations.english: a wide passage or large hall just inside the entrance to a public building
to try to persuade the government or someone with political power that a law or situation should be changed

name: log
trans: vi. 伐木

sentences.english: a roaring log fire
sentences.chinese: 原木燃烧的熊熊大火

detailed_translations.english: a thick piece of wood from a tree
to make an official record of events, facts etc

name: logic
trans: n. 逻辑；逻辑学；逻辑性

sentences.english: There is a certain logic in their choice of architect.
sentences.chinese: 他们对建筑师的选择是有一定道理的。

detailed_translations.english: a way of thinking about something that seems correct and reasonable, or a set of sensible reasons for doing something

name: long-standing
trans: adj. 长期存在的；存在已久的

name: long-time
trans: adj. 长期；长期载荷

name: loom
trans: n. 织布机；若隐若现的景象

sentences.english: Vincent loomed over me, as pale and grey as a tombstone.
sentences.chinese: 文森特赫然出现在我面前，脸色苍白阴沉得像块墓碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 织布机；若隐若现的景象
detailed_translations.english: a frame or machine on which thread is woven into cloth

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕地出现；朦胧地出现；隐约可见
detailed_translations.english: to appear as a large unclear shape, especially in a threatening way

name: loop
trans: vi. 打环；翻筋斗

sentences.english: He looped the rope over the wood.
sentences.chinese: 他把绳子打了环系在木头上。

detailed_translations.english: to fly a plane up and around in a circle so that the plane is  upside down  for a time
a shape like a curve or a circle made by a line curving back towards itself, or a piece of wire, string etc that has this shape

name: loyalty
trans: n. 忠诚；忠心；忠实；忠于…感情

sentences.english: Elizabeth understood her husband’s loyalty to his sister.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白理解丈夫对他姐姐的一片忠心。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of remaining faithful to your friends, principles, country etc

name: machinery
trans: n. 机械；机器；机构；机械装置

sentences.english: ...quality tools and machinery.
sentences.chinese: …优质工具和机械。

detailed_translations.english: You can use machinery to refer to machines in general, or machines that are used in a factory or on a farm

name: magical
trans: adj. 魔术的；有魔力的

sentences.english: magical powers
sentences.chinese: 魔力

detailed_translations.english: relating to magic or able to do magic

name: magistrate
trans: n. 地方法官；文职官员；治安推事

sentences.english: She will face a local magistrate on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 她将在星期二面见一位地方治安法官。

detailed_translations.english: someone, not usually a lawyer, who works as a judge in a local court of law, dealing with less serious crimes

name: magnetic
trans: adj. 地磁的；有磁性的；有吸引力的

sentences.english: magnetic forces
sentences.chinese: 磁力

sentences.english: a magnetic personality
sentences.chinese: 富有魅力的个性

detailed_translations.english: concerning or produced by  magnetism

name: magnitude
trans: n. 大小；量级；[地震] 震级；重要；光度

sentences.english: an increase of this order of magnitude
sentences.chinese: 如此大幅度的增长

sentences.english: The star varies in brightness by about three magnitudes.
sentences.chinese: 星体的亮度大约分三个星等。

detailed_translations.english: the great size or importance of something

name: mainland
trans: n. 大陆；本土

sentences.english: flights between a Greek island and the mainland
sentences.chinese: 希腊一海岛和本土之间的航班

detailed_translations.english: the main area of land that forms a country, as compared to islands near it that are also part of that country

name: mainstream
trans: n. 主流

sentences.english: Genet started as a rebel, but soon became part of the literary mainstream.
sentences.chinese: 热内起初很叛逆，但不久就回归了文学主流。

detailed_translations.english: the most usual ideas or methods, or the people who have these ideas or methods

name: maintenance
trans: n. 维护，维修；保持；生活费用

sentences.english: the cost of repairs and maintenance
sentences.chinese: 维修保养费

sentences.english: The theatres were closed on Saturday and Sunday for routine maintenance .
sentences.chinese: 戏院周六和周日关闭进行例行维护。

sentences.english: Engineers are carrying out essential maintenance work on the main line to Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 机修工正在对通往剑桥的干线进行必要的养护。

sentences.english: an evening class in car maintenance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保养的夜校课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 维持； 保养； 抚养费
detailed_translations.english: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition

name: mandate
trans: n. 授权；命令，指令；委托管理；受命进行的工作

sentences.english: Matters debated in meetings do not become a mandate automatically.
sentences.chinese: 会议上讨论的事宜并不能自动成为一项指令。

detailed_translations.chinese: 授权；命令，指令；委托管理；受命进行的工作
detailed_translations.english: if a government or official has a mandate to make important decisions, they have the authority to make the decisions because they have been elected by the people to do so
to give someone the right or power to do something

name: mandatory
trans: adj. 强制的；托管的；命令的

sentences.english: Murder carries a mandatory life sentence .
sentences.chinese: 谋杀罪依照法律要判无期徒刑。

sentences.english: The Council has made it mandatory for all nurses to attend a refresher course every three years.
sentences.chinese: 理事会规定所有护士必须每三年参加一次进修课程。

detailed_translations.english: if something is mandatory, the law says it must be done

name: manifest
trans: vt. 证明，表明；显示

sentences.english: The shareholders have manifested their intention to sell the shares.
sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling, attitude etc
a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
plain and easy to see

name: manipulate
trans: vt. 操纵；操作；巧妙地处理；篡改

sentences.english: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。

sentences.english: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them

name: manipulation
trans: n. 操纵；操作；处理；篡改

sentences.english: They make a lot of money by clever manipulation of the Stock Market.
sentences.chinese: 他们巧妙地操纵股票市场而大赚其钱。

name: manuscript
trans: n. [图情] 手稿；原稿

sentences.english: Unfortunately, parts of the original manuscript have been lost.
sentences.chinese: 遗憾的是，部分原始手稿丢失了。

detailed_translations.english: a book or piece of writing before it is printed

name: March
trans: n. 三月

sentences.english: She started work here last March.
sentences.chinese: 她去年3月开始在这儿工作。

detailed_translations.english: the third month of the year, between February and April

name: march
trans: n. 三月

sentences.english: On 29 August the royal army marched into Inverness.
sentences.chinese: 8月29日皇家军队开进因弗内斯。

sentences.english: The police decided not to ban the march.
sentences.chinese: 警方决定不禁止这次示威游行。

detailed_translations.english: if soldiers or other people march somewhere, they walk there quickly with firm regular steps
an organized event in which many people walk together to express their ideas or protest about something

name: marginal
trans: adj. 边缘的；临界的；末端的

sentences.english: marginal groups in society
sentences.chinese: 社会中的非主流群体

sentences.english: marginal notes
sentences.chinese: 边注（旁注）

detailed_translations.english: not part of a main or important group or situation

name: marine
trans: adj. 船舶的；海生的；海产的；航海的，海运的

sentences.english: the enormous variety of marine life
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物繁多的种类

sentences.english: the effects of oil pollution on marine mammals
sentences.chinese: 石油污染对海洋哺乳动物的影响

sentences.english: marine biology
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物学

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sea and the creatures that live there

name: marketplace
trans: n. 市场；商场；市集

sentences.english: Some retailers worry that new regulations will hurt their ability to compete in the marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 有些零售商担心新规定会削弱他们的市场竞争力。

detailed_translations.english: the part of business activity that is concerned with buying and selling goods in competition with other companies

name: mask
trans: n. 面具；口罩；掩饰

sentences.english: a surgical face mask
sentences.chinese: 外科手术口罩

sentences.english: He was attacked and robbed by two people wearing masks .
sentences.chinese: 他被两个蒙面人袭击并抢劫。

detailed_translations.english: something that covers all or part of your face, to protect or to hide it
if a smell, taste, sound etc is masked by a stronger one, it cannot be noticed because of the stronger one

name: massacre
trans: vt. 残杀；彻底击败

sentences.english: The army massacred more than 150 unarmed civilians.
sentences.chinese: 军队屠杀了150多名手无寸铁的平民。

sentences.english: the only survivor of the massacre
sentences.chinese: 这场大屠杀的唯一幸存者

detailed_translations.english: to kill a lot of people or animals in a violent way, especially when they cannot defend themselves
when a lot of people are killed violently, especially people who cannot defend themselves

name: mathematical
trans: adj. 数学的，数学上的；精确的

sentences.english: mathematical analysis
sentences.chinese: 数学分析

sentences.english: the development of mathematical skills
sentences.chinese: 数学技能的发展

sentences.english: a mathematical genius
sentences.chinese: 数学天才

detailed_translations.english: relating to or using mathematics

name: mature
trans: adj. 成熟的；充分考虑的；到期的；成年人的

sentences.english: Laura is very mature for her age.
sentences.chinese: 相对她的年龄来说劳拉是很成熟的。

sentences.english: We’re mature enough to disagree on this issue but still respect each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们都很成熟，尽管我们对此事意见不同，但还是彼此尊重。

sentences.english: As the fish matures, its colours and patternings change.
sentences.chinese: 随着发育成熟，这种鱼的颜色和斑纹都会改变。

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a child or young person, who is mature behaves in a sensible and reasonable way, as you would expect an adult to behave
to become fully grown or developed

name: maximize
trans: vt. 取…最大值；对…极为重视

sentences.english: We need to maximize the space.
sentences.chinese: 我们要充分利用空间。

detailed_translations.english: to  click  on a special part on a window on a computer screen so that it becomes as big as the screen

name: meaningful
trans: adj. 有意义的；意味深长的

sentences.english: Sam and Barbara exchanged meaningful glances.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆和芭芭拉交换了会意的眼神。

detailed_translations.english: a look that clearly expresses the way someone feels, even though nothing is said

name: meantime
trans: n. 其时，其间

sentences.english: My first novel was rejected by six publishers. In the meantime I had written a play.
sentences.chinese: 我的第一部小说遭到六家出版商的拒绝。其间我又完成了一部戏剧。

sentences.english: The doctor will be here soon. In the meantime, try and relax.
sentences.chinese: 医生很快就来，现在尽量放松一下。

sentences.english: I'll contact them soon. Meantime don't tell them I'm back.
sentences.chinese: 我会尽快和他们联系。在此期间，不要告诉他们我回来了。

detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two times or two events
英文释义: meanwhile

name: medieval
trans: adj. 中世纪的；原始的；仿中世纪的；老式的

sentences.english: These spices were first brought to Italy from the East in medieval times.
sentences.chinese: 这些香料最早是在中世纪时从东方被带到了意大利。

sentences.english: a medieval castle
sentences.chinese: 一座中世纪城堡

detailed_translations.english: connected with the Middle Ages (= the period between about 1100 and 1500 AD )

name: meditation
trans: n. 冥想；沉思，深思

sentences.english: Yoga involves breathing exercises, stretching, and meditation.
sentences.chinese: 瑜伽包括呼吸训练、伸展和冥想。

sentences.english: She found him sitting alone, deep in meditation.
sentences.chinese: 她发现他独自坐着，陷入沉思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 默想，冥想；沉思，深思，思考
detailed_translations.english: the practice of emptying your mind of thoughts and feelings, in order to relax completely or for religious reasons

name: melody
trans: n. 旋律；歌曲；美妙的音乐

sentences.english: They played some lovely melodies.
sentences.chinese: 他们演奏了一些动听的曲子。

sentences.english: a haunting melody
sentences.chinese: 难以忘怀的曲调

detailed_translations.english: a song or tune

name: memo
trans: n. 备忘录

sentences.english: I sent him a memo reminding him about the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我发给他一个通知，提醒他开会的事。

detailed_translations.english: a short official note to another person in the same company or organization

name: memoir
trans: n. 回忆录；研究报告；自传；实录

sentences.english: Lady Thatcher had just published her memoirs.
sentences.chinese: 撒切尔夫人刚刚出版了她的回忆录。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回忆录；研究报告；自传；实录
detailed_translations.english: a book by someone important and famous in which they write about their life and experiences

name: memorial
trans: n. 纪念碑，纪念馆；纪念仪式；纪念物

sentences.english: A memorial service is being held for her at St. Paul's Church.
sentences.chinese: 一场为她举行的纪念仪式正在圣保罗教堂举行。

sentences.english: The hospital was built as a memorial to King Edward VII.
sentences.chinese: 该医院是为了纪念国王爱德华七世而建的。

detailed_translations.english: done or made in order to remind people of someone who has died
something, especially a stone with writing on it, that reminds people of someone who has died

name: mentor
trans: n. 指导者，良师益友

sentences.english: Leon Sullivan was my mentor and my friend.
sentences.chinese: 利昂·沙利文既是我的导师，也是我的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: an experienced person who advises and helps a less experienced person

name: merchant
trans: n. 商人，批发商；店主

sentences.english: the son of a wealthy merchant
sentences.chinese: 一名富商的儿子

sentences.english: There's been a big reduction in the size of the merchant fleet in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来商船队的数量大为缩减。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and sells goods in large quantities
Merchant seamen or ships are involved in carrying goods for trade

name: mercy
trans: n. 仁慈，宽容；怜悯；幸运；善行

sentences.english: He showed no mercy to his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 他对敌人毫不仁慈。

sentences.english: God have mercy on his soul.
sentences.chinese: 愿上帝宽恕他的灵魂。

detailed_translations.english: if someone shows mercy, they choose to forgive or to be kind to someone who they have the power to hurt or punish

name: mere
trans: adj. 仅仅的；只不过的

sentences.english: She lost the election by a mere 20 votes.
sentences.chinese: 她仅仅以20票之差落选。

name: merely
trans: adv. 仅仅，只不过；只是

sentences.english: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is

name: merge
trans: vt. 合并；使合并；吞没

sentences.english: The company plans to merge its subsidiaries in the US.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划合并其在美国的几家子公司。

detailed_translations.english: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

name: merger
trans: n. （企业等的）合并；并购；吸收（如刑法中重罪吸收轻罪）

sentences.english: merger negotiations
sentences.chinese: 合并谈判

detailed_translations.chinese: （企业等的）合并；并购；吸收（如刑法中重罪吸收轻罪）
detailed_translations.english: the joining together of two or more companies or organizations to form one larger one

name: merit
trans: n. 优点，价值；功绩；功过

sentences.english: The merit of the report is its realistic assessment of the changes required.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的优点就是它对所要求的变动进行了实事求是的评估。

sentences.english: The great merit of the project is its flexibility and low cost.
sentences.chinese: 该项目最大的优点是它的灵活性和低成本。

sentences.english: Each of these approaches to teaching has its merits .
sentences.chinese: 这些教学方法每一种都有其优点。

sentences.english: Tonight’s meeting will weigh up the relative merits of the two candidates.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的会议将对两位候选人的相对优点进行考量。

sentences.english: It’s a fascinating book which merits attention.
sentences.chinese: 这是本引人入胜的书，值得关注。

detailed_translations.english: an advantage or good feature of something
to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

name: methodology
trans: n. 方法学，方法论

sentences.english: Teaching methodologies vary according to the topic.
sentences.chinese: 教学方法因题目而不同。

detailed_translations.english: A methodology is a system of methods and principles for doing something, for example for teaching or for carrying out research

name: midst
trans: n. 当中，中间

sentences.english: I fear we have an enemy in our midst.
sentences.chinese: 我担心我们中间有内奸。

detailed_translations.english: in a particular group
surrounded by people or things

name: migration
trans: n. 迁移；移民；移动

sentences.english: What does this migration not do?
sentences.chinese: 这种迁移不能做什么？

sentences.english: Because of this and other differences in the two versions, we recommend that you test the maps after migration.
sentences.chinese: 由于这两个版本之间的种种差异，我们建议您在完成迁移后对映射进行测试。

detailed_translations.english: when large numbers of people go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: militant
trans: adj. 好战的

sentences.english: militant political activists
sentences.chinese: 激进的政治活动家

sentences.english: a militant animal rights group
sentences.chinese: 激进的动物权利保护团体

sentences.english: After the assassination of Martin Luther King, black leaders became more militant.
sentences.chinese: 马丁•路德•金遇刺后，黑人领袖变得更为激进了。

sentences.english: Even now we could not be sure that the militants would not find some new excuse to call a strike the following winter.
sentences.chinese: 即使到现在，我们也不能确定这些激进分子不会找到某个新的借口在下一年冬天号召一场罢工。

detailed_translations.english: a militant organization or person is willing to use strong or violent action in order to achieve political or social change

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有战斗性的人；好斗者；激进分子
detailed_translations.english: Militant is also a noun

name: militia
trans: n. 民兵组织；自卫队；义勇军；国民军

sentences.english: He joined the local militia as soon as he was 16.
sentences.chinese: 他一到16岁就加入了当地民兵队伍。

sentences.english: a militia leader
sentences.chinese: 民兵组织的领导人

sentences.english: a left-wing militia group
sentences.chinese: 左翼民兵团体

detailed_translations.chinese: 民兵组织；自卫队；义勇军；国民军
detailed_translations.english: a group of people trained as soldiers, who are not part of the permanent army

name: mill
trans: vi. 乱转；被碾磨

sentences.english: All our flours are milled using traditional methods.
sentences.chinese: 我们所有的面粉全是用传统方法碾磨的。

sentences.english: Add some freshly milled black pepper.
sentences.chinese: 加一些现磨的黑胡椒粉。

detailed_translations.english: to crush grain, pepper etc in a mill

detailed_translations.chinese: 磨坊；碾磨机；制造厂，工厂
detailed_translations.english: a building containing a large machine for crushing grain into flour

name: minimal
trans: adj. 最低的；最小限度的

sentences.english: The storm caused only minimal damage.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨只造成了轻微破坏。

sentences.english: The cost to taxpayers would be minimal.
sentences.chinese: 纳税人的支出将是最少的。

sentences.english: This is a practical course, with only a minimal amount of theory.
sentences.chinese: 这是实践课程，只有少量理论。

detailed_translations.english: very small in degree or amount, especially the smallest degree or amount possible

name: minimize
trans: vt. 使减到最少；小看，极度轻视

sentences.english: Every effort is being made to minimize civilian casualties.
sentences.chinese: 正在尽最大努力减少平民伤亡。

sentences.english: The rail company is bringing in more trains in an effort to minimize disruption to travellers.
sentences.chinese: 铁路公司正投入更多的列车来减少旅客的不便。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something that is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant to the smallest possible amount or degree

name: mining
trans: n. 矿业；采矿

sentences.english: ...traditional industries such as coal mining and steel making.
sentences.chinese: …像采煤和炼钢这样的传统工业。

detailed_translations.english: the work or industry of getting gold, coal etc out of the earth

name: ministry
trans: n. （政府的）部门

sentences.english: the Ministry of Agriculture
sentences.chinese: 农业部

sentences.english: Converted in his early teens, he entered the ministry (= started working as a church leader ) in 1855.
sentences.chinese: 他十三四岁皈依基督教，1855年当上牧师。

sentences.english: the ministry of Jesus
sentences.chinese: 耶稣的传道工作

detailed_translations.chinese: （政府的）部；；（全体）牧师；牧师的职责
detailed_translations.english: a government department that is responsible for one of the areas of government work, such as education or health

name: minute
trans: n. 分，分钟；片刻，一会儿；备忘录，笔记；会议记录

sentences.english: It takes me ten minutes to walk to work.
sentences.chinese: 我步行上班要用十分钟。

sentences.english: The train arrived at four minutes past eight.
sentences.chinese: 火车于八点零四分到达。

sentences.english: He returned a few minutes later.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟后他回来了。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you at the car in five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 五分钟后我在车那儿和你见面。

sentences.english: Sam thought for a minute, then smiled at his brother.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆想了一下，然后冲着他的兄弟笑了。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour

name: miracle
trans: n. 奇迹，奇迹般的人或物；惊人的事例

sentences.english: It’s a miracle you weren’t killed!
sentences.chinese: 你没有死真是奇迹！

sentences.english: By some miracle, we managed to catch the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们奇迹般地赶上了飞机。

sentences.english: the economic miracle of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济奇迹

sentences.english: She’s our miracle baby.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们的奇迹宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: something very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible

name: misery
trans: n. 痛苦，悲惨；不幸；苦恼；穷困

sentences.english: What we are witnessing here is human misery on a vast scale.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这里所目睹的情景是许许多多的人都生活困苦。

sentences.english: the misery of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 失业的痛苦

sentences.english: the miseries of war
sentences.chinese: 战争造成的苦难

detailed_translations.english: great suffering that is caused for example by being very poor or very sick

name: misleading
trans: adj. 令人误解的；引入歧途的

sentences.english: The article was misleading, and the newspaper has apologized.
sentences.chinese: 那篇文章具有误导性，那家报纸已致歉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人误解的， 导致错误结论的； 引入歧途的； 欺骗的； 迷惑人的
detailed_translations.english: likely to make someone believe something that is not true

name: missile
trans: n. 导弹；投射物

sentences.english: a nuclear missile
sentences.chinese: 核导弹

sentences.english: a missile attack
sentences.chinese: 导弹袭击

detailed_translations.english: a weapon that can fly over long distances and that explodes when it hits the thing it has been aimed at

detailed_translations.chinese: 导弹的；可投掷的；用以发射导弹的

name: mob
trans: n. 暴民，暴徒；民众；乌合之众

sentences.english: They were immediately surrounded by the mob.
sentences.chinese: 他们立刻被那帮暴民包围了。

detailed_translations.english: a large noisy crowd, especially one that is angry and violent
if a group of birds or animals mob another bird or animal, they all attack it

name: mobility
trans: n. 移动性；机动性；[电子] 迁移率

sentences.english: It improves the strength and mobility of joints.
sentences.chinese: 它能提高关节的力量和灵活性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to move easily from one job, area, or social class to another

name: mobilize
trans: vt. 动员，调动；集合，组织；使…流通；使…松动

sentences.english: an attempt to mobilize popular opinion
sentences.chinese: 鼓动公众舆论的尝试

sentences.english: a campaign to mobilize support for the strike
sentences.chinese: 动员大家支持罢工的宣传活动

detailed_translations.english: to encourage people to support something in an active way
to encourage people to support something in an active way

name: moderate
trans: adj. 稳健的，温和的；适度的，中等的；有节制的

sentences.english: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.english: a moderate degree of success
sentences.chinese: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.english: a student of moderate ability
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

sentences.english: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.chinese: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.english: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.chinese: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.english: moderate to strong winds
sentences.chinese: 中到大风

detailed_translations.english: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
someone whose opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, are not extreme and are considered reasonable by most people
to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent

name: modification
trans: n. 修改，修正；改变

sentences.english: They have used the same process for almost 50 years with only minor modifications.
sentences.chinese: 同样的工序他们用了将近50年，期间只做过很小的改动。

detailed_translations.english: a small change made in something such as a design, plan, or system

name: momentum
trans: n. 势头；[物] 动量；动力；冲力

sentences.english: incentives to maintain the momentum of European integration
sentences.chinese: 保持欧洲一体化发展势头的激励措施

sentences.english: Governments often lose momentum in their second term of office.
sentences.chinese: 政府往往会在第二届任期中丧失冲劲。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

name: monk
trans: n. 僧侣，修道士；和尚

sentences.english: ...saffron-robed Buddhist monks.
sentences.chinese: …身穿黄袍的和尚们。

detailed_translations.english: a member of an all-male religious group that lives apart from other people in a  monastery

name: monopoly
trans: n. 垄断；垄断者；专卖权

sentences.english: In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
sentences.chinese: 过去，中央政府对电视节目播放实行垄断。

sentences.english: A good education should not be the monopoly of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 良好的教育不应该成为富人的专利。

detailed_translations.english: the complete control of trade in particular goods or the supply of a particular service; a type of goods or a service that is controlled in this way

name: morality
trans: n. 道德；品行，美德

sentences.english: the decline in standards of personal morality
sentences.chinese: 个人道德标准的下降

sentences.english: The authorities are protectors of public morality.
sentences.chinese: 当权者是公众道德的捍卫者。

detailed_translations.english: beliefs or ideas about what is right and wrong and about how people should behave

name: motive
trans: n. 动机，目的；主题

sentences.english: What do you suppose the killer’s motive was?
sentences.chinese: 你认为凶手的动机是什么？

sentences.english: The violence was clearly prompted by political motives.
sentences.chinese: 这次暴力事件显然是由政治动机引发的。

sentences.english: It’s not the kind of thing he’d do unless he had an ulterior motive (= a reason he kept hidden ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不会做这种事的，除非他另有隐情。

detailed_translations.english: the reason that makes someone do something, especially when this reason is kept hidden
the motive power or force for a machine, vehicle etc makes it move

name: motorist
trans: n. 驾车旅行的人，开汽车的人

sentences.english: Police urged motorists to take extra care on the roads.
sentences.chinese: 警方敦促汽车驾驶员们在路上要格外当心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 驾车旅行的人，开汽车的人
detailed_translations.english: A motorist is a person who drives a car

name: municipal
trans: adj. 市政的，市的；地方自治的

sentences.english: the municipal waste dump
sentences.chinese: 城市垃圾场

sentences.english: municipal elections
sentences.chinese: 市级选举

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to the government of a town or city

name: mutual
trans: adj. 共同的；相互的，彼此的

sentences.english: I didn’t like Dev, and the feeling seemed to be mutual.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢德夫，他好像也不喜欢我。

sentences.english: The two men were a mutual admiration society , gushing about how much they were learning from each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人互相吹捧，盛赞对方让自己受益匪浅。

detailed_translations.english: mutual feelings such as respect, trust, or hatred are feelings that two or more people have for each other

name: namely
trans: adv. 也就是；即是；换句话说

sentences.english: Three students were mentioned, namely John, Sarah and Sylvia.
sentences.chinese: 有三名学生被提到，即约翰、萨拉和西尔维娅。

detailed_translations.english: used when saying the names of the people or things you are referring to

name: nationwide
trans: adj. 全国范围的；全国性的

sentences.english: a nationwide search for a missing British tourist
sentences.chinese: 在全国范围内对一名失踪英国游客的搜寻

sentences.english: nationwide television
sentences.chinese: 全国性的电视节目

sentences.english: The figures show unemployment falling nationwide last month.
sentences.chinese: 数字显示，上个月失业数字正全国性地下降。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in every part of the country
Nationwide is also an adverb

name: naval
trans: adj. 海军的；军舰的

sentences.english: a naval officer
sentences.chinese: 海军军官

sentences.english: naval battles
sentences.chinese: 海战

detailed_translations.english: relating to the navy or used by the navy

name: neglect
trans: vt. 疏忽，忽视；忽略

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

name: neighbouring
trans: adj. 邻近的；附近的；接壤的

sentences.english: The fair attracted hundreds of people from the neighbouring towns and villages.
sentences.chinese: 集市吸引了邻近城镇及村庄的好几百人前来。

detailed_translations.english: near the place where you are or the place you are talking about

name: nest
trans: n. 巢，窝；安乐窝；温床

sentences.english: a bird’s nest
sentences.chinese: 鸟窝

sentences.english: In May the females build a nest and lay their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 雌鸟在5月份筑巢产蛋。

sentences.english: Young eagles leave the nest after only two months.
sentences.chinese: 雏鹰仅仅两个月以后就会飞离鸟巢。

detailed_translations.english: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in
to build or use a nest

name: net
trans: n. 网；网络；净利；实价

sentences.english: We netted three fish in under an hour.
sentences.chinese: 不到一小时我们就网住了三条鱼。

detailed_translations.english: to catch sth, especially fish, in a net

name: newsletter
trans: n. 时事通讯

sentences.english: The society publishes a newsletter twice a year.
sentences.chinese: 该社团一年出版两次简报。

detailed_translations.english: a short written report of news about a club, organization etc that is sent regularly to people who are interested

name: niche
trans: n. 壁龛；合适的职业；[亦称作 niche market]【商业】有利可图的市场(或形势等)

sentences.english: Amanda soon found her niche at the club.
sentences.chinese: 阿曼达很快就在俱乐部里找到了一份理想的工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 壁龛；合适的职业；[亦称作 niche market]【商业】有利可图的市场(或形势等)
detailed_translations.english: a hollow place in a wall, often made to hold a statue

name: noble
trans: adj. 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的

sentences.english: It’s very noble of you to spend all your weekends helping the old folk.
sentences.chinese: 你心地真好，周末的时间全都用来帮助老人。

sentences.english: noble ideals
sentences.chinese: 崇高的理想

detailed_translations.chinese: 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的
detailed_translations.english: morally good or generous in a way that is admired
a member of the highest social class with a title such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’

name: nod
trans: n. 点头；打盹；摆动

sentences.english: The woman greeted us with a nod of the head.
sentences.chinese: 那个女人向我们点点头打招呼。

sentences.english: I showed the doorman my card and he gave a friendly nod.
sentences.chinese: 我向门卫出示了卡片，他友善地点了点头。

detailed_translations.english: an act of nodding
to move your head up and down, especially in order to show agreement or understanding

name: nominate
trans: vt. 推荐；提名；任命；指定

sentences.english: Ferraro was the first woman to be nominated for the job of vice president.
sentences.chinese: 费拉罗是第一位获得副总统职位提名的女性。

sentences.english: Next year Mr Jenks will retire and Mr Broadbent will be nominated as his replacement.
sentences.chinese: 明年詹克斯先生退休，布罗德本特先生将获任命接替他的职位。

detailed_translations.english: to officially suggest someone or something for an important position, duty, or prize

name: nomination
trans: n. 任命，提名；提名权

sentences.english: All the committee’s nominations were approved.
sentences.chinese: 该委员会的所有提名均获得批准。

detailed_translations.english: the act of officially suggesting someone or something for a position, duty or prize, or the fact of being suggested for it

name: nominee
trans: n. 被任命者；被提名的人；代名人

sentences.english: the Democratic Party presidential nominee
sentences.chinese: 民主党被提名的总统候选人

detailed_translations.chinese: 被任命者；被提名的人；代名人
detailed_translations.english: someone who has been officially suggested for an important position, duty, or prize

name: nonetheless
trans: adv. 尽管如此，但是

sentences.english: The region was extremely beautiful. Nonetheless Gerard could not imagine spending the rest of his life there.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区非常漂亮，然而杰拉德却无法想象自己要在那里度过余生。

sentences.english: The paintings are complex, but have plenty of appeal nonetheless.
sentences.chinese: 这些画复杂难懂，不过还是不乏吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尽管如此， 依然， 然而
detailed_translations.english: in spite of the fact that has just been mentioned

name: non-profit
trans: adj. 非营利的

name: nonsense
trans: n. 胡说；废话

sentences.english: ‘I’m a prisoner in my own home.’ ‘Nonsense!’
sentences.chinese: “我在自己家里就像个囚犯。”“胡说！”

sentences.english: If you ask me, these modern teaching methods are a load of nonsense (= a lot of nonsense ).
sentences.chinese: 要我说，这些现代教学方法全是一派胡言。

sentences.english: He was talking utter nonsense as usual.
sentences.chinese: 他像平常一样又在胡说八道了。

sentences.english: By 1832 the idea had become an economic nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 到了1832年，那种观点已经成为经济学的谬论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 胡说， 废话； 冒失的行动
detailed_translations.english: ideas, opinions, statements etc that are not true or that seem very stupid

name: noon
trans: n. 中午；正午；全盛期

sentences.english: We met at 12 noon.
sentences.chinese: 我们中午12点见了面。

detailed_translations.english: 12 o’clock in the daytime

name: notable
trans: adj. 值得注意的，显著的；著名的

sentences.english: If there are any notable inconsistencies or discrepancies, think through how you are going to explain the situation.
sentences.chinese: 如果有任何显著的不相符或让人起疑的情况，要想好该如何去解释这个情况。

detailed_translations.english: important, interesting, excellent, or unusual enough to be noticed or mentioned

name: notably
trans: adv. 显著地；尤其

sentences.english: Emigration has notably increased over the past five years.
sentences.chinese: 在过去五年中，移居国外的人明显增加。

sentences.english: Notably absent from his statement was any hint of an apology.
sentences.chinese: 他的话里显然没有丝毫道歉的意思。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is clearly different, important, or unusual

name: notify
trans: vt. 通告，通知；公布

sentences.english: You will be notified of any changes in the system.
sentences.chinese: 系统中有任何变化都会通知你。

sentences.english: In August we were notified that our article had been rejected.
sentences.chinese: 8月份我们接到通知，说我们的文章不予采用。

detailed_translations.english: to formally or officially tell someone about something

name: notorious
trans: adj. 声名狼藉的，臭名昭著的

sentences.english: a notorious computer hacker
sentences.chinese: 声名狼藉的电脑黑客

sentences.english: notorious cases of human rights abuses
sentences.chinese: 臭名昭著的践踏人权案

detailed_translations.english: famous or well-known for something bad

name: novel
trans: adj. 新奇的；异常的

sentences.english: a novel by Jane Austen
sentences.chinese: 简·奥斯丁的小说

sentences.english: What a novel idea!.
sentences.chinese: 多么新奇的想法呀！

detailed_translations.english: a long written story in which the characters and events are usually imaginary
not like anything known before, and unusual or interesting

name: nursery
trans: n. 苗圃；托儿所；温床

sentences.english: She puts her baby in this nursery and then goes back to work.
sentences.chinese: 她把孩子送到这家托儿所然后回去上班。

sentences.english: The garden, developed over the past 35 years, includes a nursery.
sentences.chinese: 这个有35年历史的花园里有一个苗圃。

detailed_translations.english: a place where young children are taken care of during the day while their parents are at work

name: objection
trans: n. 异议，反对；缺陷，缺点；妨碍；拒绝的理由

sentences.english: Her objection was that he was too young.
sentences.chinese: 她反对的理由是他太小。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 异议； 反对的理由
detailed_translations.english: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of something, or something you say that expresses this

name: oblige
trans: vt. 迫使；强制；赐，施恩惠；责成；义务

sentences.english: Mr. Oakley has always been ready to oblige journalists with information.
sentences.chinese: 奥克利先生一直乐于提供信息帮助记者们。

sentences.english: We called up three economists to ask how to eliminate the deficit and they obliged with very straightforward answers.
sentences.chinese: 我们致电3位经济学家咨询消除赤字的方法，他们满足了我们的要求，给出了非常直接的答复。

detailed_translations.english: To oblige someone means to be helpful to them by doing what they have asked you to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 迫使；施恩于，帮…的忙；使感激
detailed_translations.english: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

name: obsess
trans: vt. 迷住，缠住；使…着迷；使…困扰

sentences.english: The project seems to obsess him.
sentences.chinese: 这项工程似乎令他着迷。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval

name: obsession
trans: n. 痴迷；困扰；[内科][心理] 强迫观念

sentences.english: Gambling became an obsession, and he eventually lost everything.
sentences.chinese: 他迷上赌博，最后失去了一切。

sentences.english: The game pachinko became a national obsession.
sentences.chinese: 弹珠机游戏已经风靡全国。

sentences.english: He has an enthusiasm for art, to the point of obsession in my opinion.
sentences.chinese: 他对艺术很热衷，在我看来已经到了痴迷的程度。

sentences.english: She looked after him with a devotion bordering on obsession.
sentences.chinese: 她尽心尽力地照顾他，简直到了沉迷的地步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 痴迷；困扰；[内科][心理] 强迫观念
detailed_translations.english: an extreme unhealthy interest in something or worry about something, which stops you from thinking about anything else

name: occasional
trans: adj. 偶然的；临时的；特殊场合的

sentences.english: He made occasional visits to London.
sentences.chinese: 他有时候会去伦敦。

sentences.english: They had an occasional coffee together after shopping.
sentences.chinese: 他们偶尔会在购物后一起喝杯咖啡。

sentences.english: He only has occasional use of a car.
sentences.chinese: 他只是偶尔用一下汽车。

sentences.english: We should have enough money for the occasional trip.
sentences.chinese: 我们的钱应该足够偶尔出去旅行一次的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶尔的， 间或发生的
detailed_translations.english: happening sometimes but not often or regularly

name: occurrence
trans: n. 发生；出现；事件；发现

sentences.english: The greatest occurrence of coronary heart disease is in those over 65.
sentences.chinese: 冠心病的最高发病率在65岁以上的人群中。

sentences.english: Complaints seemed to be an everyday occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 投诉似乎成了天天发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of something happening

name: odds
trans: n. 几率；胜算；不平等；差别

sentences.english: (= it is likely ) that he will commit the same crime again.
sentences.chinese: 他可能还会犯同样的罪行。

sentences.english: (= how likely is it ) that they will mess up?
sentences.chinese: 他们失败的可能性有多大？

sentences.english: a new company that has beaten the odds and succeeded (= it was not likely to succeed, but it did )
sentences.chinese: 战胜逆境而取得成功的一家新公司

detailed_translations.english: how likely it is that something will or will not happen

name: offering
trans: n. 提供；祭品；奉献物；牲礼

sentences.english: ...the holiest of the Shinto rituals, where offerings are made at night to the great Sun.
sentences.chinese: …神道教仪式中最神圣的部分，祭品在夜间献给伟大的太阳神。

detailed_translations.english: something that is given to God

name: offspring
trans: n. 后代，子孙；产物

sentences.english: a young mother trying to control her offspring
sentences.chinese: 一个想管住自己孩子的年轻妈妈

detailed_translations.english: someone’s child or children – often used humorously

name: operational
trans: adj. 操作的；运作的

sentences.english: operational activities/costs/difficulties
sentences.chinese: 营运上的活动 / 成本 / 困难

sentences.english: The boat should be operational by this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午这艘船应该可以使用了。

sentences.english: The new system became operational in March.
sentences.chinese: 新的系统于3月份启用。

sentences.english: Our main offices are now fully operational.
sentences.chinese: 我们的总部现已全面投入运营。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the operation of a business, government etc

name: opt
trans: vi. 选择

sentences.english: Depending on your circumstances you can opt for one method or the other.
sentences.chinese: 根据自己的情况，你可以选择这种或那种方法。

detailed_translations.english: to choose one thing or do one thing instead of another

name: optical
trans: adj. 光学的；眼睛的，视觉的

sentences.english: microscopes and other optical instruments
sentences.chinese: 显微镜和其他光学仪器

detailed_translations.english: relating to machines or processes which are concerned with light, images, or the way we see things

name: optimism
trans: n. 乐观；乐观主义

sentences.english: There are grounds for cautious optimism.
sentences.chinese: 有理由保持谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: a tendency to believe that good things will always happen

name: oral
trans: n. 口试

sentences.english: oral history
sentences.chinese: 口述的历史

sentences.english: an oral agreement
sentences.chinese: 口头协议

detailed_translations.english: spoken, not written
a spoken test, especially in a foreign language

name: organizational
trans: adj. 组织的；编制的

sentences.english: Evelyn's excellent organizational skills were soon spotted by her employers.
sentences.chinese: 伊夫琳出色的组织才干很快就被她的雇主发现了。

detailed_translations.english: Organizational abilities and methods relate to the way that work, activities, or events are planned and arranged

name: orientation
trans: n. 方向；定向；适应；情况介绍；向东方

sentences.english: The company needs to develop a stronger orientation towards marketing its products.
sentences.chinese: 公司需要针对其产品的营销设定一个更为明确的目标。

sentences.english: How can we get students to adopt a serious orientation to learning?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样才能让学生对学习采取认真的态度呢？

detailed_translations.english: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

name: originate
trans: vt. 引起；创作

sentences.english: The disease originated in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病起源于非洲。

sentences.english: All carbohydrates originate from plants.
sentences.chinese: 所有的碳水化合物均来源于植物。

detailed_translations.english: When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创始， 开创
detailed_translations.english: to have the idea for something and start it

name: outbreak
trans: n. （战争的）爆发；（疾病的）发作

sentences.english: a cholera outbreak
sentences.chinese: 霍乱的爆发

detailed_translations.english: if there is an outbreak of fighting or disease in an area, it suddenly starts to happen

name: outing
trans: n. 远足；短途旅游；体育比赛

sentences.english: One evening, she made a rare outing to the local night club.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，她难得地去了一趟当地的夜总会。

detailed_translations.chinese: 远足；短途旅游；体育比赛
detailed_translations.english: a short trip that a group of people take for pleasure

name: outlet
trans: n. 出口，排放孔；[电] 电源插座；销路；发泄的方法；批发商店

sentences.english: a waste water outlet
sentences.chinese: 污水排放口

sentences.english: Is football a good outlet for men’s aggression?
sentences.chinese: 足球是男人宣泄好斗情绪的有效途径吗？

detailed_translations.english: a pipe or hole through which something such as a liquid or gas can flow out

name: outlook
trans: n. 展望；观点；景色

sentences.english: Exercise will improve your looks and your outlook.
sentences.chinese: 运动将会改善你的外在形象和人生态度。

detailed_translations.english: your general attitude to life and the world

name: outrage
trans: n. 愤怒，愤慨；暴行；侮辱

sentences.english: The response to the jury’s verdict was one of outrage.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团的裁决引发了愤慨。

sentences.english: a sense of moral outrage
sentences.chinese: 一种义愤填膺的感觉

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great anger and shock

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌辱，强奸；对…施暴行；激起愤怒
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very angry and shocked

name: outsider
trans: n. 外人；无取胜希望者

sentences.english: I’m an outsider, the only foreign woman in the group.
sentences.chinese: 我是个外人，是这群人里唯一的外国女人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is not accepted as a member of a particular social group

name: overlook
trans: vt. 忽略；俯瞰；远眺；检查；高耸于…之上

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

name: overly
trans: adv. 过度地；极度地

sentences.english: Employers may become overly cautious about taking on new staff.
sentences.chinese: 雇主在雇用新员工的问题上可能会过于谨慎。

detailed_translations.english: Overly means more than is normal, necessary, or reasonable

name: oversee
trans: vt. 监督；审查；俯瞰；偷看到，无意中看到

sentences.english: A team leader was appointed to oversee the project.
sentences.chinese: 任命了一位组长来监管该工程。

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of a group of workers and check that a piece of work is done satisfactorily

name: overturn
trans: vt. 推翻；倾覆；破坏

sentences.english: Leslie jumped to her feet, overturning her chair.
sentences.chinese: 莱斯莉一跃而起，碰倒了椅子。

sentences.english: His car overturned, trapping him inside.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车发生侧翻，把他困在了里面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倾覆， 翻转， 翻倒
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

detailed_translations.chinese: 使翻转，使倾覆，使倒下；颠覆，推翻
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

name: overwhelm
trans: vt. 淹没；压倒；受打击；覆盖；压垮

sentences.english: But the various pros and cons should not blindly overwhelm one another.
sentences.chinese: 但是，众多的利弊得失不应盲目的一个压倒另一个。

sentences.english: We try not to think about it because it would overwhelm us to an extent that we would just vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽量不去想它，因为在某种我们能够想像到的程度上他会压倒我们。

sentences.english: For example, in a situation in which several bystanders need to band together to overwhelm a perpetrator, they will be more likely to act collectively than to act alone.
sentences.chinese: 例如, 就有这样一种情况， 在只有几个旁观者需要联合起来才能压倒一个罪犯的情况下, 他们就可能会更多地采取集体行动。

detailed_translations.english: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly

name: overwhelming
trans: adj. 压倒性的；势不可挡的

sentences.english: There is overwhelming evidence that smoking damages your health.
sentences.chinese: 有难以辩驳的证据表明吸烟有损健康。

sentences.english: An overwhelming majority of the members were against the idea.
sentences.chinese: 占压倒性多数的成员反对这项主张。

sentences.english: The proposal has been given overwhelming support.
sentences.chinese: 这一提议得到了压倒性多数的支持。

sentences.english: The British Air Force succeeded despite overwhelming odds against them.
sentences.chinese: 英国空军虽然处境极为不利，但还是完成了任务。

detailed_translations.english: very large or greater, more important etc than any other

name: pad
trans: n. 衬垫；护具；便笺簿；填补

sentences.english: Use an abrasive pad for stubborn stains.
sentences.chinese: 用百洁布擦洗顽固污渍。

sentences.english: Keep a telephone pad and a pen to hand.
sentences.chinese: 手边准备一本电话记事簿和一支笔。

sentences.english: All the sharp corners were padded with foam.
sentences.chinese: 所有的棱角都垫上了泡沫塑料。

detailed_translations.english: a thick flat object made of cloth or rubber, used to protect or clean something, or to make something more comfortable
to put a layer of soft material in or on sth in order to protect it, make it thicker or change its shape

name: parameter
trans: n. 参数；系数；参量

sentences.english: ...some of the parameters that determine the taste of a wine.
sentences.chinese: …一些决定葡萄酒味道的参数。

detailed_translations.english: Parameters are factors or limits that affect the way something can be done or made

name: parental
trans: adj. 父母亲的，父母的；亲代的，亲本的

sentences.english: parental responsibility
sentences.chinese: 父母的责任

sentences.english: Opening a new school will increase parental choice.
sentences.chinese: 开办一所新学校将会扩大父母的选择范围。

sentences.english: Parental consent is required before the operation can take place.
sentences.chinese: 手术前须征得父母同意。

detailed_translations.english: relating to being a parent and especially to being responsible for a child’s safety and development

name: parish
trans: n. 教区

sentences.english: Father Doyle moved to a new parish.
sentences.chinese: 多伊尔神父调到了新的教区。

detailed_translations.english: the area that a priest in some Christian churches is responsible for

name: parliamentary
trans: adj. 议会的；国会的；议会制度的

sentences.english: the world’s oldest parliamentary democracy
sentences.chinese: 世界上最古老的议会民主制

detailed_translations.chinese: 议会的；国会的；议会制度的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or governed by a parliament

name: partial
trans: adj. 局部的；偏爱的；不公平的

sentences.english: The exhibition was only a partial success.
sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

name: partially
trans: adv. 部分地；偏袒地

sentences.english: The operation was only partially successful.
sentences.chinese: 手术不尽如人意。

sentences.english: Remember that you are partially responsible for their unhappiness.
sentences.chinese: 记住，你对他们的不幸负有部分责任。

detailed_translations.english: not completely

name: passing
trans: n. 经过；及格；流逝；去世

name: passive
trans: n. 被动语态

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: pastor
trans: n. 牧师

name: patch
trans: n. 眼罩；斑点；碎片；小块土地

sentences.english: Look out for icy patches on the road.
sentences.chinese: 小心路上结冰的地方。

sentences.english: a cat with a white patch on its chest
sentences.chinese: 胸部有一块白斑的猫

sentences.english: He combs his hair over his bald patch .
sentences.chinese: 他把头发梳过来盖住秃掉的地方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 眼罩；斑点；碎片；小块土地
detailed_translations.english: a small area of something that is different from the area around it
to repair a hole in something by putting a piece of something else over it

name: patent
trans: n. 专利权；执照；专利品

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: pathway
trans: n. 路，道；途径，路径

sentences.english: Richard was coming up the pathway.
sentences.chinese: 理查德正沿路走来。

detailed_translations.english: a path

name: patrol
trans: n. 巡逻；巡逻队；侦察队

sentences.english: The security forces increased their patrols in the area.
sentences.chinese: 安全部队加强了对该地区的巡逻。

detailed_translations.english: when someone goes around different parts of an area at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger
to go around the different parts of an area or building at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger

name: patron
trans: n. 赞助人；保护人；主顾

sentences.english: a wealthy patron
sentences.chinese: 富有的赞助人

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports the activities of an organization, for example by giving money

name: peak
trans: n. 山峰；最高点；顶点；帽舌

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.english: jagged peaks
sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.english: It was a time of peak demand for the product.
sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

detailed_translations.english: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

name: peasant
trans: n. 农民；乡下人

sentences.english: Most villagers are peasant farmers.
sentences.chinese: 大多数村民是农民。

detailed_translations.english: a poor farmer who owns or rents a small amount of land, either in past times or in poor countries

name: peculiar
trans: n. 特权；特有财产

sentences.english: He’s been a little peculiar lately.
sentences.chinese: 最近他有点怪异。

sentences.english: She’s a very peculiar child.
sentences.chinese: 她是个非常古怪的孩子。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a strange and slightly crazy way

name: persist
trans: vi. 存留，坚持；持续，固执

sentences.english: If the pain persists, you must see a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果一直痛，你就必须去看医生了。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad persists, it continues to exist or happen

name: persistent
trans: adj. 固执的，坚持的；持久稳固的

sentences.english: persistent rumours
sentences.chinese: 持续流传的谣言

sentences.english: persistent headaches
sentences.chinese: 持续头疼

sentences.english: a persistent problem
sentences.chinese: 长期问题

sentences.english: persistent rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

name: personnel
trans: n. 人事部门；全体人员

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

name: petition
trans: n. 请愿；请愿书；祈求；[法] 诉状

sentences.english: Local residents have drawn up a petition to protest the hospital closure.
sentences.chinese: 当地居民已草拟了一份请愿书，抗议关闭医院。

sentences.english: Villagers petitioned the local authority to provide better bus services.
sentences.chinese: 村民请愿要求地方当局提供更好的公共汽车服务。

detailed_translations.english: a written request signed by a lot of people, asking someone in authority to do something or change something
to ask the government or an organization to do something by sending them a petition

name: philosopher
trans: n. 哲学家；哲人

sentences.english: Plato, Aristotle, and other Greek philosophers
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图、亚里士多德和其他希腊哲学家

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies and develops ideas about the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil etc

name: philosophical
trans: adj. 哲学的（等于philosophic）；冷静的

sentences.english: the philosophical problem of whether there is free will
sentences.chinese: 关于是否有自由意志的哲学问题

sentences.english: a philosophical argument
sentences.chinese: 哲学争论

detailed_translations.english: relating to philosophy

name: physician
trans: n. [医] 医师；内科医师

sentences.english: your family physician
sentences.chinese: 你的家庭医生

detailed_translations.english: a doctor

name: pioneer
trans: n. 先锋；拓荒者

sentences.english: the early pioneers of the Dakota territory
sentences.chinese: 达科他地区的早期拓荒者

detailed_translations.english: someone who is important in the early development of something, and whose work or ideas are later developed by other people
to be the first person to do, invent or use something

name: pipeline
trans: n. 管道；输油管；传递途径

sentences.english: In the above pipelines we started with some command that generated output and then piped that output through each stage of the pipeline.
sentences.chinese: 在以上的管道线中，我们在开始时使用一些生成输出的命令，然后通过管道线的每个阶段导出输出。

detailed_translations.chinese: 用管道输送， 为…安装管道
管道；供应线，商品供应线
detailed_translations.english: a line of connecting pipes, often under the ground, used for sending gas, oil etc over long distances

name: pirate
trans: n. 海盗；盗版；侵犯专利权者

sentences.english: Computer game pirates cost the industry twenty million pounds a year.
sentences.chinese: 电脑游戏盗版者每年要给该行业带来两千万英镑的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 海盗；盗版；侵犯专利权者
detailed_translations.english: someone who sails on the seas, attacking other boats and stealing things from them
to illegally copy and sell another person’s work such as a book, video, or computer program

name: pit
trans: n. 矿井；深坑；陷阱；（物体或人体表面上的）凹陷；（英国剧场的）正厅后排；正厅后排的观众

sentences.english: Dad first went down the pit (= worked in a coal mine ) when he was 15 years old.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸第一次下煤矿井时才15岁。

sentences.english: a national strike against pit closures
sentences.chinese: 抗议关闭煤矿井的全国性罢工

detailed_translations.chinese: 矿井；深坑；陷阱；（物体或人体表面上的）凹陷；（英国剧场的）正厅后排；正厅后排的观众
detailed_translations.english: a coal mine

detailed_translations.chinese: 使竞争；窖藏；使凹下；去…之核；使留疤痕
detailed_translations.english: to put small marks or holes in the surface of something

name: plea
trans: n. 恳求，请求；辩解，辩护；借口，托辞

sentences.english: Caldwell made a plea for donations.
sentences.chinese: 考德威尔恳求捐款。

detailed_translations.english: a request that is urgent or full of emotion

name: plead
trans: vt. 借口；为...辩护；托称

sentences.english: ‘Don’t go!’ Robert pleaded.
sentences.chinese: “别走！”罗伯特央求道。

sentences.english: He appeared before the committee to plead his case.
sentences.chinese: 他出现在委员会上为他的案子辩护。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，请求；申诉，答辩，辩护
detailed_translations.english: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…辩护， 提出…为理由
detailed_translations.english: If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence

name: pledge
trans: n. 保证，誓言；抵押；抵押品，典当物

sentences.english: The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of the region.
sentences.chinese: 会议以加快该地区6个州之间合作的承诺结束。

detailed_translations.english: a serious promise or agree-ment, especially one made publicly or officially
to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something

name: plug
trans: n. 插头；塞子；栓

sentences.english: the bath plug
sentences.chinese: 浴缸塞子

sentences.english: an electric plug
sentences.chinese: 电源插头

sentences.english: We used mud to plug up the holes in the roof.
sentences.chinese: 我们用泥堵住了房顶上的漏洞

detailed_translations.english: a round flat piece of rubber used for stopping the water flowing out of a bath or  sink
to fill or block a small hole

name: plunge
trans: n. 投入；跳进

sentences.english: The government's political and economic reforms threaten to plunge the country into chaos.
sentences.chinese: 该政府的政治和经济改革有可能使这个国家陷入混乱之中。

sentences.english: Eddy found himself plunged into a world of brutal violence.
sentences.chinese: 埃迪发现自己突然陷入了一个残酷暴力的世界。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth experience sth unpleasant

name: pole
trans: n. 杆；极点；电极

sentences.english: a telephone pole
sentences.chinese: 电话线杆

detailed_translations.english: a long stick or post usually made of wood or metal, often set upright in the ground to support something
to push a boat along in the water using a pole

name: poll
trans: n. 投票；民意测验；投票数；投票所

sentences.english: A recent poll found that 80% of Californians support the governor.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一项民意调查发现80%的加利福尼亚人支持州长。

sentences.english: Polls indicate that education is the top issue with voters.
sentences.chinese: 民意调查显示，教育是选民心中的头等大事。

sentences.english: Labour is ahead in the polls.
sentences.chinese: 工党在民意调查中处于领先地位。

sentences.english: The latest public opinion poll showed that 25% of us consider ourselves superstitious.
sentences.chinese: 最新的民意调查显示我们中有25%的人认为自己迷信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民意测验；政治选举，大选
detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…进行民意测验； 获得
detailed_translations.english: to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject

name: pond
trans: n. 池塘

sentences.english: The path descends to  the pond.
sentences.chinese: 小路下斜通到池塘。

sentences.english: This pond often catches in winter.
sentences.chinese: 这个池塘在冬天常常结冰。

sentences.english: Wild flowers and grasses rimmed the little pond.
sentences.chinese: 各种野花和野草环绕着这个小池塘。

detailed_translations.english: a small area of fresh water that is smaller than a lake, that is either natural or artificially made

name: pop
trans: abbr. 卖点广告（Point of Purchase）

sentences.english: The window opened and a dog's head popped out.
sentences.chinese: 窗子打开了，冷不防一只狗探出头来。

sentences.english: An idea suddenly popped into his head.
sentences.chinese: 他突然想到了一个主意。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly appear, especially when not expected

name: portfolio
trans: n. 公文包；文件夹；证券投资组合；部长职务

sentences.english: an investment portfolio
sentences.chinese: 投资组合

detailed_translations.chinese: 公文包；文件夹；证券投资组合；部长职务
detailed_translations.english: a large flat case used especially for carrying pictures, documents etc

name: portray
trans: vt. 描绘；扮演

sentences.english: Romantic artists portrayed nature as wild and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫主义艺术家描绘的大自然是狂野而强大的。

sentences.english: The President likes to portray himself as a friend of working people.
sentences.chinese: 总统喜欢以工薪阶层的朋友自居。

detailed_translations.english: to describe or show someone or something in a particular way, according to your opinion of them

name: postpone
trans: vt. 使…延期；把…放在次要地位；把…放在后面

sentences.english: The match had to be postponed until next week.
sentences.chinese: 比赛不得不推迟到下周举行。

sentences.english: His trial has been postponed indefinitely (= no one knows when it will happen ) .
sentences.chinese: 对他的审判被无限期推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: to change the date or time of a planned event or action to a later one

name: post-war
trans: adj. 战后的

name: practitioner
trans: n. 开业者，从业者，执业医生

sentences.english: RMC provides structure in three areas for the practitioner: productivity, guidance , and personalization.
sentences.chinese: RMC在三个领域为从业者提供了结构：生产力，指导和个性化。

sentences.english: The dictionary is mainly for civil aviation practitioner, aviation majored students and Aviation enthusiasts.
sentences.chinese: 词典主要面向民航从业人员、航空专业学员以及航空爱好者。

sentences.english: The articulation of work and life, cast as work-life balance, has become a key feature of much current government, practitioner and academic debate.
sentences.chinese: 当今的工作和生活，扮演工作与生活的平衡，已成为一个关键特性当前的很多政府、从业者和学术争论。

name: preach
trans: n. 说教

sentences.english: He traveled the southern states, preaching the gospel .
sentences.chinese: 他游历南方各州宣讲福音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说教；讲道；鼓吹；传道；反复灌输
detailed_translations.english: to talk about a religious subject in a public place, especially in a church during a service

name: precedent
trans: n. 先例；前例

sentences.english: The Obama administration and police officers around the country say no, and their precedent is the past.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马政府和全国各地的警官说不可以，他们引为依据的先例就是“过去”。

sentences.english: There is no historical precedent that can tell us what happens to established democracies when most citizens go years, even decades, without an improvement in their standard of living.
sentences.chinese: 没有历史先例能告诉我们，当大多数人民的生活水平在几年、甚至几十年间维持不变时，一个已经确立根基的民主国家会发生什么。

sentences.english: An east London school has set a precedent by fining pupils who break the rules.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦东区的一所学校开创了对违反校规的学生处以罚金的先例。

detailed_translations.english: an action or official decision that can be used to give support to later actions or decisions

name: precision
trans: n. 精度，[数] 精密度；精确

sentences.english: precision engineering
sentences.chinese: 精密工程

sentences.english: precision bombing
sentences.chinese: 精确轰炸

detailed_translations.chinese: 精度，[数] 精密度；精确
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very exact or correct
made or done in a very exact way

name: predator
trans: n. [动] 捕食者；[动] 食肉动物；掠夺者

sentences.english: With no natural predators on the island, the herd increased rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 由于岛上没有天然食肉动物，牧群的数量迅速增加。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that kills and eats other animals

name: predecessor
trans: n. 前任，前辈

sentences.english: Kennedy’s predecessor as President was the war hero Dwight Eisenhower.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪总统的前任是战争英雄德怀特·艾森豪威尔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who had your job before you started doing it

name: predominantly
trans: adv. 主要地；显著地

sentences.english: The landscape has remained predominantly rural in appearance.
sentences.chinese: 该风景看上去主要保留了乡村风貌。

detailed_translations.english: You use predominantly to indicate which feature or quality is most noticeable in a situation

name: pregnancy
trans: n. 怀孕；丰富，多产；意义深长

sentences.english: This drug should not be taken during pregnancy.
sentences.chinese: 这种药妊娠期间不得服用。

sentences.english: her third pregnancy
sentences.chinese: 她的第三次怀孕

sentences.english: teenage pregnancies
sentences.chinese: 少女怀孕

sentences.english: a pregnancy test
sentences.chinese: 妊娠试验，验孕

detailed_translations.english: when a woman is pregnant (= has a baby growing inside her body )

name: prejudice
trans: n. 偏见；侵害

sentences.english: Women still face prejudice in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 女性在职场中仍然面临歧视。

sentences.english: It takes a long time to overcome these kinds of prejudices.
sentences.chinese: 战胜这些偏见需要假以时日。

sentences.english: There was concern that reports in the media would prejudice the jury.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

detailed_translations.english: an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something

name: preliminary
trans: n. 准备；预赛；初步措施

sentences.english: the preliminary stages of the competition
sentences.chinese: 竞赛的预赛阶段

sentences.english: a preliminary draft
sentences.chinese: 初稿

detailed_translations.english: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it

detailed_translations.chinese: 初步做法， 起始行为

name: premier
trans: n. 总理，首相

sentences.english: one of Dublin’s premier hotels
sentences.chinese: 都柏林最好的酒店之一

detailed_translations.english: best or most important
a  prime minister  – used in news reports

name: premise
trans: n. 前提；上述各项；房屋连地基

sentences.english: Schools may earn extra money by renting out their premises.
sentences.chinese: 学校通过出租房屋场地可以获取额外收入。

sentences.english: business premises
sentences.chinese: 企业经营场所

detailed_translations.chinese: 房屋和地基， 经营场址； 前提， 假设
detailed_translations.english: the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses

name: premium
trans: n. 额外费用；奖金；保险费;(商)溢价

sentences.english: premium ice cream
sentences.chinese: 优质冰激凌

sentences.english: the current consumer trend for premium products
sentences.chinese: 当前消费者喜欢购买优质产品的趋向

sentences.english: premium quality British potatoes
sentences.chinese: 优质英国马铃薯

detailed_translations.chinese: 高级的，优质的；售价高的
detailed_translations.english: of very high quality

detailed_translations.chinese: 保险金；额外费用，加付款；奖品，赠品；额外津贴
detailed_translations.english: the cost of insurance, especially the amount that you pay each year

name: prescribe
trans: vt. 规定；开处方

sentences.english: The physician examines the patient then diagnoses the disease and prescribes medication.
sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

detailed_translations.english: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

name: prescription
trans: n. 药方；指示；惯例

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

name: presently
trans: adv. （美）目前；不久

sentences.english: The doctor will be here presently.
sentences.chinese: 医生一会儿就到。

sentences.english: Presently, I fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 一会儿我就睡着了。

sentences.english: The range of courses presently available has grown.
sentences.chinese: 目前可选择的课程范围已经扩大了。

detailed_translations.english: in a short time

name: preservation
trans: n. 保存，保留

sentences.english: methods of food preservation
sentences.chinese: 保存食物的各种方法

sentences.english: the preservation of peace in the region
sentences.chinese: 维护该地区的和平

detailed_translations.english: when something is kept in its original state or in good condition

name: preside
trans: vi. 主持，担任会议主席

sentences.english: I shall be pleased to preside at your meetings.
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴主持你们的会议。

sentences.english: Mr Justice Waller, presiding judge for the northeast
sentences.chinese: 沃勒法官，东北地区的首席法官

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of a formal event, organization, ceremony etc

name: presidency
trans: n. 总统（或董事长、会长、大学校长等）的职位（任期）；管辖；支配

sentences.english: Roosevelt was elected four times to the presidency of the US.
sentences.chinese: 罗斯福四次当选美国总统。

sentences.english: There were few real improvements during his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 在他的总统任期内几乎没有什么真正的改善。

detailed_translations.english: the position of being the president of a country or organization, or the period of time during which someone is president

name: presidential
trans: adj. 总统的；首长的；统辖的

sentences.english: a presidential election
sentences.chinese: 总统大选

sentences.english: the party’s presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 该党的总统候选人

detailed_translations.english: relating to a president

name: prestigious
trans: adj. 有名望的；享有声望的

sentences.english: a prestigious literary award
sentences.chinese: 享有盛名的文学奖

sentences.english: a highly prestigious university
sentences.chinese: 赫赫有名的大学

detailed_translations.english: admired as one of the best and most important

name: presumably
trans: adv. 大概；推测起来；可假定

sentences.english: It’s raining, which presumably means that your football match will be cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了，这可能意味着你们的足球比赛要取消。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大概， 可能， 据推测
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you think something is probably true

name: presume
trans: vi. 相信；擅自行为

sentences.english: They're resentful that outsiders presume to meddle in their affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们对外人擅自干预他们的事务怨恨不已。

sentences.english: I presume you're here on business.
sentences.chinese: 我想你是来这儿出差的吧。

sentences.english: "Had he been home all week?"—"I presume so."
sentences.chinese: “他整个星期都在家吗？”—“我想是。”

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone presumes to do something, you mean that they do it even though they have no right to do it

detailed_translations.chinese: 推测，假定，相信；冒昧，擅自；认定，推定
detailed_translations.english: If you presume that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you are not certain

name: prevail
trans: vi. 盛行，流行；战胜，获胜

sentences.english: 英文编辑：the economic conditions which prevail in England and Wales
sentences.chinese: 英格兰和威尔士普遍的经济状况

sentences.english: Justice will prevail.
sentences.chinese: 正义终将获胜。

detailed_translations.english: if a belief, custom, situation etc prevails, it exists among a group of people at a certain time

name: prevalence
trans: n. 流行；普遍；广泛

sentences.english: The report says climate change could also increase the prevalence of dengue fever.
sentences.chinese: 报告表示，气候变化还有可能增加登革热的流行强度。

sentences.english: Generating epidemiological data on the prevalence and risk factors of obesity in dogs.
sentences.chinese: 针对狗肥胖症的流行程度和风险因素获得流行病学数据。

sentences.english: The prevalence of these widgets means they can report on almost all your browsing activity, which can then be linked to databases full of the social data you intentionally share.
sentences.chinese: 这些小工具的流行意味着它们能上报几乎所有的你的浏览行为，通过这些行为就能链接到你主动共享出来，满是你社交信息的数据库。

name: prevention
trans: n. 预防；阻止；妨碍

sentences.english: a fire prevention officer
sentences.chinese: 消防官员

sentences.english: You know what they say, prevention is better than cure (= it is better to stop something bad from happening than to remove the problem once it has happened ) .
sentences.chinese: 正所谓预防胜于治疗。

detailed_translations.english: when something bad is stopped from happening

name: prey
trans: n. 捕食；牺牲者；被捕食的动物

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

name: principal
trans: adj. 主要的；资本的

sentences.english: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

sentences.english: Teaching is her principal source of income.
sentences.chinese: 教书是她主要的收入来源。

sentences.english: the principal character in the book
sentences.chinese: 书里的主人公

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a school

name: privatization
trans: n. 私有化

sentences.english: We learned all the tricks of privatization.
sentences.chinese: 我们学到了私有化的所有技巧。

sentences.english: The household contract responsibility system does not mean privatization of the rural economy.
sentences.chinese: 家庭联产承包制并不意味着农村经济私有化。

sentences.english: Outside the World Water Forum, hundreds of protesters demonstrated against what they call the "privatization" of water.
sentences.chinese: 在世界水论坛的会场外面，数百名抗议者举行示威，反对他们所说的“水资源私有化”。

detailed_translations.english: the act of privatizing something

name: privilege
trans: n. 特权；优待

sentences.english: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

detailed_translations.english: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

name: probe
trans: n. 探针；调查

sentences.english: a fibre-optic probe
sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.english: The surgeon would pick up his instruments, probe, repair, and stitch up again.
sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body
to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

name: problematic
trans: adj. 问题的；有疑问的；不确定的

sentences.english: The reforms could turn out to be highly problematic .
sentences.chinese: 改革最终可能会困难重重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 问题的；有疑问的；不确定的
detailed_translations.english: involving problems and difficult to deal with

name: proceeding
trans: n. 进行；程序；诉讼；事项

sentences.english: The proceedings of the inquiry will take place in private.
sentences.chinese: 调查行动将秘密进行。

detailed_translations.english: The proceedings are an organized series of events that take place in a particular place

name: proceeds
