trans: n. 收入，收益；实收款项

sentences.english: We sold the business and bought a villa in Spain with the proceeds.
sentences.chinese: 我们卖了公司，用所得的钱在西班牙买了一幢别墅。

detailed_translations.english: the money that is obtained from doing something or selling something

name: processing
trans: v. 加工；[自] 处理；对…起诉（process的ing形式）

sentences.english: Can you guess what the extra processing is here?
sentences.chinese: 您可以猜出这里的额外处理是什么吗？

sentences.english: As this processing loop is not required, it is unhooked from the collaboration.
sentences.chinese: 由于并不需要这个处理循环，所以将其从协作中去除。

sentences.english: But its most natural target is in automation of system scripting and text processing tasks.
sentences.chinese: 但是它最自然的目标在于系统脚本的自动化和本文处理任务。

name: processor
trans: n. [计] 处理器；处理程序；加工者

sentences.english: US tuna processors
sentences.chinese: 美国的金枪鱼加工厂商

detailed_translations.chinese: [计] 处理器；处理程序；加工者
detailed_translations.english: the central part of a computer that deals with the commands and information it is given

name: proclaim
trans: vt. 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

name: productive
trans: adj. 能生产的；生产的，生产性的；多产的；富有成效的

sentences.english: the economy’s productive capacity
sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

name: productivity
trans: n. 生产力；生产率；生产能力

sentences.english: high productivity levels in manufacturing
sentences.chinese: 制造业中的高生产率

sentences.english: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
sentences.chinese: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

detailed_translations.english: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them

name: profitable
trans: adj. 有利可图的；赚钱的；有益的

sentences.english: The advertising campaign proved very profitable.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明，这次广告宣传活动卓有成效。

sentences.english: a highly profitable business
sentences.chinese: 盈利高的企业

sentences.english: a profitable afternoon
sentences.chinese: 有收获的下午

detailed_translations.english: producing a profit or a useful result

name: profound
trans: adj. 深厚的；意义深远的；渊博的

sentences.english: a profound question
sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

detailed_translations.english: showing great knowledge and understanding

name: projection
trans: n. 投射；规划；突出；发射；推测

sentences.english: projection equipment
sentences.chinese: 投影设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 投射；规划；突出；发射；推测
detailed_translations.english: the act of projecting a film or picture onto a screen

name: prominent
trans: adj. 突出的，显著的；杰出的；卓越的

sentences.english: a prominent Russian scientist
sentences.chinese: 杰出的俄罗斯科学家

sentences.english: The World Cup will have a prominent place on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 世界杯赛将占据议程表的重要位置。

sentences.english: a prominent nose
sentences.chinese: 高鼻子

detailed_translations.english: important

name: pronounced
trans: v. 发音；宣告；断言（pronounce的过去分词）

sentences.english: a pronounced Polish accent
sentences.chinese: 明显的波兰口音

sentences.english: This disability is more pronounced in men.
sentences.chinese: 这种障碍在男性中表现得更为明显。

detailed_translations.chinese: 显著的；断然的；讲出来的
detailed_translations.english: very great or noticeable

detailed_translations.chinese: 发音；宣告；断言（pronounce的过去分词）

name: propaganda
trans: n. 宣传；传道总会

sentences.english: the spreading of political propaganda
sentences.chinese: 政治宣传的开展

sentences.english: the government propaganda machine
sentences.chinese: 政府的宣传机器

detailed_translations.english: information which is false or which emphasizes just one part of a situation, used by a government or political group to make people agree with them

name: proposition
trans: n. [数] 命题；提议；主题；议题

sentences.english: He telephoned Stuart with a proposition.
sentences.chinese: 他打电话给斯图尔特提了个建议。

sentences.english: I’ve got a proposition to put to you.
sentences.chinese: 我要向你提个建议。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion, or something that is suggested or considered as a possible thing to do
to suggest to someone that they have sex with you

name: prosecute
trans: vt. 检举；贯彻；从事；依法进行

sentences.english: Mrs Lynn Smith, prosecuting, said the offence took place on January 27.
sentences.chinese: 控方律师林恩·史密斯夫人称案件发生于1月27日。

detailed_translations.english: if a lawyer prosecutes a case, he or she tries to prove that the person charged with a crime is guilty
to charge someone with a crime and try to show that they are guilty of it in a court of law

name: prosecution
trans: n. 起诉，检举；进行；经营

sentences.english: a criminal prosecution
sentences.chinese: 刑事诉讼

sentences.english: The evidence is not sufficient to bring a prosecution against him.
sentences.chinese: 现有证据不足以对他提出起诉。

detailed_translations.english: when a charge is made against someone for a crime, or when someone is judged for a crime in a court of law

name: prosecutor
trans: n. 检察官；公诉人；[法] 起诉人；实行者

sentences.english: I was the first to go before the prosecutor.
sentences.chinese: 我是第一个被带到检察官面前的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 检察官； 起诉人， 原告
detailed_translations.english: In some countries, a prosecutor is a lawyer or official who brings charges against someone or tries to prove in a trial that they are guilty

name: prospective
trans: n. 预期；展望

sentences.english: The story should act as a warning to other prospective buyers.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报道应该可以对其他可能的购买者起到警告作用。

detailed_translations.english: You use prospective to describe someone who wants to be the thing mentioned or who is likely to be the thing mentioned

name: prosperity
trans: n. 繁荣，成功

sentences.english: a time of economic prosperity
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣时期

detailed_translations.english: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life

name: protective
trans: adj. 防护的；关切保护的；保护贸易的

sentences.english: protective clothing
sentences.chinese: 防护服

sentences.english: Sunscreen provides a protective layer against the sun’s harmful rays.
sentences.chinese: 防晒霜提供了一层抵挡阳光中有害光线的防护层。

detailed_translations.english: used or intended for protection

name: protocol
trans: n. 协议；草案；礼仪

sentences.english: a breach of diplomatic protocol
sentences.chinese: 违反外交礼节

detailed_translations.english: a system of rules about the correct way to behave on an official occasion

name: province
trans: n. 省；领域；职权

sentences.english: Computers were once the exclusive province of scientists and mathematicians.
sentences.chinese: 计算机一度为科学家和数学家专用。

detailed_translations.english: a subject that someone knows a lot about or something that only they are responsible for

name: provincial
trans: n. 粗野的人；乡下人；外地人

sentences.english: a provincial election
sentences.chinese: 省级选举

sentences.english: the provincial government of Quebec
sentences.chinese: 魁北克省政府

detailed_translations.english: relating to or coming from a province

detailed_translations.chinese: 粗野的人；乡下人；外地人

name: provision
trans: n. 规定；条款；准备；[经] 供应品

sentences.english: The agreement includes a provision for each side to check the other side’s weapons.
sentences.chinese: 协议有项规定，允许双方互查武器。

sentences.english: Under the provisions of the Act, employers must supply safety equipment.
sentences.chinese: 该法令规定，雇主必须提供安全设备。

detailed_translations.english: a condition in an agreement or law

name: provoke
trans: vt. 驱使；激怒；煽动；惹起

sentences.english: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
sentences.chinese: 如果不是被惹恼了，那狗原本不会攻击的。

sentences.english: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
sentences.chinese: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry, especially deliberately

name: psychiatric
trans: adj. 精神病学的；精神病治疗的

sentences.english: a psychiatric hospital
sentences.chinese: 精神病医院

sentences.english: a psychiatric nurse
sentences.chinese: 精神病院护士

sentences.english: Charles was suffering from a psychiatric disorder (= mental illness ) .
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯彼时精神错乱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神病学的，精神病治疗的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the study and treatment of mental illness

name: pulse
trans: n. [电子] 脉冲；脉搏

sentences.english: His breathing was shallow and his pulse was weak .
sentences.chinese: 他呼吸很浅，脉搏微弱。

sentences.english: She felt his neck. There was no pulse.
sentences.chinese: 她摸了摸他的颈部，没有脉搏。

sentences.english: Her pulse raced (= beat very quickly ) with excitement.
sentences.chinese: 她激动得脉搏急速跳动。

detailed_translations.english: the regular beat that can be felt, for example at your wrist, as your heart pumps blood around your body
to move or flow with a steady quickbeat or sound

name: pump
trans: n. 泵，抽水机；打气筒

sentences.english: water/air/beer etc pump (=for moving water, air etc)
sentences.chinese: 抽水机/抽气机/啤酒泵等

sentences.english: It's not enough to get rid of raw sewage by pumping it out to sea.
sentences.chinese: 仅用水泵将未经处理的污水排入海中是不够的。

sentences.english: The money raised will be used to dig bore holes to pump water into the dried-up lake.
sentences.chinese: 筹到的钱款将用来挖井眼，再将水抽入干涸的湖中。

detailed_translations.english: a machine for forcing liquid or gas into or out of something
to make liquid or gas move in a particular direction, using a pump

name: punch
trans: n. 冲压机；打洞器；钻孔机

sentences.english: The guard punched my ticket and I got on.
sentences.chinese: 守卫在我的票上打孔后，我就上去了。

sentences.english: a hole punch
sentences.chinese: 打孔器

detailed_translations.english: to make a hole in something, using a metal tool or other sharp object
a metal tool for cutting holes or for pushing something into a small hole

name: query
trans: n. 疑问，质问；疑问号 ；[计] 查询

sentences.english: Staff are always available to answer your queries.
sentences.chinese: 员工随时为您解答疑问。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疑问，质问；疑问号 ；[计] 查询
detailed_translations.english: a question that you ask to get information, or to check that something is true or correct
to express doubt about whether something is true or correct

name: quest
trans: n. 追求；寻找

sentences.english: He had been questing for religious belief from an early age.
sentences.chinese: 他从早年开始就一直在寻求宗教信仰。

sentences.english: ...his questing mind and boundless enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: …他的探索型头脑和无限的热情

detailed_translations.english: to search for sth that is difficult to find

name: quota
trans: n. 配额；定额；限额

sentences.english: The government has decided to scrap quotas on car imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府决定取消汽车进口配额。

sentences.english: There are plans to introduce strict immigration quotas.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要推行严格的移民限额制度。

detailed_translations.english: an official limit on the number or amount of something that is allowed in a particular period

name: radar
trans: n. [雷达] 雷达，无线电探测器

sentences.english: The coastline can now be monitored by radar.
sentences.chinese: 现在能用雷达监测海岸线了。

sentences.english: We could see the plane quite clearly on the radar screen.
sentences.chinese: 我们在雷达屏幕上可清晰地看到飞机。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that uses radio waves to find the position of things and watch their movement

name: radical
trans: n. 基础；激进分子；[物化] 原子团；[数] 根数

sentences.english: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.english: a radical reform of the tax system
sentences.chinese: 税收制度的彻底改革

sentences.english: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根本的，基本的；激进的，激进派的
detailed_translations.english: a radical change or difference is very big and important
someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

name: rage
trans: n. 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动

sentences.english: Sobbing with rage, Carol was taken to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗尔气得呜呜哭，被送往医院。

sentences.english: Richens was 17 when he flew into a rage and stabbed another teenager.
sentences.chinese: 里琴斯17岁那年一怒之下捅了一名少年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of uncontrollable anger
to feel very angry about something and show this in the way you behave or speak

name: raid
trans: n. 袭击；突袭；搜捕；抢劫

sentences.english: a bombing raid
sentences.chinese: 轰炸

sentences.english: an air raid warning siren
sentences.chinese: 空袭警报

detailed_translations.chinese: 袭击； 突入查抄， 突入搜捕； 劫掠
detailed_translations.english: a short attack on a place by soldiers, planes, or ships, intended to cause damage but not take control

name: rally
trans: n. 集会；回复；公路赛车会

sentences.english: After a shaky start, he rallied and won the title in style.
sentences.chinese: 虽然开局不顺，但他振作精神，最后漂亮地赢得了冠军。

sentences.english: The Tokyo stock market rallied later in the day.
sentences.chinese: 当天晚些时候东京股市止跌回升。

detailed_translations.chinese: 团结；重整；恢复；（网球等）连续对打
detailed_translations.english: to become stronger again after a period of weakness or defeat
a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc

name: ranking
trans: n. 等级；地位

name: rape
trans: n. 强奸，掠夺；[园艺] 油菜；葡萄渣

sentences.english: Police are investigating a series of violent rapes in the town.
sentences.chinese: 警察在调查镇上发生的一连串暴力强奸案。

sentences.english: He was arrested and charged with rape.
sentences.chinese: 他被捕并被控强奸。

sentences.english: He always denied that he was guilty of rape.
sentences.chinese: 他一直否认自己犯有强奸罪。

sentences.english: a rape victim
sentences.chinese: 遭强奸者

sentences.english: the gang rape of a 17-year-old girl
sentences.chinese: 对一个17岁少女的轮奸

sentences.english: He was convicted of attempted rape .
sentences.chinese: 他被判犯有强奸未遂罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强奸，掠夺；[园艺] 油菜；葡萄渣
detailed_translations.english: the crime of forcing someone to have sex, especially by using violence
to force someone to have sex, especially by using violence

name: ratio
trans: n. 比率，比例

sentences.english: Yeah, , now you know how the sex ratio matters!
sentences.chinese: 是的，现在你知道性别比例的问题了吧！ ！

sentences.english: The ratio could reach one in four within a year.
sentences.chinese: 一年之内这个比例可以达到四分之一。

sentences.english: When using profiling it is typical to consider only the ratio (or percentage) of time spent in certain areas.
sentences.chinese: 当使用分析时，它是典型的考虑时间花费在某些领域的比例（或百分比）。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship between two amounts, represented by a pair of numbers showing how much bigger one amount is than the other

name: rational
trans: n. 有理数

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

name: ray
trans: n. 射线；光线；【鱼类】鳐形目(Rajiformes)鱼

sentences.english: The room darkened as a cloud hid the sun’s rays.
sentences.chinese: 一朵云挡住了阳光，房间暗了下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 射线；光线；【鱼类】鳐形目(Rajiformes)鱼
detailed_translations.english: a straight narrow beam of light from the sun or moon

name: readily
trans: adv. 容易地；乐意地；无困难地

sentences.english: Boats are readily available to visitors.
sentences.chinese: 游客可以很方便地租到船只。

sentences.english: The information is readily accessible on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 这些信息在因特网上一查就能找到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐意地， 欣然地； 容易地； 很快地， 立即
detailed_translations.english: quickly and easily

name: realization
trans: n. 实现；领悟

sentences.english: the realization of his dreams
sentences.chinese: 他的梦想成真

detailed_translations.english: when you achieve something that you had planned or hoped for

name: realm
trans: n. 领域，范围；王国

sentences.english: the spiritual realm
sentences.chinese: 精神领域

detailed_translations.english: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

name: rear
trans: n. 后面；屁股；后方部队

sentences.english: It’s a good place to rear young children.
sentences.chinese: 这地方非常适合抚养小孩子成长。

sentences.english: The birds have been successfully reared in captivity.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟笼养成功。

detailed_translations.english: to look after a person or animal until they are fully grown

name: reasoning
trans: n. 推理；论证；评理

sentences.english: Let me explain my reasoning.
sentences.chinese: 让我解释我的推论。

sentences.english: Your reasoning is comprehensive but I do not agree with you.
sentences.chinese: 你的推理是可以理解的，但我不同意你的观点。

sentences.english: But auctions require "if he thinks that she thinks that I think that he thinks" chains of reasoning that tend to have weak links.
sentences.chinese: 不过，拍卖要求有“如果他认为她认为我认为他那么认为”的推理链条，而这种链条往往存在薄弱环节。

detailed_translations.english: a process of thinking carefully about something in order to make a judgment

name: reassure
trans: vt. 使…安心，使消除疑虑

sentences.english: Teachers reassured anxious parents.
sentences.chinese: 老师们安慰焦急的父母。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less worried or frightened about a problem or situation

name: rebel
trans: n. 反叛者；叛徒

sentences.english: Voters rebelled against high property taxes.
sentences.chinese: 投票者们反对高额财产税。

detailed_translations.english: to oppose or fight against someone in authority or against an idea or situation which you do not agree with
someone who opposes or fights against people in authority

name: rebellion
trans: n. 叛乱；反抗；谋反；不服从

sentences.english: an armed rebellion
sentences.chinese: 武装叛乱

detailed_translations.english: an organized attempt to change the government or leader of a country, using violence

name: recipient
trans: n. 容器，接受者；容纳者

sentences.english: ...the largest recipient of U.S. foreign aid.
sentences.chinese: …最大的美国对外援助接受方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who receives something

name: reconstruction
trans: n. 再建，重建；改造；复兴

sentences.english: ...America's part in the postwar reconstruction of Germany.
sentences.chinese: …美国在战后德国重建中扮演的角色。

detailed_translations.english: the work that is done to repair the damage to a city, industry etc, especially after a war

name: recount
trans: n. 重算

sentences.english: The defeated candidate demanded a recount.
sentences.chinese: 落选的候选人要求重新计票。

sentences.english: He then recounted the story of the interview for his first job.
sentences.chinese: 他然后叙述了有关他第一份工作面试的故事。

detailed_translations.english: a second count of votes that happens in an election because the result was very close
to tell someone a story or describe a series of events

name: referendum
trans: n. 公民投票权；外交官请示书

sentences.english: The city council agreed to hold a referendum on the issue in November.
sentences.chinese: 市政会同意在11月就此问题进行全民投票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民投票权；外交官请示书
detailed_translations.english: when people vote in order to make a decision about a particular subject, rather than voting for a person

name: reflection
trans: n. 反射；沉思；映象

sentences.english: Can you see your reflection in the glass?
sentences.chinese: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: ...the reflection of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

sentences.english: Inhibition in adulthood seems to be a reflection of a person's experiences as a child.
sentences.chinese: 成年期的压抑似乎是一个人童年经历的一种反映。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

name: reform
trans: n. 改革，改良；改正

sentences.english: plans to radically reform the tax system
sentences.chinese: 彻底改革税收制度的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 改革， 改良， 改造； 改正， 改过自新
detailed_translations.english: to improve a system, law, organization etc by making a lot of changes to it, so that it operates in a fairer or more effective way

name: refuge
trans: n. 避难；避难所；庇护

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

name: refusal
trans: n. 拒绝；优先取舍权；推却；取舍权

sentences.english: Her country suffered through her refusal to accept change.
sentences.chinese: 她的国家因为她拒绝接受变革而受了害。

detailed_translations.english: when you say firmly that you will not do, give, or accept something

name: regain
trans: n. 收复；取回

sentences.english: The family never quite regained its former influence.
sentences.chinese: 这个家族再也没有恢复往昔的影响力。

sentences.english: He somehow managed to regain his balance .
sentences.chinese: 他总算恢复了平衡。

sentences.english: Government forces have regained control of the city.
sentences.chinese: 政府军已重新控制了这座城市。

sentences.english: When she regained consciousness (= woke up after being unconscious ) , she was lying on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她恢复知觉醒来时，正躺在地板上。

sentences.english: He looked stunned, but he soon regain ed his composure (= became calm again ) .
sentences.chinese: 他似乎愣了愣，但很快就恢复平静了。

sentences.english: The doctors don’t know if he will ever regain the use of his legs.
sentences.chinese: 医生们不知道他的腿是否还能恢复功能。

detailed_translations.english: to get something back, especially an ability or quality, that you have lost

name: regardless
trans: adj. 不管的；不顾的；不注意的

sentences.english: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or influenced by something

name: regime
trans: n. 政权，政体；社会制度；管理体制

sentences.english: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
sentences.chinese: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

sentences.english: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
sentences.chinese: 根据新制度，所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

detailed_translations.english: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

name: regulator
trans: n. 调整者；监管者；校准器

sentences.english: a heat regulator
sentences.chinese: 热调节器

detailed_translations.english: an instrument for controlling the temperature, speed etc of something

name: regulatory
trans: adj. 管理的；控制的；调整的

sentences.english: Perhaps the best reason for regulators to be suspicious about innovation is that so much of it in the modern world is aimed at facilitating regulatory and tax arbitrage.
sentences.chinese: 监管者之所以对创新怀有疑虑，最关键的原因可能在于，现代社会中太多创新的目的都是为监管和税收套利提供便利。

detailed_translations.english: a regulatory authority has the official power to control an activity and to make sure that it is done in a satisfactory way

name: rehabilitation
trans: n. 复原

sentences.english: A second evaluation at the end of this period determines the length of time a detainee must spend in community rehabilitation.
sentences.chinese: 这一时期结束时的第二次评估被用来确定被拘留者必须花多少时间进行社区康复。

sentences.english: Third, you and the organization have the responsibility under most state laws of finding avenues for an employee’s rehabilitation.
sentences.chinese: 第三，按照大多数州立法，你和你的单位是有责任为雇员的康复寻找一个很好的途径。

sentences.english: They also benefit less from prevention efforts, and have less access to high-quality treatment and rehabilitation services.
sentences.chinese: 他们也较少能受益于预防工作，而且较少能获取高质量的治疗和康复服务。

name: reign
trans: n. 统治；统治时期；支配

sentences.english: Last night confusion reigned about how the debate, which continues today, would end.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，这场在今天继续进行的辩论将如何结束的问题令人困惑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 当政， 统治； 占主导地位
detailed_translations.english: If you say, for example, that silence reigns in a place or confusion reigns in a situation, you mean that the place is silent or the situation is confused

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主的统治，君主的统治时期
detailed_translations.english: the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor

name: rejection
trans: n. 抛弃；拒绝；被抛弃的东西；盖帽

sentences.english: They sent me a rejection letter.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我发了一封回绝信。

detailed_translations.english: the act of not accepting, believing in, or agreeing with something

name: relevance
trans: n. 关联；适当；中肯

sentences.english: I think we can all appreciate the relevance of that now.
sentences.chinese: 我想，我们大家现在都能领会这句话中肯。

name: reliability
trans: n. 可靠性

sentences.english: I can assure you of the reliability of the information.
sentences.chinese: 我可以向你保证这消息是可靠的。

sentences.english: You have to work at it and design it in to your systems from the beginning, just like you have to design in scalability, performance, reliability and security.
sentences.chinese: 您从一开始就得学习它并将其设计到您的系统中，就像您在可伸缩性、性能、可靠性和安全性方面进行的设计一样。

sentences.english: How will that affect reliability and other factors?
sentences.chinese: 将如何影响可靠性和其他因素？

name: reluctant
trans: adj. 不情愿的；勉强的；顽抗的

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

name: remainder
trans: n. [数] 余数，残余；剩余物；其余的人

sentences.english: The remainder must be paid by the end of June.
sentences.chinese: 剩余款项必须在6月底之前支付。

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 余数，残余；剩余物；其余的人
detailed_translations.english: the part of something that is left after everything else has gone or been dealt with

name: remains
trans: n. 残余；遗骸

sentences.english: extensive Roman remains (= of ancient buildings ) at Arles
sentences.chinese: 阿尔勒的一大片古罗马遗迹

detailed_translations.english: the parts of something that are left after the rest has been destroyed or has disappeared

name: remedy
trans: n. 补救；治疗；赔偿

sentences.english: The problems in our schools do not have a simple remedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校的问题没有简单的解决办法。

sentences.english: To remedy the situation, the water must be chemically treated.
sentences.chinese: 为了改善这种情况，水必须进行化学处理。

detailed_translations.english: a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better
to deal with a problem or improve a bad situation

name: reminder
trans: n. 暗示；提醒的人/物；催单

sentences.english: a reminder from the dentist for your check-up
sentences.chinese: 牙医寄来的检查提醒函

detailed_translations.english: something, for example a letter, that reminds you to do something which you might have forgotten

name: removal
trans: n. 免职；移动；排除；搬迁

sentences.english: the removal of rubbish
sentences.chinese: 移除垃圾

sentences.english: stain removal
sentences.chinese: 去污

detailed_translations.english: when something is taken away from, out of, or off the place where it is

name: render
trans: n. 打底；交纳；粉刷

sentences.english: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
sentences.chinese: 为有困难的人提供援助的义务

sentences.english: a bill of $3,200 for services rendered
sentences.chinese: 一张3,200美元服务费的账单

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

name: renew
trans: vt. 使更新；续借；续费；复兴；重申

sentences.english: The window frames need to be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 窗框需要换新的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it

name: renowned
trans: v. 使有声誉（renown的过去分词）

sentences.english: The area is renowned for its Romanesque churches.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区以其罗马式教堂闻名。

detailed_translations.english: known and admired by a lot of people, especially for a special skill, achievement, or quality

name: rental
trans: n. 租金收入，租金；租赁

sentences.english: Video rental is usually £3.
sentences.chinese: 录像带的租金通常是3英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the money that you pay to use a car, television, or other machine over a period of time

name: replacement
trans: n. 更换；复位；代替者；补充兵员

sentences.english: Our old car is badly in need of replacement.
sentences.chinese: 我们的旧车急需更换。

sentences.english: replacement windows
sentences.chinese: 新换的窗户

detailed_translations.english: when you get something that is newer or better than the one you had before

name: reportedly
trans: adv. 据报道；据传闻

sentences.english: Her husband’s assets are reportedly worth over $15 million.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫的资产据传超过1,500万美元。

detailed_translations.english: according to what some people say

name: representation
trans: n. 代表；表现；表示法；陈述

sentences.english: The clock in the painting is a symbolic representation of the passage of time.
sentences.chinese: 画上的时钟象征着光阴的流逝。

sentences.english: A group of students made representations to the college about the poor standard of the accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 一群学生就恶劣的住宿条件同校方交涉。

sentences.english: Minority groups need more effective parliamentary representation.
sentences.chinese: 少数族群需要办事更为高效的议会代表。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, sign, description etc that shows something

name: reproduce
trans: vt. 复制；再生；生殖；使…在脑海中重现

sentences.english: Klimt’s artwork is reproduced in this exquisite book.
sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

name: reproduction
trans: n. 繁殖，生殖；复制；复制品

sentences.english: Scientists studied the reproduction, diet, and health of the dolphins.
sentences.chinese: 科学家研究了海豚的繁殖情况、进食规律和健康状况。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["sexual reproduction"]}
sentences.chinese: 有性繁殖

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of producing babies, young animals, or plants

name: republic
trans: n. 共和国；共和政体

sentences.english: the former Federal Republic of Germany
sentences.chinese: 前德意志联邦共和国

sentences.english: Nine republics took part in the referendum.
sentences.chinese: 有九个共和国参加了全民公决。

detailed_translations.english: a country governed by elected representatives of the people, and led by a president, not a king or queen

name: resemble
trans: vt. 类似，像

sentences.english: It’s amazing how closely Brian and Steve resemble each other.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。

sentences.english: He grew up to resemble his father.
sentences.chinese: 他长大了，很像他父亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look like or be similar to someone or something

name: reside
trans: vi. 住，居住；属于

sentences.english: He spent most of his time in Rutherglen, where his family resided.
sentences.chinese: 他大部分时间都在拉瑟格伦度过，他的家人就在那里居住。

detailed_translations.english: to live in a particular place

name: residence
trans: n. 住宅，住处；居住

sentences.english: Rome was his main place of residence.
sentences.chinese: 罗马是他的主要居住地。

sentences.english: the ambassador’s official residence
sentences.chinese: 大使官邸

detailed_translations.english: the state of living in a place

name: residential
trans: adj. 住宅的；与居住有关的

sentences.english: a quiet residential neighbourhood
sentences.chinese: 安静的住宅区

detailed_translations.chinese: 居住的， 住宅的； 寄宿的， 住在住所的
detailed_translations.english: a residential part of a town consists of private houses, with no offices or factories

name: residue
trans: n. 残渣；剩余；滤渣

sentences.english: The flies leave a sticky residue on crops.
sentences.chinese: 苍蝇在庄稼上留下黏糊糊的分泌物。

sentences.english: Rinse off any soap residue.
sentences.chinese: 冲净残留的肥皂。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that remains on a surface, in a container etc and cannot be removed easily, or that remains after a chemical process

name: resignation
trans: n. 辞职；放弃；辞职书；顺从

sentences.english: She gave a sigh of resignation.
sentences.chinese: 她无奈地叹了一口气。

sentences.english: He accepted her decision with resignation.
sentences.chinese: 他无可奈何地接受了她的决定。

detailed_translations.english: when someone calmly accepts a situation that cannot be changed, even though it is bad

name: resistance
trans: n. 阻力；电阻；抵抗；反抗；抵抗力

sentences.english: Rebel gunmen have put up strong resistance.
sentences.chinese: 持枪的叛乱分子负隅顽抗。

sentences.english: disease resistance
sentences.chinese: 抗病能力

detailed_translations.english: fighting against someone who is attacking you

name: respective
trans: adj. 分别的，各自的

sentences.english: We all went back to our respective homes to wait for news.
sentences.chinese: 我们都各自回家等待消息。

sentences.english: the respective roles of teachers and students
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生各自不同的角色

detailed_translations.english: used before a plural noun to refer to the different things that belong to each separate person or thing mentioned

name: respectively
trans: adv. 分别地；各自地，独自地

sentences.english: The cups and saucers cost £5 and £3 respectively.
sentences.chinese: 茶杯和茶碟的价钱分别为5英镑和3英镑。

detailed_translations.english: in the same order as the things you have just mentioned

name: restoration
trans: n. 恢复；复位；王政复辟；归还

sentences.english: You have control over the restoration of objects.
sentences.chinese: 您还可以控制对象的恢复。

detailed_translations.english: the act of bringing back a law, tax, or system of government

name: restraint
trans: n. 抑制，克制；约束

sentences.english: The police were praised for their restraint in handling the demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 警方因对待示威者时所表现出的克制而受到赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: calm sensible controlled behaviour, especially in a situation when it is difficult to stay calm

name: resume
trans: n. 摘要；[管理] 履历，简历

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: retreat
trans: n. 撤退；休息寓所；撤退

sentences.english: Napoleon’s retreat from Moscow
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑从莫斯科的撤退

sentences.english: The rebel forces are in full retreat (= retreating very fast ) .
sentences.chinese: 叛军全线溃退。

sentences.english: The bugler sounded the retreat (= gave a loud signal for retreat ) .
sentences.chinese: 司号兵吹响撤退号。

detailed_translations.english: a movement away from the enemy after a defeat in battle
to move away from the enemy after being defeated in battle

name: retrieve
trans: n. [计] 检索；恢复，取回

sentences.english: She bent down to retrieve her earring.
sentences.chinese: 她俯身去捡回耳环。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新得到， 取回， 收回； 挽回， 补救； 检索
detailed_translations.english: to find something and bring it back

name: revelation
trans: n. 启示；揭露；出乎意料的事；被揭露的真相

sentences.english: ...following the revelation of his affair with a former secretary.
sentences.chinese: …在他和前任秘书的风流韵事被揭露之后。

detailed_translations.english: a surprising fact about someone or something that was previously secret and is now made known

name: revenge
trans: n. 报复；复仇

sentences.english: The attackers were said to be taking revenge on the 14-year-old, claiming he was a school bully.
sentences.chinese: 攻击者被称是在报复一名14岁男孩，称他是学校一霸。

detailed_translations.english: something you do in order to punish someone who has harmed or offended you
to punish someone who has done something to harm you or someone else

name: reverse
trans: n. 背面；相反；倒退；失败

sentences.english: Reverse the paper in the printer.
sentences.chinese: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

sentences.english: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
sentences.chinese: 这种错误的态度会得到恰好相反的结果。

detailed_translations.english: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

detailed_translations.chinese: 反向的； 相反的； 颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

name: revival
trans: n. 复兴；复活；苏醒；恢复精神；再生效

sentences.english: The US and the UK have expectations of economic revival.
sentences.chinese: 美国和英国对经济复苏有所期待。

detailed_translations.english: a process in which something becomes active or strong again

name: revive
trans: vt. 使复兴；使苏醒；回想起；重演，重播

sentences.english: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

sentences.english: an attempt to revive the steel industry
sentences.chinese: 复苏钢铁工业的努力

sentences.english: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她注射葡萄糖，使她苏醒过来。

detailed_translations.english: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

name: revolutionary
trans: n. 革命者

sentences.english: The new cancer drug is a revolutionary breakthrough.
sentences.chinese: 这种抗癌新药是一个革命性突破。

sentences.english: a revolutionary new drug
sentences.chinese: 一种革命性的新药

detailed_translations.english: completely new and different, especially in a way that leads to great improvements
someone who joins in or supports a political or social revolution

name: rhetoric
trans: n. 修辞，修辞学；华丽的词藻

sentences.english: The speech was dismissed by some people as merely political rhetoric .
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为这场演讲只是华而不实的政治空谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 修辞，修辞学；华丽的词藻
detailed_translations.english: the art of speaking or writing to persuade or influence people

name: rifle
trans: n. 步枪；来复枪

sentences.english: They shot him at point blank range with an automatic rifle.
sentences.chinese: 他们用一支自动步枪在近距离射程内射中了他。

detailed_translations.english: a long gun which you hold up to your shoulder to shoot

name: riot
trans: n. 暴乱；放纵；蔓延

sentences.english: urban riots
sentences.chinese: 城市骚乱

sentences.english: prison riots
sentences.chinese: 监狱暴乱

sentences.english: His murder triggered vicious race riots (= caused by a problem between different races ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的被杀引发了严重的种族骚乱。

sentences.english: police wearing riot gear
sentences.chinese: 配有防暴装备的警察

sentences.english: police in bullet-proof vests and carrying riot shields
sentences.chinese: 穿防弹背心、持防暴盾牌的警察

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a large crowd of people are behaving in a violent and uncontrolled way, especially when they are protesting about something
if a crowd of people riot, they behave in a violent and uncontrolled way, for example by fighting the police and damaging cars or buildings

name: rip
trans: n. 裂口，裂缝

sentences.english: Her clothes had all been ripped.
sentences.chinese: 她的衣服都被撕破了。

sentences.english: The sail ripped under the force of the wind.
sentences.chinese: 船帆被狂风刮破了。

sentences.english: Impatiently, Sue ripped the letter open .
sentences.chinese: 休急不可待地撕开信封。

detailed_translations.english: to tear something or be torn quickly and violently
a long tear or cut

name: ritual
trans: n. 仪式；惯例；礼制

sentences.english: ancient pagan rituals
sentences.chinese: 古老的异教仪式

sentences.english: the importance of religion and ritual in our lives
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中宗教和宗教仪式的重要性

sentences.english: The lady of the house performs the sacred ritual of lighting two candles.
sentences.chinese: 由女主人来完成点燃两根蜡烛的神圣仪式。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

name: robust
trans: adj. 强健的；健康的；粗野的；粗鲁的

sentences.english: a robust man of six feet four
sentences.chinese: 一个身高六英尺四英寸的壮汉

detailed_translations.english: a robust person is strong and healthy

name: rock
trans: n. 岩石；摇滚乐；暗礁

sentences.english: She covered her face, rocking to and fro in her grief.
sentences.chinese: 她捂住脸，悲痛得身体不住地来回晃动。

sentences.english: The waves rocked the boat from side to side .
sentences.chinese: 波浪使小船左摇右晃。

sentences.english: Paul sat gently rocking the child in his arms.
sentences.chinese: 保罗坐着，轻轻摇晃怀里的孩子。

sentences.english: Jim rocked with laughter when he heard what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆听了发生的事情后笑得前仰后合。

detailed_translations.english: to move gently backwards and forwards or from side to side, or to make something do this
a type of popular modern music with a strong loud beat, played using  guitar s  and drums

name: rod
trans: n. 棒；惩罚；枝条；权力

sentences.english: a measuring rod
sentences.chinese: 测量杆

detailed_translations.english: a long thin pole or bar

name: rotate
trans: vt. 使旋转；使转动；使轮流

sentences.english: The Earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 地球每24小时绕地轴自转一周。

sentences.english: Rotate the pan halfway through the baking time.
sentences.chinese: 烘烤到一半时把盘子转一下。

detailed_translations.english: to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this
to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this

name: rotation
trans: n. 旋转；循环，轮流

sentences.english: The rotation of flagella pushes the bacteria through the water.
sentences.chinese: 鞭毛的旋转可以推动细菌在水中行进。

sentences.english: Sets this matrix to a translation, rotation and scaling matrix.
sentences.chinese: 设置这个矩阵为一个平移、旋转和缩放矩阵。

detailed_translations.english: when something turns with a circular movement around a central point

name: ruling
trans: n. 统治，支配；裁定

sentences.english: Goodwin tried to have the court ruling overturned.
sentences.chinese: 古德温试图推翻法院的裁决。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision, especially one made by a court

name: rumour
trans: n. 谣言

sentences.english: His name has come up in the rumour mill as a possible director for the project.
sentences.chinese: 有谣传说他可能出任这个项目的主管。

detailed_translations.english: information or a story that is passed from one person to another and which may or may not be true

name: sack
trans: n. 麻布袋；洗劫

sentences.english: They’ve never actually given anyone the sack .
sentences.chinese: 他们从未真的辞退过什么人。

sentences.english: He got the sack for stealing.
sentences.chinese: 他因偷东西而被解雇。

sentences.english: She claimed she’d been threatened with the sack.
sentences.chinese: 她称自己受到过解雇的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is dismissed from their job
to dismiss someone from their job

name: sacred
trans: adj. 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的

sentences.english: a sacred vow
sentences.chinese: 神圣的誓言

sentences.english: the miraculous powers of sacred relics
sentences.chinese: 圣物的神奇力量

sentences.english: Certain animals were considered sacred.
sentences.chinese: 有些动物被认为是神圣的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a god or religion

name: sacrifice
trans: n. 牺牲；祭品；供奉

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: saint
trans: n. 圣人；圣徒；道德崇高的人

sentences.english: Saint Patrick
sentences.chinese: 圣帕特里克

sentences.english: Statues of saints lined the walls of the church.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的墙边立着一排圣徒像。

detailed_translations.chinese: 圣人；圣徒；道德崇高的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is given the title ‘saint’ by the Christian church after they have died, because they have been very good or holy

name: sake
trans: n. 目的；利益；理由；日本米酒

sentences.english: He moved to the seaside for the sake of his health.
sentences.chinese: 他为了健康而迁居海滨。

sentences.english: I only went for Kay’s sake.
sentences.chinese: 我是为了凯才去的。

sentences.english: I hope he’s told the truth for his own sake (= because it will be good for him ) .
sentences.chinese: 为了他自己好，我希望他已经说出了真相。

detailed_translations.english: in order to help, improve, or please someone or something

name: sanction
trans: n. 制裁，处罚；认可；支持

sentences.english: a resolution to impose sanctions (= start using sanctions ) on DPRK
sentences.chinese: 对朝鲜实施制裁的决议

sentences.english: the threat of trade sanctions
sentences.chinese: 贸易制裁的威胁

sentences.english: The UN security council may impose economic sanctions .
sentences.chinese: 联合国安理会可能会实施经济制裁。

sentences.english: Any talk about lifting sanctions (= ending them ) is premature.
sentences.chinese: 现时就谈取消制裁为时过早。

detailed_translations.english: official orders or laws stopping trade, communication etc with another country, as a way of forcing its leaders to make political changes
to officially accept or allow something

name: say
trans: vt. 讲；说明；例如；声称；假设；指明

sentences.english: ‘I’m so tired,’ she said.
sentences.chinese: “我太累了。”她说。

sentences.english: ‘Don’t cry,’ he said softly.
sentences.chinese: “别哭了。”他柔声说道。

sentences.english: Don’t believe anything he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说什么都不要相信。

sentences.english: I always said I would buy a motorbike when I had enough money.
sentences.chinese: 我一直说等我有了足够的钱就买一辆摩托车。

sentences.english: I would like to say how much we appreciate your hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我想说我们对你的辛勤劳动非常感谢。

sentences.english: ‘Why did she leave?’ ‘I don’t know – she didn’t say .’
sentences.chinese: “她为什么要离开？”“我不知道——她没说。”

sentences.english: Although he didn’t say so , it was clear that he was in pain.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他没说，但是他明显很痛苦。

sentences.english: (= why do you think that ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会那么说呢？

sentences.english: I’d like to say a few words (= make a short speech ) .
sentences.chinese: 我想简单地说几句。

sentences.english: ‘So what are your plans now?’‘ I’d rather not say .’
sentences.chinese: “那么你现在的计划是什么？”“我还是不说的好。”

detailed_translations.english: to express an idea, feeling, thought etc using words

name: scattered
trans: adj. 分散的；散乱的

sentences.english: There will be some scattered showers (= short periods of rain ) in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 下午将有零星阵雨。

sentences.english: a widely scattered set of islands
sentences.chinese: 分散得很广的一片群岛

detailed_translations.english: spread over a wide area or over a long period of time

name: sceptical
trans: adj. 怀疑的；怀疑论的；习惯怀疑的

sentences.english: Others here are more sceptical about the chances for justice being done.
sentences.chinese: 这里的其他人更为怀疑正义能否得到伸张。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的；怀疑论的；习惯怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: If you are sceptical about something, you have doubts about it

name: scope
trans: n. 范围；余地；视野；眼界；导弹射程

sentences.english: measures to limit the scope of criminals’ activities
sentences.chinese: 限制罪犯活动范围的措施

detailed_translations.english: the range of things that a subject, activity, book etc deals with

name: screw
trans: n. 螺旋；螺丝钉；吝啬鬼

sentences.english: Fix the frame in position and tighten the screws.
sentences.chinese: 把框子固定在正确位置上，拧紧螺丝。

sentences.english: The lens screws onto the front of the camera.
sentences.chinese: 镜头旋扣在照相机正面。

detailed_translations.english: a thin pointed piece of metal that you push and turn in order to fasten pieces of metal or wood together
to fasten or close something by turning it, or to be fastened in this way

name: scrutiny
trans: n. 详细审查；监视；细看；选票复查

sentences.english: Their activities have come under police scrutiny .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动受到警方的严密监视。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细检查， 仔细观察
detailed_translations.english: careful and thorough examination of someone or something

name: seal
trans: n. 密封；印章；海豹；封条；标志

sentences.english: The document carried the seal of the governor’s office.
sentences.chinese: 文件上盖有州长办公室的章。

sentences.english: He broke the wax seal and unrolled the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他揭去封蜡，把纸卷展开。

sentences.english: The window was sealed shut.
sentences.chinese: 这扇窗户被封了起来。

detailed_translations.english: a mark that has a special design and shows the legal or official authority of a person or organization
to close an entrance or a container with something that stops air, water etc from coming in or out of it

name: secular
trans: n. 修道院外的教士，(对宗教家而言的) 俗人

sentences.english: secular education
sentences.chinese: 世俗教育

sentences.english: our modern secular society
sentences.chinese: 我们的现代世俗社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的；长期的；现世的；不朽的
detailed_translations.english: not connected with or controlled by a church or other religious authority

detailed_translations.chinese: 修道院外的教士，(对宗教家而言的) 俗人

name: seemingly
trans: adv. 看来似乎；表面上看来

sentences.english: seemingly unrelated bits of information
sentences.chinese: 似乎互不相关的零星信息

detailed_translations.english: appearing to have a particular quality, when this may or may not be true

name: segment
trans: n. 段；部分

sentences.english: Decorate with orange segments.
sentences.chinese: 用几瓣橙子作点缀。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

name: seize
trans: vt. 抓住；夺取；理解；逮捕

sentences.english: Suddenly he seized my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他突然抓住我的手。

sentences.english: The rebels have seized power.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子夺取了政权。

sentences.english: The gunmen were seized at 1 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 这几名持枪歹徒在凌晨1点被抓获。

detailed_translations.english: to take hold of something suddenly and violently

name: seldom
trans: adv. 很少，不常

sentences.english: Karen had seldom seen him so angry.
sentences.chinese: 卡伦很少见他这么生气过。

detailed_translations.english: very rarely or almost never

name: selective
trans: adj. 选择性的

sentences.english: selective schools
sentences.chinese: 择优录取学生的学校

sentences.english: He has a very selective memory (= he chooses what he wants to remember and what to forget ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的记忆选择性很强。

detailed_translations.english: careful about what you choose to do, buy, allow etc

name: senator
trans: n. 参议员；（古罗马的）元老院议员；评议员，理事

sentences.english: Senator Kennedy
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪参议员

detailed_translations.english: a member of the Senate or a senate

name: sensation
trans: n. 感觉；轰动；感动

sentences.english: One sign of a heart attack is a tingling sensation in the left arm.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病发作的一个征兆是左臂有刺痛感。

sentences.english: The sex scenes in the film caused a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片中的性爱镜头引起了轰动。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you get from one of your five senses, especially the sense of touch

name: sensitivity
trans: n. 敏感；敏感性；过敏

sentences.english: Each user should have access to a security level based upon the level of data sensitivity he or she can see.
sentences.chinese: 根据用户可以看到的数据的敏感性级别，每个用户都应该可以访问某个安全级别。

sentences.english: The authentication mode you choose for your environment will be determined by the level of sensitivity of your data.
sentences.chinese: 应该为您的环境选择什么样的身份验证模式，这是由数据的敏感级别来决定的。

sentences.english: The sensitivity of the test meets WHO standards for detecting the toxin in drinking water.
sentences.chinese: 这种测试的灵敏度满足了世界卫生组织探测饮用水毒物的标准。

name: sentiment
trans: n. 感情，情绪；情操；观点；多愁善感

sentences.english: the spread of nationalist sentiments
sentences.chinese: 民族主义情绪的传播

sentences.english: the anti-immigrant sentiments expressed by some Americans
sentences.chinese: 一些美国人表露出的反移民情绪

detailed_translations.english: a feeling or an opinion, especially one based on emotions

name: separation
trans: n. 分离，分开；间隔，距离；[法] 分居；缺口

sentences.english: the separation of church and state
sentences.chinese: 政教分离

detailed_translations.chinese: 分离，分开；间隔，距离；[法] 分居；缺口
detailed_translations.english: when something separates or is separate

name: serial
trans: n. 电视连续剧；[图情] 期刊；连载小说

sentences.english: Keep the questions in the same serial order .
sentences.chinese: 让这些问题保持原来的顺序。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连续的；连载的；分期偿还的
detailed_translations.english: arranged or happening one after the other in the correct order

detailed_translations.chinese: 电视连续剧；[图情] 期刊；连载小说
detailed_translations.english: a story that is broadcast or printed in several separate parts on television, in a magazine etc

name: settlement
trans: n. 解决，处理；[会计] 结算；沉降；殖民

sentences.english: Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt to reach a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。

sentences.english: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。

sentences.english: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
sentences.chinese: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

sentences.english: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
sentences.chinese: 根据离婚协议，她拿到了房子。

sentences.english: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司花了1,000多万美元进行庭外和解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决； 协议； 居留地， 小社区
detailed_translations.english: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

name: set-up
trans: n. 计划；组织；机构；装配

name: sexuality
trans: n. [胚] 性别；性欲；性征；性方面的事情（比如性行为或性能力）

sentences.english: ...the growing discussion of women's sexuality.
sentences.chinese: …日益增多的对女性性欲的讨论。

detailed_translations.chinese: [胚] 性别；性欲；性征；性方面的事情（比如性行为或性能力）
detailed_translations.english: the things people do, think, and feel that are related to their sexual desires

name: shareholder
trans: n. 股东；股票持有人

sentences.english: Shareholders have been told to expect an even lower result next year.
sentences.chinese: 股东们被告知明年的业绩还会更差。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns shares in a company or business

name: shatter
trans: n. 碎片；乱七八糟的状态

sentences.english: The explosion shattered the building.
sentences.chinese: 这次爆炸把大楼炸成一片废墟。

sentences.english: A tragic accident shattered her dreams of Olympic glory.
sentences.chinese: 一场不幸的意外事故使她获得奥运奖牌的梦想破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to break suddenly into very small pieces, or to make something break in this way

name: shed
trans: n. 小屋，棚；分水岭

sentences.english: The company is planning to shed about a quarter of its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正计划裁减约四分之一的人员。

sentences.english: The magazine is desperately trying to shed its old-fashioned image.
sentences.chinese: 这份杂志急于摆脱其过时的形象。

sentences.english: a diet to help you shed pounds
sentences.chinese: 帮助你减肥的食谱

detailed_translations.chinese: 脱落，脱去；流出，流下；发出，散发
detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something that you no longer need or want
a small building, often made of wood, used especially for storing things

name: sheer
trans: n. 偏航；透明薄织物

sentences.english: cliffs which rose sheer from the sea
sentences.chinese: 从海面垂直拔起的悬崖

detailed_translations.english: straight up or down in an almost vertical line
to change direction suddenly, especially in order to avoid something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全的，十足的；陡峭的，垂直的；极薄的，透明的
detailed_translations.english: a sheer drop, cliff, slope etc is very steep and almost vertical

name: shipping
trans: n. [船] 船舶，船舶吨数；海运；运送

sentences.english: The port is closed to all shipping.
sentences.chinese: 这个港口已经封港。

detailed_translations.chinese: [船] 船舶，船舶吨数；海运；运送
detailed_translations.english: ships considered as a group

name: shoot
trans: n. 射击；摄影；狩猎；急流

sentences.english: Police shot one suspect when he pulled a gun on them.
sentences.chinese: 警方在一名嫌疑人拔枪指着他们时击毙了他。

sentences.english: Smith killed his wife, and then shot himself.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯杀死妻子，然后开枪自杀。

sentences.english: A woman was shot dead in an attempted robbery.
sentences.chinese: 一名女子在一桩未遂抢劫案中中枪身亡。

sentences.english: The guards have orders to shoot intruders on sight (= shoot them as soon as they see them ) .
sentences.chinese: 卫兵们奉命一见到有人闯入就开枪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 射击，射中；拍摄；发芽；使爆炸；给…注射
detailed_translations.english: to deliberately kill or injure someone using a gun
an occasion when someone takes photographs or makes a film

name: shrink
trans: vi. 收缩；畏缩

sentences.english: I’m worried about washing that shirt in case it shrinks.
sentences.chinese: 我不太敢洗那件衬衫，怕它会缩水。

detailed_translations.chinese: 起皱； 收缩； 退缩， 畏缩
detailed_translations.english: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

name: shrug
trans: n. 耸肩

sentences.english: I just shrugged my shoulders and ignored him.
sentences.chinese: 我只是耸耸肩，没有理睬他。

sentences.english: ‘Suit yourself,’ he said with a shrug.
sentences.chinese: “随你的便。”他耸耸肩说道。

detailed_translations.english: to raise and then lower your shoulders in order to show that you do not know something or do not care about something
a movement of your shoulders upwards and then downwards again that you make to show that you do not know something or do not care about something

name: sigh
trans: n. 叹息，叹气

sentences.english: ‘Well, there’s nothing we can do about it now,’ she sighed.
sentences.chinese: “唉，我们现在对此无能为力。”她叹口气说。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in and out making a long sound, especially because you are bored, disappointed, tired etc
an act or sound of sighing

name: simulate
trans: adj. 模仿的；假装的

sentences.english: a machine that simulates conditions in space
sentences.chinese: 一台模拟太空环境的机器

sentences.english: Interviews can be simulated in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 可以在教室里模拟面试。

detailed_translations.english: to make or produce something that is not real but has the appearance or feeling of being real

name: simulation
trans: n. 仿真；模拟；模仿；假装

sentences.english: a computer simulation used to train airline pilots
sentences.chinese: 用于训练航空公司飞行员的电脑模拟程序

detailed_translations.english: the activity of producing conditions which are similar to real ones, especially in order to test something, or the conditions that are produced

name: simultaneously
trans: adv. 同时地

sentences.english: If they have multiple test cases that will be run on the same platforms, they can select multiple configurations simultaneously and apply the configurations to several of them in batch mode.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们拥有多个将要运行在同一个平台上的测试用例的话，那么他们能够同时选择多个配置，并且将这些配置批量应用到平台上。

name: sin
trans: n. 罪恶；罪孽；过失

sentences.english: She needed to confess her sins and ask for forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她需要忏悔罪过，请求宽恕。

sentences.english: He knew that he had committed a terrible sin .
sentences.chinese: 他知道自己犯下了可怕的罪行。

detailed_translations.english: an action that is against religious rules and is considered to be an offence against God
to do something that is against religious rules and is considered to be an offence against God

name: situated
trans: v. 使位于；使处于（situate的过去分词）

sentences.english: The house is situated near the college.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子位于学院附近。

sentences.english: a farm situated in the valley
sentences.chinese: 位于山谷里的一个农场

sentences.english: The hotel is ideally situated near the seafront.
sentences.chinese: 酒店的位置理想，靠近海滨。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular place or position

name: sketch
trans: n. 素描；略图；梗概

sentences.english: So if we just sketch that.
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.english: He squiggled a sketch on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

detailed_translations.english: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail
a short humorous scene on a television programme, in a theatre etc, that is part of a larger show

name: skip
trans: n. 跳跃；跳读

sentences.english: They saw the man with a little girl skipping along behind him.
sentences.chinese: 他们看到那个男人身后跟着一个蹦蹦跳跳的小女孩。

detailed_translations.english: to go from one subject to another in no fixed order
a skipping movement

name: slam
trans: n. 猛击；砰然声

sentences.english: We heard a car door slam.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到有车门砰的一声关上了。

sentences.english: He slammed the door shut.
sentences.chinese: 他把门砰地关上。

sentences.english: She slammed down the phone angrily.
sentences.chinese: 她气呼呼地啪的一声挂上电话。

detailed_translations.english: to shut, or to make sth shut, with a lot of force, making a loud noise

name: slap
trans: n. 掴；侮辱；掌击；拍打声

sentences.english: Sarah slapped Aaron across the face.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在阿龙的脸上掴了一巴掌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拍击；侮辱；掌击；掴…的耳光
detailed_translations.english: to hit a surface with a lot of force, making a loud sharp sound
a quick hit with the flat part of your hand

name: slash
trans: n. 削减；斜线；猛砍；砍痕；沼泽低地

sentences.english: Someone had slashed the tires.
sentences.chinese: 有人把轮胎割破了。

detailed_translations.english: to cut or try to cut something violently with a knife, sword etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 砍， 砍痕； 斜线号
detailed_translations.english: a line (/) used in writing to separate words, numbers, or letters

name: slavery
trans: n. 奴役；奴隶制度；奴隶身份

sentences.english: attempts to abolish slavery
sentences.chinese: 废除奴隶制的努力

detailed_translations.english: the system of having slaves

name: slot
trans: n. 位置；狭槽；水沟；硬币投币口

sentences.english: Alan dropped another quarter into the slot on the pay phone.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦往付费电话的投币口里又塞了一枚 25 分的硬币。

sentences.english: He was slotting a CD into a CD player.
sentences.chinese: 他正把一张光盘放入光盘播放器中。

sentences.english: The car seat belt slotted into place easily.
sentences.chinese: 那个汽车安全带很容易就扣好了。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow hole in a surface, that you can put something into

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…放入狭长开口中； 把…纳入其中， 使有位置
detailed_translations.english: If you slot something into something else, or if it slots into it, you put it into a space where it fits

name: smash
trans: n. 破碎；扣球；冲突；大败

sentences.english: Vandals had smashed all the windows.
sentences.chinese: 破坏分子打碎了所有的窗子。

sentences.english: Firemen had to smash the lock to get in.
sentences.chinese: 消防员不得不砸锁而入。

sentences.english: Several cups fell to the floor and smashed to pieces .
sentences.chinese: 有几个杯子掉到地上摔得粉碎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粉碎，打烂；狠打，猛击；破灭，失败；猛撞，猛冲
detailed_translations.english: to break into pieces violently or noisily, or to make something do this by dropping, throwing, or hitting it

detailed_translations.chinese: 破碎 ； 猛击， 猛撞； 轰动的演出， 巨大的成功
detailed_translations.english: the loud sound of something breaking

name: snap
trans: n. 猛咬；劈啪声；突然折断

sentences.english: A twig snapped under my feet.
sentences.chinese: 一根细枝在我脚下嚓一声断开了。

sentences.english: The wind snapped branches and power lines.
sentences.chinese: 大风刮断了树枝和输电线。

detailed_translations.chinese: 咔嚓折断， 啪地绷断； 猛咬； 猛然断裂 <；吧嗒一声；厉声说话， 怒声责骂
detailed_translations.english: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this
a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion
to take a photograph
a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing

name: soak
trans: n. 浸；湿透；大雨

sentences.english: Soak the clothes in cold water.
sentences.chinese: 把衣服浸泡在冷水里。

sentences.english: Let the pans soak; I’ll wash them later.
sentences.chinese: 把锅泡着吧，我过一会儿再洗。

detailed_translations.english: if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean
if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean

name: soar
trans: n. 高飞；高涨

sentences.english: Her temperature soared.
sentences.chinese: 她的体温骤然升高。

sentences.english: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 最近几个星期汽油价格猛涨。

sentences.english: soaring unemployment
sentences.chinese: 急剧上升的失业率

detailed_translations.english: to increase quickly to a high level

name: socialist
trans: n. 社会主义者；社会党党员

sentences.english: Esperanto has always been popular among socialists.
sentences.chinese: 世界语在社会主义者中一直很受欢迎。

sentences.english: ...members of the ruling Socialist Party.
sentences.chinese: …执政的社会主义党成员。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes in socialism, or who is a member of a political party that supports socialism
based on socialism or relating to a political party that supports socialism

name: sole
trans: n. 鞋底；脚底；基础；鳎目鱼

sentences.english: the sole American in the room
sentences.chinese: 房间里唯一的美国人

sentences.english: Griffiths is the sole survivor of the crash.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思是此次撞车事故唯一的幸存者。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were caked in mud.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚掌上沾满了泥巴。

sentences.english: the soles of her shoes

detailed_translations.english: the sole person, thing etc is the only one
