name: solely
trans: adv. 单独地，唯一地

sentences.english: Scholarships are given solely on the basis of financial need.
sentences.chinese: 奖学金完全是根据经济需要发放的。

sentences.english: I shall hold you solely responsible for anything that goes wrong.
sentences.chinese: 出现任何差错的话，我唯你是问。

detailed_translations.english: not involving anything or anyone else

name: solicitor
trans: n. 律师；法务官；募捐者；掮客

sentences.english: You need to see a solicitor.
sentences.chinese: 你需要找个律师。

sentences.english: a small firm of solicitors
sentences.chinese: 一家小型律师事务所

detailed_translations.chinese: 律师；法务官；募捐者；掮客
detailed_translations.english: a type of lawyer in Britain who gives legal advice, prepares the necessary documents when property is bought or sold, and defends people, especially in the lower courts of law

name: solidarity
trans: n. 团结，团结一致

sentences.english: a gesture of solidarity
sentences.chinese: 团结的表示

sentences.english: an appeal for worker solidarity
sentences.chinese: 呼吁工人们团结

detailed_translations.english: loyalty and general agreement between all the people in a group, or between different groups, because they all have a shared aim

name: solo
trans: n. 独奏；独唱；独奏曲

sentences.english: a gorgeous piano solo
sentences.chinese: 一首极其美妙的钢琴独奏曲

sentences.english: He had just completed his final solo album.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚完成他最后一张个人专辑。

sentences.english: When did you first fly solo?
sentences.chinese: 你第一次单独飞行是什么时候？

sentences.english: a solo effort
sentences.chinese: 独自的努力

sentences.english: a solo album
sentences.chinese: 独唱专辑

detailed_translations.english: a piece of music for one performer
done alone without anyone else helping you

name: sound
trans: n. 声音，语音；噪音；海峡；吵闹；听力范围；[医] 探条

sentences.english: a sound understanding of money and banking systems
sentences.chinese: 对货币和银行业体制的透彻理解

sentences.english: a sound knowledge of English
sentences.chinese: 扎实的英语知识

sentences.english: He has sound grasp of European history.
sentences.chinese: 他对欧洲历史有着透彻的理解。

detailed_translations.english: complete and thorough

name: sovereignty
trans: n. 主权；主权国家；君主；独立国

sentences.english: the sovereignty of Parliament
sentences.chinese: 议会至高无上的权威

detailed_translations.chinese: 主权；主权国家；君主；独立国
detailed_translations.english: complete freedom and power to govern

name: spam
trans: v. 刷屏

name: span
trans: n. 跨度，跨距；范围

sentences.english: I worked with him over a span of six years.
sentences.chinese: 我和他共事达六年之久。

sentences.english: The bridge crosses the river in a single span.
sentences.chinese: 河上的桥为单跨桥。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that sth lasts or is able to continue

name: spare
trans: n. 剩余；备用零件

sentences.english: Sorry, I can’t spare the time.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我抽不出时间。

sentences.english: Have you got any spare boxes?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有多余的盒子？

sentences.english: You could sleep in the spare bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 你可以睡那间空着的客房。

sentences.english: Do you have any spare cash?
sentences.chinese: 你手头有闲钱吗？

sentences.english: I’ll go and see if there are any spare seats.
sentences.chinese: 我去看看是否还有空余的座位。

sentences.english: A decline in beer sales had left the industry with spare capacity (= the ability to produce more than can be sold ) .
sentences.chinese: 啤酒销售量的下降使该行业出现产能闲置。

detailed_translations.english: to make something such as time, money, or workers available for someone, especially when this is difficult for you to do
not being used or not needed at the present time

name: spark
trans: n. 火花；朝气；闪光

sentences.english: sparks from the fire
sentences.chinese: 火里飞出的火星

sentences.english: The scrape of metal on metal sent up a shower of sparks .
sentences.chinese: 金属之间互相摩擦，迸出一串火星。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together
a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together

name: specialized
trans: adj. 专业的；专门的

name: specification
trans: n. 规格；说明书；详述

sentences.english: The bolts met all the engineering specifications.
sentences.chinese: 这些螺栓符合所有的工程设计规格。

sentences.english: a specification of what role each member will play
sentences.chinese: 每名成员担当什么角色的具体说明

detailed_translations.english: a detailed instruction about how a car, building, piece of equipment etc should be made

name: specimen
trans: n. 样品，样本；标本

sentences.english: a blood specimen
sentences.chinese: 血样

detailed_translations.english: a small amount or piece that is taken from something, so that it can be tested or examined

name: spectacle
trans: n. 景象；场面；奇观；壮观；公开展示；表相，假相 n.（复）眼镜

sentences.english: a multimedia dance and opera spectacle
sentences.chinese: 盛大的多媒体舞蹈戏剧表演

sentences.english: The trial was turned into a public spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 审判变成了一场公开的闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: a very impressive show or scene

name: spectrum
trans: n. 光谱；频谱；范围；余象

sentences.english: The two articles here represent opposite ends of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

sentences.english: the electromagnetic spectrum
sentences.chinese: 电磁（波）谱

detailed_translations.english: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

name: spell
trans: n. 符咒；一段时间；魅力

sentences.english: How do you spell ‘juice’?
sentences.chinese: juice 怎么拼？

sentences.english: Pupils should know how to spell commonly used words.
sentences.chinese: 小学生应该知道常用词的拼法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拼，拼写；意味着；招致；拼成；迷住；轮值
detailed_translations.english: to form a word by writing or naming the letters in order
a piece of magic that someone does, or the special words or ceremonies used in doing it

name: sphere
trans: n. 范围；球体

sentences.english: Because the earth spins, it is not a perfect sphere.
sentences.chinese: 因为地球旋转，所以它不是个完完全全的球体。

detailed_translations.english: a ball shape

detailed_translations.chinese: 包围；放入球内；使…成球形

name: spin
trans: n. 旋转；疾驰

sentences.english: The plane’s propellers were spinning.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的螺旋桨在快速旋转。

sentences.english: She sat by the window spinning.
sentences.chinese: 她坐在窗前纺线。

sentences.english: the Earth’s spin
sentences.chinese: 机的螺旋桨在快速旋转。

detailed_translations.english: to turn around and around very quickly, or to make something do this
an act of turning around quickly

name: spine
trans: n. 脊柱，脊椎；刺；书脊

sentences.english: cactus spines
sentences.chinese: 仙人掌的刺

detailed_translations.chinese: 脊柱， 脊椎； 刺， 刺毛； 书脊
detailed_translations.english: the row of bones down the centre of your back that supports your body and protects your  spinal cord

name: spotlight
trans: n. 聚光灯；反光灯；公众注意的中心

sentences.english: The yard was lit by three huge spotlights.
sentences.chinese: 院子里亮着三盏巨大的聚光灯。

detailed_translations.english: a light with a very bright beam which can be directed at someone or something. Spotlights are often used to light a stage when actors or singers are performing
to shine a strong beam of light on something

name: spouse
trans: n. 配偶

sentences.english: Spouses were invited to the company picnic.
sentences.chinese: 配偶受到邀请参加公司的野餐会。

detailed_translations.english: a husband or wife

name: spy
trans: n. 间谍；密探

sentences.english: That day he spied on her while pretending to work on the shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 那天他假装修剪灌木，却秘密地监视着她。

detailed_translations.english: If you spy on someone, you watch them secretly
someone whose job is to find out secret information about another country, organization, or group
to suddenly see someone or something, especially after searching for them

name: squad
trans: n. 班；小队；五人组（篮球队的非正式说法）

sentences.english: a drill squad
sentences.chinese: 操练小队

detailed_translations.chinese: 班；小队；五人组（篮球队的非正式说法）
detailed_translations.english: a small group of soldiers working together as a unit

name: squeeze
trans: n. 压榨；紧握；拥挤；佣金

sentences.english: She smiled as he squeezed her hand.
sentences.chinese: 他捏了捏她的手，她笑了。

sentences.english: He squeezed the trigger, but nothing happened.
sentences.chinese: 他扣动扳机，但没有反应。

detailed_translations.english: to press something firmly together with your fingers or hand

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤； 握手； 拮据， 紧缺
detailed_translations.english: an act of pressing something firmly with your fingers or hand

name: stab
trans: n. 刺；戳；尝试；突发的一阵

sentences.english: He was stabbed to death in a fight.
sentences.chinese: 他在一次打斗中被捅死了。

detailed_translations.english: to push a knife into someone or something
an act of stabbing or trying to stab someone with a knife

name: stability
trans: n. 稳定性；坚定，恒心

sentences.english: a period of relative stability
sentences.chinese: 相对稳定的一段时期

detailed_translations.english: the condition of being steady and not changing

name: stabilize
trans: vt. 使稳固，使安定

sentences.english: The patient’s condition has now stabilized.
sentences.chinese: 病人的情况现已稳定下来了。

sentences.english: an attempt to stabilize the economy
sentences.chinese: 稳定经济的努力

detailed_translations.english: to become firm, steady, or unchanging, or to make something firm or steady

name: stake
trans: n. 桩，棍子；赌注；火刑；奖金

sentences.english: They have to win the contract – thousands of jobs are at stake.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须拿下这份合同，这关系到数千个工作岗位。

sentences.english: National pride is at stake in next week’s game against England.
sentences.chinese: 下星期对英格兰队的比赛关乎民族尊严。

detailed_translations.english: if something that you value very much is at stake, you will lose it if a plan or action is not successful

name: standing
trans: n. 站立；持续；身分

sentences.english: You have to pay standing charges whether or not you use the service.
sentences.chinese: 无论是否使用这项服务，你都必须一直付费。

sentences.english: A standing committee was established to coordinate the army and navy.
sentences.chinese: 成立了常务委员会以协调陆军和海军。

detailed_translations.english: permanently agreed or arranged

detailed_translations.chinese: 站立；坚持不变；坐落于（stand的ing形式）

name: stark
trans: adj. 完全的；荒凉的；刻板的；光秃秃的；朴实的

sentences.english: In the cold dawn light, the castle looked stark and forbidding.
sentences.chinese: 在寒冷的曙光中，城堡看上去了无生气，令人生畏。

sentences.english: the stark beauty of New Mexico
sentences.chinese: 新墨西哥州的荒凉之美

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全的；荒凉的；刻板的；光秃秃的；朴实的
detailed_translations.english: very plain in appearance, with little or no colour or decoration

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全；明显地；突出地；质朴地
detailed_translations.english: completely crazy

detailed_translations.chinese: (Stark)人名；(俄、罗)斯塔尔克；(英、芬、法、瑞典)斯塔克；(德)施塔克

name: statistical
trans: adj. 统计的；统计学的

sentences.english: The report contains a great deal of statistical information.
sentences.chinese: 该报告包含大量统计资料。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the use of statistics

name: steer
trans: vt. 控制，引导；驾驶

sentences.english: He was steering with only one hand.
sentences.chinese: 他只用一只手在驾驶。

detailed_translations.english: to control the direction a vehicle is going, for example by turning a wheel

name: stem
trans: n. 干；茎；船首；血统

sentences.english: ‘Writ ’ is the stem of the forms ‘writes ’, ‘writing ’ and ‘written ’.
sentences.chinese: writ是writes、writing和written三个词的词干。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a word that stays the same when different endings are added to it, for example ‘driv-’ in ‘driving’

name: stereotype
trans: n. 陈腔滥调，老套；铅版

sentences.english: There's always been a stereotype about successful businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 对成功的商人们总有一种成见。

detailed_translations.english: a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like. Stereotypes are often unfair or untrue.

name: stimulus
trans: n. 刺激；激励；刺激物

sentences.english: Tax cuts provided the stimulus which the slow economy needed.
sentences.chinese: 减税为不景气的经济带来了其所需的刺激。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps a process to develop more quickly or more strongly

name: stir
trans: n. 搅拌；轰动

sentences.english: Give that pan a stir , will you?
sentences.chinese: 把那锅东西搅一搅，好吗？

detailed_translations.english: an act of stirring something
to move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together

name: storage
trans: n. 存储；仓库；贮藏所

sentences.english: the storage of highly radioactive material
sentences.chinese: 高放射性材料的存放

sentences.english: storage costs
sentences.chinese: 保管费用

detailed_translations.english: the process of keeping or putting something in a special place while it is not being used

name: straightforward
trans: adj. 简单的；坦率的；明确的；径直的

sentences.english: In this example, we will use the most straightforward method of all -- writing our object reference to a file that will be picked up by our client.
sentences.chinese: 在这个示例中，我们将使用所有方法中最直截了当的一种 — 将对象引用写入一个文件，该 文件将由客户机选取。

name: strain
trans: n. 张力；拉紧；负担；扭伤；血缘

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

name: strand
trans: n. 线；串；海滨

sentences.english: She tried to blow a grey strand of hair from her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她试图吹开眼前的一缕白发。

sentences.english: The climbers had been stranded by a storm.
sentences.chinese: 这些登山者被暴风雨困住了。

detailed_translations.english: a single thin piece of thread, wire, hair etc
If you are stranded, you are prevented from leaving a place, for example because of bad weather

name: strategic
trans: adj. 战略上的，战略的

sentences.english: UN forces made a strategic withdrawal.
sentences.chinese: 联合国部队作了战略性撤退。

sentences.english: strategic planning meetings
sentences.chinese: 战略计划会议

sentences.english: a strategic decision to move production to Hungary
sentences.chinese: 把生产转至匈牙利的战略决定

detailed_translations.english: done as part of a plan, especially in a military, business, or political situation

name: striking
trans: v. 打（strike的ing形式）

sentences.english: a striking contrast between wealth and poverty
sentences.chinese: 显著的贫富差异

sentences.english: The most striking feature of those statistics is the high proportion of suicides.
sentences.chinese: 那些统计数据最显著的特征是高自杀率。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or interesting enough to be easily noticed

name: strip
trans: n. 带；条状；脱衣舞

sentences.english: Strip the beds and wash the sheets.
sentences.chinese: 把床单撤下来清洗。

sentences.english: a strip of paper
sentences.chinese: 一张纸条

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is covering the surface of something else
a long narrow piece of paper, cloth etc

name: strive
trans: vi. 努力；奋斗；抗争

sentences.english: I was still striving to be successful.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在努力争取成功。

sentences.english: We must continue to strive for greater efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须继续为提高效率而努力。

detailed_translations.english: to make a great effort to achieve something

name: structural
trans: adj. 结构的；建筑的

sentences.english: structural changes in the computer industry
sentences.chinese: 电脑行业的结构性改变

sentences.english: The earthquake caused minor structural damage.
sentences.chinese: 这次地震造成了轻微的结构破坏。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the structure of something

name: stumble
trans: n. 绊倒；蹒跚而行

sentences.english: In her hurry, she stumbled and spilled the milk all over the floor.
sentences.chinese: 匆忙中她绊了一下，把牛奶洒得满地都是。

sentences.english: I make it into the darkness with only one stumble.
sentences.chinese: 我只踉跄了一下就把它弄进了黑暗中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跌， 绊；结结巴巴地说话
detailed_translations.english: to hit your foot against something or put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running, so that you almost fall
Stumble is also a noun

name: stun
trans: n. 昏迷；打昏；惊倒；令人惊叹的事物

sentences.english: Redfern stunned the crowd with a last-minute goal.
sentences.chinese: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球，使观众很是震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使震惊， 使目瞪口呆； 把…打昏， 使昏迷
detailed_translations.english: to surprise or upset someone so much that they do not react immediately

name: submission
trans: n. 投降；提交（物）；服从；（向法官提出的）意见；谦恭

sentences.english: The deadline for the submission of proposals is May 1st.
sentences.chinese: 呈交提案的最后期限是 5 月 1 日。

sentences.english: Plans were drawn up for submission to the housing council.
sentences.chinese: 计划已起草，要提交给住房委员会。

sentences.english: Submissions will not be accepted after May.
sentences.chinese: 过了5月再提交将不予接受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投降；提交（物）；服从；（向法官提出的）意见；谦恭
detailed_translations.english: when you give or show something to someone in authority, for them to consider or approve

name: subscriber
trans: n. 订户；签署者；捐献者

name: subscription
trans: n. 捐献；订阅；订金；签署

sentences.english: You may cancel your subscription at any time.
sentences.chinese: 你随时可以取消订阅。

sentences.english: I’ve decided not to renew my subscription .
sentences.chinese: 我决定不再续订了。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money you pay, usually once a year, to receive copies of a newspaper or magazine, or receive a service, or the act of paying money for this

name: subsidy
trans: n. 补贴；津贴；补助金

sentences.english: European farmers are planning a massive demonstration against farm subsidy cuts.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的农场主们正在策划一场反对削减农场补贴的大游行。

detailed_translations.english: money that is paid by a government or organization to make prices lower, reduce the cost of producing goods etc

name: substantial
trans: n. 本质；重要材料

sentences.english: We have the support of a substantial number of parents.
sentences.chinese: 我们有相当多家长的支持。

sentences.english: a substantial salary
sentences.chinese: 丰厚的薪水

sentences.english: a substantial breakfast
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的早餐

sentences.english: The document requires substantial changes.
sentences.chinese: 文件需要作大量修改。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可观的， 大量的； 物质的， 坚固的； 实质的， 真实的
detailed_translations.english: large in amount or number

name: substantially
trans: adv. 实质上；大体上；充分地

sentences.english: There are one or two minor differences, but they’re substantially the same text.
sentences.chinese: 这些文本有一两处细微差异，但大体上是一样的。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that in many ways something is true, the same, different etc

name: substitute
trans: n. 代用品；代替者

sentences.english: Germany brought on a substitute at half time.
sentences.chinese: 德国队在比赛半场时换上一名替补队员。

sentences.english: substitute goalkeeper
sentences.chinese: 替补守门员

detailed_translations.english: someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time, especially in a sports team or school
to use something new or diffe-rent instead of something else

name: substitution
trans: n. 代替；[数] 置换；代替物

sentences.english: Coach Ross made two substitutions in the second half.
sentences.chinese: 罗斯教练在下半场两次换人。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose

name: utterly
trans: adv. 完全地；绝对地；全然地；彻底地，十足地

sentences.english: You look utterly miserable.
sentences.chinese: 你看起来很痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: completely – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong

name: vacuum
trans: n. 真空；空间；真空吸尘器

sentences.english: I vacuumed the carpets today.
sentences.chinese: 我今天用吸尘器清洁地毯了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 收集； 用真空吸尘器打扫
detailed_translations.english: to clean using a vacuum cleaner
a space that is completely empty of all gas, especially one from which all the air has been taken away

name: vague
trans: adj. 模糊的；含糊的；不明确的；暧昧的

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

name: validity
trans: n. [计] 有效性；正确；正确性

sentences.english: So that satisfies the definition of validity.
sentences.chinese: 所以这满足了有效性的定义。

sentences.english: Does this argument satisfy the definition of validity or does it not?
sentences.chinese: 这个论点满足有效性的定义吗？,还是不满足？

sentences.english: While each of these might have some validity, in many cases the same general comments may also apply to many of the other projects you work on.
sentences.chinese: 尽管其中每个问题可能具有某些正确性，但是在许多情况下，一般性评论还可能适用于您从事的其他项目。

name: vanish
trans: n. 弱化音

sentences.english: My keys were here a minute ago but now they’ve vanished.
sentences.chinese: 我的钥匙刚刚还在这里，现在却不翼而飞了。

sentences.english: The bird vanished from sight.
sentences.chinese: 那只鸟从视线中消失了。

sentences.english: She seemed to have just vanished into thin air (= suddenly disappeared in a very mysterious way ).
sentences.chinese: 她好像就蒸发了似的。

detailed_translations.english: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained

name: variable
trans: n. [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素

sentences.english: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

name: varied
trans: v. 改变；使多样化（vary的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: a varied diet
sentences.chinese: 丰富多样的饮食

sentences.english: The responsibilities of government are many, and they are varied.
sentences.chinese: 政府有很多职责，而且各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of or including many different kinds of things or people, especially in a way that seems interesting

name: vein
trans: n. 血管；叶脉；[地质] 岩脉；纹理；翅脉；性情

sentences.english: the pulmonary vein
sentences.chinese: 肺静脉

sentences.english: She felt the blood racing through her veins as they kissed.
sentences.chinese: 他们接吻时她觉得热血沸腾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血管；叶脉；[地质] 岩脉；纹理；翅脉；性情
detailed_translations.english: one of the tubes which carries blood to your heart from other parts of your body

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成脉络；象脉络般分布于

name: venture
trans: n. 企业；风险；冒险

sentences.english: business/commercial venture
sentences.chinese: 商业风投

sentences.english: When darkness fell, he would venture out.
sentences.chinese: 天黑以后，他就会壮着胆子出去。

detailed_translations.english: a new business activity that involves taking risks
to go somewhere that could be dangerous

name: verbal
trans: n. 动词的非谓语形式

sentences.english: verbal skills
sentences.chinese: 语言技能

detailed_translations.chinese: 口头的； 用言辞的， 用文字的； 动词的
detailed_translations.english: spoken rather than written

name: verdict
trans: n. 结论；裁定

sentences.english: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
sentences.chinese: 裁决为“无罪”。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

name: verify
trans: vt. 核实；查证

sentences.english: I verified the source from which I had that information.
sentences.chinese: 我核实了我获知那条信息的来源。

sentences.english: His statement was verified by several witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他的说法得到了几位证人的证实。

detailed_translations.english: to discover whether something is correct or true

name: verse
trans: n. 诗，诗篇；韵文；诗节

sentences.english: Let’s sing the last verse again.
sentences.chinese: 我们把最后一节再唱一遍吧。

sentences.english: Learn the first two verses of the poem by heart.
sentences.chinese: 把这首诗的头两节背下来。

sentences.english: Genesis chapter 3, verse 13
sentences.chinese: 《创世记》第3章第13节

detailed_translations.english: a set of lines that forms one part of a song, poem, or a book such as the Bible or the Koran

name: versus
trans: prep. 对；与...相对；对抗

sentences.english: the New York Knicks versus the LA Lakers
sentences.chinese: 纽约尼克斯队对洛杉矶湖人队

sentences.english: the Supreme Court decision in Roe vs. Wade
sentences.chinese: 最高法院关于罗诉韦德案的判决

detailed_translations.english: used to show that two people or teams are competing against each other in a game or court case

name: vessel
trans: n. 船，舰；[组织] 脉管，血管；容器，器皿

sentences.english: a fishing vessel
sentences.chinese: 渔船

sentences.english: a burst blood vessel
sentences.chinese: 破裂的血管

sentences.english: a Bronze Age drinking vessel
sentences.chinese: 青铜器时代的饮具

detailed_translations.english: a ship or large boat

name: veteran
trans: n. 老兵；老手；富有经验的人；老运动员

sentences.english: He is a veteran of the last revolution in medical technology, gene therapy, which, after some hyped expectations in the 1990s, fell into disfavor after some unsuccessful trials.
sentences.chinese: 他是基因治疗这项最新医学技术的老手，经过了1990年代的兴奋期和之后几次失败的实验后，基因治疗技术已经失宠了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

name: viable
trans: adj. 可行的；能养活的；能生育的

sentences.english: viable seeds
sentences.chinese: 可存活的种子

detailed_translations.chinese: 可行的；能养活的；能生育的
detailed_translations.english: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully

name: vibrant
trans: adj. 振动的；充满生气的；响亮的；战栗的

sentences.english: a painting full of vibrant reds and blues
sentences.chinese: 满是鲜亮的红色和蓝色的画作

detailed_translations.chinese: 振动的；充满生气的；响亮的；战栗的
detailed_translations.english: a vibrant colour is bright and strong

name: vice
trans: prep. 代替

sentences.english: Smoking is my only vice.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟是我唯一的恶习。

detailed_translations.english: a bad habit

name: vicious
trans: adj. 恶毒的；恶意的；堕落的；有错误的；品性不端的；剧烈的

sentences.english: Sarah can be quite vicious at times.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉有时相当狠毒。

sentences.english: a vicious personal attack on the Duchess
sentences.chinese: 对公爵夫人恶毒的人身攻击

sentences.english: She was shocked by the vicious tone in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 她对他恶毒的语气感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: very unkind in a way that is intended to hurt someone’s feelings or make their character seem bad

name: villager
trans: n. 乡村居民，村民

sentences.english: Soon the villagers couldn't afford to buy food for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 很快村民们就买不起吃的东西了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a village

name: violate
trans: vt. 违反；侵犯，妨碍；亵渎

sentences.english: 34 protesters were arrested for violating criminal law.
sentences.chinese: 34名抗议者因违反刑法而被逮捕。

sentences.english: regimes that violate human rights
sentences.chinese: 侵犯人权的政权

detailed_translations.english: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc

name: violation
trans: n. 违反；妨碍，侵害；违背；强奸

sentences.english: human rights violations
sentences.chinese: 违反人权

detailed_translations.chinese: 违反；妨碍，侵害；违背；强奸
detailed_translations.english: an action that breaks a law, agreement, principle etc

name: virtue
trans: n. 美德；优点；贞操；功效

sentences.english: Women have often been used as symbols of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 女性常被用作美德的象征。

sentences.english: Wilkins is now extolling the virtues of organic farming.
sentences.chinese: 威尔金斯现在盛赞有机耕作的好处。

detailed_translations.english: moral goodness of character and behaviour

name: vocal
trans: adj. 直言不讳的

sentences.english: vocal music
sentences.chinese: 声乐

sentences.english: Allison’s vocal style is influenced by country and blues music.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森的演唱风格受到乡村音乐和布鲁斯音乐的影响。

sentences.english: a female vocal group
sentences.chinese: 女子歌唱组合

detailed_translations.chinese: 喜欢畅所欲言的，直言不讳的；嗓音的，发声的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the voice or to singing
the part of a piece of music that is sung rather than played on an instrument

name: vow
trans: n. 发誓；誓言；许愿

sentences.english: Jim made a vow that he would find his wife’s killer.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆发誓要找到杀害他妻子的凶手。

sentences.english: While many models vow to go back to college, few do.
sentences.chinese: 很多模特儿发誓要重返大学，但几乎无人做到。

sentences.english: I solemnly vowed that someday I would return to live in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 我郑重起誓总有一天我要重回欧洲生活。

detailed_translations.english: a serious promise
If you vow to do something, you make a serious promise or decision that you will do it

name: vulnerability
trans: n. 易损性；弱点

sentences.english: Now that we know the basis of an attack, what can we do to protect ourselves from this vulnerability?
sentences.chinese: 既然我们知道了攻击的基本知识，那么做些什么才能保护我们自己避免这一脆弱性呢？

sentences.english: But you also notice the sense of limitation and the vulnerability associated with the physical state of virginity here.
sentences.chinese: 但是你们也要注意到限制和弱点的意义所在,那是与身体的贞节状态相联系的。

sentences.english: This points to another vulnerability.
sentences.chinese: 这指的是另一弱点。

name: vulnerable
trans: adj. 易受攻击的，易受…的攻击；易受伤害的；有弱点的

sentences.english: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.english: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的, 易受影响的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt

name: ward
trans: n. 病房；保卫；监视

sentences.english: the other patients in the ward
sentences.chinese: 病房里的其他病人

detailed_translations.english: a large room in a hospital where people who need medical treatment stay

name: warehouse
trans: n. 仓库；货栈；大商店

sentences.english: The building opposite us is the warehouse.
sentences.chinese: 我们对面的那个建筑是仓库。

sentences.english: Each warehouse reports back to the retailer which portion (if any) of the customer order it was able to fulfil.
sentences.chinese: 每个仓库把它能完成客户定单的哪个部分（如果有）的报告返回给零售商。

sentences.english: This option allows organizations to pay only for the volume of compressed user data they manage in their warehouse.
sentences.chinese: 该定价方式允许组织只为他们在其仓库中管理的压缩的用户数据量进行付费。

detailed_translations.english: a large building for storing large quantities of goods

name: warfare
trans: n. 战争；冲突

sentences.english: the realities of modern warfare
sentences.chinese: 现代战争的真实面貌

detailed_translations.english: the activity of fighting in a war – used especially when talking about particular methods of fighting

name: warrant
trans: n. 根据；证明；正当理由；委任状

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important to note that individual situations may warrant including additional characters in the list of special characters.
sentences.chinese: 因此，要注意可能保证把额外字符包括到特殊字符列表中的个别情况，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: Learning incessantly is the surest way to keep pace with the times in the information age and an infallible warrant of success in times of uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: 持续的学习是在资讯时代中跟时代并驾齐驱的最稳当的方法，也是在变动的世代中成功的可靠保证。

sentences.english: At Dean Miller's suggestion, I have allowed her to give the current student organizers the opportunity to propose a program for next semester that might warrant continuation of this event on campus.
sentences.chinese: 根据米勒学监的建议，我允许她给学生机会，让他们给下学期的活动提出一个方案，保证这个活动得以在校园内继续开展。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that something is true

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当理由；许可证，委任状
detailed_translations.english: a legal document that is signed by a judge, allowing the police to take a particular action

name: warrior
trans: n. 战士，勇士；鼓吹战争的人

sentences.english: a noble warrior
sentences.chinese: 忠勇的战士

detailed_translations.chinese: 战士，勇士；鼓吹战争的人
detailed_translations.english: a soldier or fighter who is brave and experienced – used about people in the past

name: weaken
trans: vt. 减少；使变弱；使变淡

sentences.english: Over the last two years the president’s position has weakened.
sentences.chinese: 过去两年来，总统的地位被削弱了。

sentences.english: Changes in policy have weakened the power of the trade unions.
sentences.chinese: 政策的变化削弱了工会的力量。

sentences.english: The absence of this witness has weakened the case against the accused.
sentences.chinese: 这名证人的缺席削弱了对被告的指控力度。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something less powerful or less important, or to become less powerful
to make someone or something less powerful or less important, or to become less powerful

name: weave
trans: vi. 纺织；编成；迂回行进

sentences.english: hand-woven scarves
sentences.chinese: 手织围巾

sentences.english: Only a few of the women still weave.
sentences.chinese: 只有数量很少的妇女还在编织。

sentences.english: traditional basket weaving
sentences.chinese: 传统的编篮技术

detailed_translations.chinese: 迂回行进；编织；编造，编纂
detailed_translations.english: to make cloth, a carpet, a basket etc by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom
the way in which a material is woven, and the pattern formed by this

name: weed
trans: n. 杂草，野草；菸草

sentences.english: the constant battle against weeds
sentences.chinese: 对付杂草的长期斗争

sentences.english: I've been weeding the flower beds.
sentences.chinese: 我一直在除花坛里的杂草。

detailed_translations.english: a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly
to remove unwanted plants from a garden or other place

name: well
trans: n. 井；源泉

sentences.english: Did you sleep well?
sentences.chinese: 你睡得好吗？

sentences.english: James reads quite well for his age.
sentences.chinese: 就詹姆斯的年龄来说，他的阅读能力算不错了。

sentences.english: All the team played very well today.
sentences.chinese: 今天所有队员都打得很不错。

sentences.english: Simon doesn’t work well under pressure.
sentences.chinese: 有压力时西蒙的工作表现就不好。

sentences.english: The festival was very well organized.
sentences.chinese: 节庆活动组织得很好。

sentences.english: The concert went very well.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会进行得非常顺利。

detailed_translations.chinese: 很好地；充分地；满意地；适当地
detailed_translations.english: in a successful or satisfactory way
healthy

name: well-being
trans: n. 幸福；康乐

sentences.english: Singing can create a sense of well-being.
sentences.chinese: 唱歌能产生一种幸福感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 健康， 幸福； 福利
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being comfortable, healthy, and happy

name: whatever
trans: conj. 无论什么

sentences.english: She has shown no interest whatever in anything scientific.
sentences.chinese: 凡是与科学有关的她都没有表现出任何兴趣。

sentences.english: This is just a stupid argument that has nothing whatever to do with your job.
sentences.chinese: 这只是一场无聊的争论，和你的工作没有任何关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: [用于否定句中以加强语气]任何； 无论什么
detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize a negative statement

name: whatsoever
trans: pron. 无论什么

sentences.english: But there should be no Christmas for me, I knew, no gifts, no remembrance whatsoever.
sentences.chinese: 但我知道，对我来说，将没有圣诞节可言，没有礼物，没有怀念，什么都没有。

name: whereby
trans: adv. 凭借；通过…；借以；与…一致

sentences.english: a proposal whereby EU citizens would be allowed to reside anywhere in the EU
sentences.chinese: 允许欧盟公民在欧盟任何地方居住的一项提议

detailed_translations.english: by means of which or according to which

name: whilst
trans: conj. 同时；时时，有时；当…的时候

sentences.english: As you lower your pen whilst continuing the motion, you should notice the resulting shape is more regular than it otherwise would have been.
sentences.chinese: 随着你降低你的笔，同时保持圆周运动，你应该会注意到画出的形状比起不这样做画出的形状要规范的多。

sentences.english: Indeed, it is important to keep fit and healthy, whilst we all aspire to improve the way we look and feel in order to make good first and lasting impressions.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，为了得到一个良好的初次印象和持续印象，在保持体形和健康的同时，我们也渴望提高自己看待和感受他人的方式。

sentences.english: Modules participate in a dynamic life cycle which includes the ability to add, update and remove modules at runtime, whilst preserving the state in the system.
sentences.chinese: 模块参与到动态的生命周期里，这个动态的生命周期能够在运行时添加、更新、删除模块，同时保留系统中的状态。

name: whip
trans: n. 鞭子；抽打；车夫；[机] 搅拌器

sentences.english: He whipped the horse into a canter.
sentences.chinese: 他抽了一下鞭子，马儿就小跑起来。

sentences.english: The coachman cracked his whip and the carriage lurched forward.
sentences.chinese: 马车夫甩了一记响鞭，马车猛然向前冲去。

detailed_translations.english: to hit someone or something with a whip
a long thin piece of rope or leather with a handle, that you hit animals with to make them move or that you hit someone with to punish them

name: wholly
trans: adv. 完全地；全部；统统

sentences.english: a wholly satisfactory solution
sentences.chinese: 完全令人满意的解决办法

sentences.english: The report claimed that the disaster was wholly unavoidable.
sentences.chinese: 报告称这场灾难完全无法避免。

detailed_translations.english: completely

name: widen
trans: vt. 放宽

sentences.english: They’re widening the road.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在拓宽马路。

sentences.english: The river widens and splits.
sentences.chinese: 这条河有变宽的河段，也有分流的河段。

detailed_translations.english: to become wider, or to make something wider
to become wider, or to make something wider

name: widow
trans: n. 寡妇；孀妇

sentences.english: The sorrowful widow begged for mercy.
sentences.chinese: 伤心的寡妇乞怜。

sentences.english: Tony hobnobbed with an attractive widow when he lived in Metz.
sentences.chinese: 托尼在梅斯居住期间曾与一名漂亮的寡妇交往甚密。

sentences.english: "I tell you the truth," he said, "this poor widow has put in more than all the others.
sentences.chinese: “我实话告诉你”，耶稣说道，“这个贫穷的寡妇放入的比其他人的都多。

detailed_translations.english: a woman whose husband has died and who has not married again

name: width
trans: n. 宽度；广度

sentences.english: a covered terrace extending the full width of the house
sentences.chinese: 和房子同宽的有顶露台

detailed_translations.english: the distance from one side of something to the other

name: willingness
trans: n. 乐意；心甘情愿；自动自发

sentences.english: So we do believe we have improved the willingness of our people for our acceptance in the future.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们确实认为，我们已经使群众发生变化，愿意将来接受我们的领导。

sentences.english: But when we focus on God and His ability and willingness to help us in every way -- all our excuses become insignificant.
sentences.chinese: 但是当我们聚焦在神时，他的能力和意愿会用任何方法去帮助我们---我们所有的借口都变得毫无意义。

sentences.english: That provides a measure of willingness to punish, even at a cost to the punisher.
sentences.chinese: 这提供了一个对惩罚的愿意程度的衡量手段，即使惩罚有代价。

name: wipe
trans: n. 擦拭；用力打

sentences.english: I'll just wipe the table.
sentences.chinese: 我只擦擦桌子。

detailed_translations.english: to remove liquid, dirt, or marks by wiping
a wiping movement with a cloth

name: wit
trans: n. 智慧；才智；智力

sentences.english: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
sentences.chinese: 信息是现成的，等着有头脑的人去获取和利用。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation
that is to say; namely (used to introduce statements, as in legal documents)

name: withdrawal
trans: n. 撤退，收回；提款；取消；退股

sentences.english: large-scale troop withdrawals
sentences.chinese: 大规模撤军

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤退，收回；提款；取消；退股
detailed_translations.english: the act of moving an army, weapons etc away from the area where they were fighting

name: workout
trans: n. 锻炼；练习；试验

name: worship
trans: n. 崇拜；礼拜；尊敬

sentences.english: The ceremony must take place in a recognized place of worship.
sentences.chinese: 该仪式必须在获得认可的敬拜场所举行。

sentences.english: He absolutely worships her.
sentences.chinese: 他太崇拜她了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼拜；崇拜；崇拜: 爱慕：崇敬
detailed_translations.english: the activity of praying or singing in a religious building in order to show respect and love for a god
to admire and love someone very much

name: worthwhile
trans: adj. 值得做的，值得花时间的

sentences.english: He wanted to do a worthwhile job.
sentences.chinese: 他想做有意义的工作。

sentences.english: We decided to give the money to a worthwhile cause (= one that helps people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定把这笔钱投入到慈善事业中。

detailed_translations.english: if something is worthwhile, it is important or useful, or you gain something from it

name: worthy
trans: n. 杰出人物；知名人士

sentences.english: Leeds United were worthy winners of the competition.
sentences.chinese: 利兹联队是比赛当之无愧的获胜者。

sentences.english: a worthy opponent
sentences.chinese: 值得钦佩的对手

sentences.english: A couple of other books are worthy of mention.
sentences.chinese: 还有一些其他的书值得一提

detailed_translations.english: deserving respect from people

name: yell
trans: n. 喊声，叫声

sentences.english: ‘Help me!’ she yelled hysterically.
sentences.chinese: “救救我！”她歇斯底里地大叫。

sentences.english: I yelled out, ‘Here I am!’
sentences.chinese: 我大声喊道:“我在这儿！”

sentences.english: The crowd are on their feet yelling.
sentences.chinese: 观众站着高声呐喊。

sentences.english: He could hear Pete yelling at the top of his voice (= very loudly ).
sentences.chinese: 他听到皮特声嘶力竭地在喊叫。

detailed_translations.english: to shout or say something very loudly, especially because you are frightened, angry, or excited
a loud shout

name: yield
trans: n. 产量；收益

sentences.english: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近我们的研究才开始取得重要成果。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information

name: youngster
trans: n. 年轻人；少年

sentences.english: Other youngsters are not so lucky.
sentences.chinese: 其他的年轻人没有这么幸运。

detailed_translations.english: a child or young person
